Full Job Description
We are currently seeking a candidate to fill the following internship during the 2021-2022 season.
Title: Information Technology Intern
Paid Internship: $8.00/Hour
Reports to: Information Technology Service Desk Manager

Education:
Bachelor’s degree (or in pursuit of) from four-year accredited college or university with a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology (“IT”), Computer Engineering or related field preferred.
Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology/ Computer Engineering or related field preferred.
Previous work experience in IT not required, but a plus.
Basic Function: Shadow IT personnel and assist in providing technical support and consultation to system users on matters relating to software, hardware, network, mobile device and telecom at multiple office locations.

Skills Required:
Strong knowledge of PC hardware, Microsoft operation systems and Office suite of software applications.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory, Windows Server and Exchange. Working knowledge of data networks.
Ability to troubleshoot and to apply strong problem-solving skills in resolving issues at the end user level, including analysis and resolution of software applications issues (i.e., evaluate whether a program meets user needs, and if not, make appropriate recommendations; hardware issues and network issues).
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills and the ability to develop solid working relationships at all levels across the organization.
Excellent attention to detail and an ability to produce high-quality, accurate work under pressure and within designated deadlines.
Effective verbal, written and interpersonal communications.
Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a high-energy environment.
Ability to support a 24/7 work environment in providing services to Houston Texans (“Club”) and be willing to work rotating schedules during the Club’s football season.
Ability to maintain confidential and/or proprietary information.
Ability and internal drive to demonstrate a winning attitude and a strong work ethic in the performance of all job responsibilities.

Job Function (duties and responsibilities):
Create a positive client support experience and build strong relationships by analyzing and resolving problems and issues in a timely and responsive manner, communicating promptly on progress, and interacting with Club employees with a consummately professional attitude.
Apply knowledge and experience to understand, analyze and resolve problems and issues with software, hardware and information system procedures, resolve or escalate technical issues as necessary to achieve timely problem resolution, provide consultation and implement effective solutions.
Assist in the setup and deployment of PC and/or laptop equipment for new employees using standard hardware images and software via Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM).
Participate in the overall service delivery process (Information Technology Infrastructure Library and IT Service Management (“ITIL/ITSM”)).
Investigate and resolve software and hardware incidents (e.g., MS Office suite, operating systems, graphics, printing, email, mobile devices, VPN, web browser, etc.).
Document problem analysis, communication and resolution in ServiceNow, the ITIL/ITSM service desk tracking application.
Maintain an updated inventory of service desk related assets such as PC hardware, software, mobile devices, printers and scanners, and conduct semi-annual physical equipment audits.
Modify configurations, utilities, software settings, etc., for workstations as required.
Remain current on all state-of-the art technical equipment and best practices in the information systems industry through self-paced learning, training courses and technical conferences.
Perform various other tasks as may be assigned from time to time by the Service Desk Manager and/or Vice President, Information Technology.
Job responsibilities are to be physically performed in the Club or on a remote basis during business hours or after hours (i.e., from another office location or from home or elsewhere), as determined by the particular situation and with supervisor approval.

Travel Requirements: Possible domestic travel to pre-season and regular season games as assigned.

Please note that while resumes of all candidates will be considered, as a way for the Texans organization to acknowledge and reciprocate the tremendous support given the Team by local fans and the local community in general, qualified candidates with permanent addresses in the Houston metropolitan and surrounding areas will be given first consideration whenever possible.

If your skills and experience match our available position requirements, a Human Resources representative will contact you directly. Due to the volume of resumes received by the Houston Texans, we are unable to provide updates on the status of individual applications.

The Houston Texans organization is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Overview:
Vectrus strives to bring high performance, operational excellence, and customer focus to every aspect of our business. In a rapidly changing and complex world, we continue to push to be a top innovator and achiever in the software development field and are proud to serve in our country's defense. We're seeking dedicated innovators and achievers to help us expand on our mission to provide high quality software solutions in the areas of RF modeling/simulation, spectrum sharing, and interference deconfliction applications. As either a Entry Level Software Engineer or an Engineering Intern at Vectrus, you will be provided the opportunity to learn from our professional software development team while you provide support to multiple DoD Program Offices as well as our commercial customers. You will work alongside our software development team to develop full software applications, RF modeling applications, quick-response custom tailored software applications, and many other related software engineering tasks.

Responsibilities:
Major Job Activities:
  • Work as part of an agile software development team to implement multi-user database-driven RF spectrum deconfliction and related software applications for our customers.
  • Design/develop/modify software.
  • Profile tools and improve performance as required.
  • Write and review software documentation.
  • Coordinate with team members to ensure problem resolution, appropriate risk reduction, and user satisfaction.
  • Work with our team to conduct software engineering best practices, such as code reviews, unit testing, and software static analysis. Be able to implement new software development process metrics as required by our customers.
Material & Equipment Directly Used:
Real-Time Spectrum Analyzers (RSA), Signal Generators, servers, and basic computers.

Working Environment:
Work will be performed in an office environment approximately 90% of the time. Some laboratory work may be required. Local travel is required with the possibility of regional and international travel roughly 5 to 10% of the time.

Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications:
Education/Experience/Certifications:
Associates (2) year degree or in pursuit of a Bachelor’s (4 year) degree from an accredited College or University in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Programming, or related field with:
  • Experience preparing technical documents, test plans/reports, analytical evaluations, and presentations.
  • Ability to obtain a SECRET Security Clearance.
  • Must be a U.S Citizen.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Past experience in with software development
  • Past experience performing RF modeling and simulation.

Full Job Description

Website Application Developer Intern

We are currently looking for enthusiastic and skilled Website Application Developer Interns to join our Product development department and provide creative ideas and development work to help achieve specific aviation product goals. We currently build software for the aviation industry on both the B2B and B2C consumer categories. Someone who is also looking for an opportunity to find a good fit with our company, and is seeking an opportunity to be converted into a full-time employee.

You will also be working as a full-stack website application developer in our Product development department and closely with the marketing and design departments and times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the designing of the company's various software products. You will gain real hands-on working with many aspects of the product on the front-end and back-end.

We are looking for someone who is very positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”.

You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, maintain clean, and clever Mean Stack codes
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of web applications
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
  • Work with the company's AI department and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the company’s web applications
  • Apply understandings of web and mobile web app (Mean Stack)
  • Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the web applications
  • You will spend a lot of your time building web apps, efficiently coding in Mean Stack. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes
  • Work with the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools
  • Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management
  • Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts
  • Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable.

Requirements

  • You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts
  • Previous experience with javascript, Angular, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and Java
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills
  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of web development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning
  • Developing proficiency in Angular (v7 or higher), Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, Git, Postman, GitHub, AWS, PHP, Laravel, Rest/Restful, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build our web apps.
  • Great communicator, adaptable, supportive, hard-working, and has a great sense of humor.
  • Loves to learn new things about programming each day.

This internship will help you acquire software engineering and development skills and provide you with knowledge of aviation industry-specific engineering requirements. Ultimately, you will gain experience in conceptualizing, designing, and developing software for both B2B and B2C markets within the aviation industry and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment.

This internship has no set salary, it offers other forms of compensation, such as training, experience building and possible commission and/or bonuses and full-time position.

description:
Full Job Description

Summer STEM Teachers, Assistants, Internship (Minecraft, Coding & Robotics)
Hello, and thank you for your interest in our Summer Technology Teacher and Assistant Positions! Below is an overview of the program and positions as well as a few questions to help us determine if you are a good fit for our company.

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

************************
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
************************

You must be available for 8 weeks this summer from June 8 to August 7. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8 am to 5 pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both.

As a Teacher or Assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will typically be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. You will need to go every 1 to 3 weeks to our headquarters for training and equipment pick up and drop off.

Rochester and St. Cloud teachers will only need to go twice in one summer

You will be delivering our curriculum to classes of up to 18 students. Teachers must be comfortable with managing up to 12 students alone. Grade level will vary between K-8th grades depending on the class.

************************
ABOUT PROGRAM:
************************
Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout the US. We offer classes in Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics for students ages 6-14. We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions.

Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers.

Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students, or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom.

Many of our past employees were able to use positions to satisfy an internship requirement from school.

************************
Training and Equipment:
************************
Before teaching or assisting, teachers must complete 12 hours of online training on basic camp management and leadership skills. You must also complete an in-house 12-hour employee orientation.

The curriculum will be provided to each teacher for each class. You are required to go over the curriculum, and submit projects to us prior to teaching. We will available during business hours via phone and email to help you. You will be provided all of the equipment needed to teach a class each week.

************************************
Pay:
************************************
Teachers: $15-$20 an hour
Assistants $12-$16 an hour
Prep and training: $8.25 an hour

************************************
Requirements:
************************************
-College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education
-Experience with Elementary age children
-Have a valid driver’s license
-You will be required to complete a local and national background check
-Be very comfortable with technology and using computers
-Your own reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes
-Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds
-You must be very punctual and reliable. Students must always be supervised.
-You must be organized and efficient to run an effective class
-You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids
-You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us on a regular basis
Reliable access to the Internet and a cell phone.

Plusses:
Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, or both Programming or Robotics experience of any kind

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

The Cadence Digital and Signoff Group Machine learning team is a high energy team which explores and implements Deep and Machine Learning techniques to Electronic Design Automation [EDA] tools. We are looking for exceptional individuals skilled in ML and Deep-Learning algorithms, frameworks and application development. In addition, we desire a team player with excellent communication skills who is as comfortable discussing Deep Learning research as with developing APIs to innovative new software.

The ability to interact with a worldwide cross-functional team and collaborate productively is a necessity. Full Job Description
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

Cadence has a 30-year history of applying leading edge optimization and analysis algorithms to extremely complex problems in semiconductor and electronic design, verification, and analysis. We are looking for a recent graduate software engineer to join our team of collaborative EDA professionals to deliver the best in class next generation of software for physical IC applications. The software engineer will work on complex problems where analysis of data requires an evaluation of intangible variance factors to develop leading edge software for the physical design and verification of products at advanced nodes.

Each day with Cadence offers exciting opportunities to create a better, more connected world. We are leading the charge to solve technology’s toughest challenges. Working at Cadence means working alongside the industry’s brightest people and innovating for the biggest, most innovative companies around the globe.

We are looking for a someone who is customer-centric and driven, to join our AI/ML team in implementing enterprise chatbot. As a developer, you will have the opportunity to implement new features and enhancements to Newton chatbot, which is a major platform for IT used by all users of Cadence world-wide sites. This bot is based on Microsoft Azure bot framework and uses various cognitive services (LUIS, QnaMaker) that will give you opportunity to learn and integrate it with various application both on cloud and in-house to automate L1/L2 tickets.

Candidate should have knowledge of node.js, python and Javascript programming languages
Candidate should have knowledge of MySQL, Oracle or equivalent DBs

**PROTECTED VETERAN DEFINITION

Protected veteran means a veteran who may be classified as an active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran, disabled veteran, Armed Forces service medal veteran or recently separated veteran.

Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.

Armed Forces service medal veteran means any veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 FR 1209, 3 CFR, 1996 Comp., p. 159).

Disabled veteran means (1) a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or (2) a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.

Recently separated veteran means a veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service.

Full Job Description

Job Description

Skyline Security Consulting Inc. is seeking a talented Cyber Compliance Intern to join one of the region's fastest-growing companies. This internship will consist of a combination of some on-site (headquarters office), some virtual (remote) work , and training. This is an UNPAID INTERNSHIP, however there will be expenses paid monthly totaling $500. These expenses incurred by the intern will be paid on the 1st and 15th of the month, $250 for each cycle.

As a Skyline Security intern, you will be learning how to detect, mitigate and exploit risks and vulnerabilities in information systems, as well as help, develop and test custom cybersecurity tools in support of internal operations and client projects. You will learn how to properly identify, implement, document, and validate NIST SP 800-53 security controls in accordance with various cybersecurity frameworks such as NIST RMF, CSF, and others. You will also learn how to maintain compliance with requirements such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, FISMA, HIPAA/HITECH, and more under the direction of highly experienced and certified industry professionals.

As a Skyline Security intern, you will support IT Compliance within the Information Technology framework, collaborating with a broad team of technical and business resources and delivering customer-focused support to Skyline Security Consulting Inc.’s operational and compliance needs.

The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Evaluating system projects for IT controls compliance requirements
  • Defining IT controls compliance requirements
  • Coordinating IT controls design and implementation
  • Validating IT controls have been effectively designed and executed

In order to be qualified for this role, you must possess the following:

  • Be enrolled in a Computer Science, Information Systems or related four-year degree program as a Junior or Senior (graduate students are also welcome to apply)
  • Have a strong interest in Cyber Security, especially for networks, systems, and software
  • Have technical ability to understand networking, systems administration, and other facets of information technology
  • A background in software development using any mainstream programming language (e.g. Python, Java, etc.) is preferred, but not required
  • Basic knowledge of Security, Cyber Risk, IT general controls
  • Basic knowledge of FFIEC, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, and other auditing standards.
  • Basic knowledge of CISSP and CISA Certifications and requirements.
  • Ability to research and write technical assessments of various aspects of Cybersecurity Controls
  • Ability to document large volumes of electronic files involved in an Audit or Risk Assessment
  • Ability to manage time and prioritize projects and tasks
  • Ability to work well with internal customers, understand needs and support appropriately
  • Ability to communicate effectively, represent technical topic in business terms
  • Able to communicate clearly via email, telephone, or in-person with staff, clients, leadership, and industry partners
  • Be able to meet monthly in-person, in Bridgewater NJ for monthly Staff meetings
  • Enrolled in an IT Major E.g. Computer Science, Computer Info. Systems, or Management Info. Systems or equivalent
  • Ability to pass a background and drug screening
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA required

description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 Agenda and related Public Relations, including:

  • Sparrow's App Store Launch
  • Email Marketing Campaigns
  • User feedback Communication
  • Social Media Presence
  • Public Relations
  • Influencer Outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) end of May through end of August 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started

The Company

Diligent is the pioneer in modern governance. We empower leaders to turn governance into a competitive advantage through unparalleled insight and highly secure, integrated SaaS applications, helping organizations thrive and endure in today’s complex, global landscape. The largest global network of corporate directors and executives, Diligent is relied on by more than 19,000 organizations and nearly 700,000 leaders in over 90 countries. With award-winning customer service, Diligent serves more than 50% of the Fortune 1000, 70% of the FTSE 100, and 65% of the ASX. Our passionate, smart, and creative group of more than 1,000 employees support customers around the globe.

Position Overview

Diligent is looking for an undergraduate student to work with our Database Operations team during the summer of 2021. The summer intern will primarily write SQL against various database types in support of our internal clients. They will be expected to learn the DBOps technology stack and administrative responsibilities.

Key Responsibilities

The Intern will share the responsibility for developing new or running existing SQL code for our internal and external clients. A daily expectation will be to analyze and report on any anomalies found in our monitoring systems.

Create customer report of increasing complexity
Perform daily operational system checks
Contribute to Datawarehouse design

Full-time undergraduate
Preferred Degree type – Technology, Engineering, Computer Science
Must be a team player with strong attention to detail
Availability for 8 weeks from early June until mid-August

Full Job Description
Starburst is on a mission to modernize data access & analytics. Our company was founded in an unusual way; with customers and revenue from the beginning! Our growth is already ahead of some of the most successful software start-ups, and we don’t plan on slowing down.

We believe our opportunity is huge. Every large company in the world suffers from a data silo problem. Traditional data warehouse products approach the problem with old solutions that breed inefficiency and ultimately can’t help business analysts run fast analytics on all their data.

Starburst provides a modern solution that addresses these data silo & speed of access problems. Starburst helps enterprises harness the value of open source Trino (formerly PrestoSQL), the fastest distributed query engine available today, by adding the tools and 24x7 support that meet the needs for big data access at scale. Ultimately, Starburst helps organizations run analytics anywhere to make better business decisions.

Are you a skilled writer and technology enthusiast pursuing a future in technical communication? The information engineering team at Starburst Data is seeking a summer intern to produce high-quality, external publications that help customers achieve their goals. You will apply your education and refine your technical writing skills with hands-on experience.

Throughout your internship, you’ll partner with and be mentored by senior information engineers, product managers, and designers. We expect that you’ll complete the internship with a quality piece you can showcase in your portfolio.

You get to work with Starburst Enterprise, and the Trino open source project, to improve the documentation. Have a look at https://docs.starburst.io to see what you will be working on!

This paid internship will span 12 weeks in Summer 2021.

Core responsibilities:
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and designers.
Plan, create, and update technical documentation.
Edit, clarify, and enhance the content experience.
Learn and teach new technologies and technical concepts to others.

Requirements:
Currently pursuing or recent graduate of a degree, intensive, or bootcamp in technical writing, human-computer interaction, computer science, or related field.
A portfolio that demonstrates how you used content to support a technical audience through an experience.
Excellent communication and storytelling skills.
Strong editing skills.
The ability to work independently in a remote capacity, as well as within a team environment.

Preferred qualifications:
Familiarity with Git/Github
Familiarity with Markdown
Knowledge of databases, SQL, object storage, and data analysis
Ability to read source code written in Java
Experience with HTML and CSS
Headquartered in Boston MA with offices in Warsaw and London and employees across Europe and the Americas, we are committed to hiring where the talent is.

Starburst Data, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Full Job Description
Company Description

When applying, you will need to answer the 3 screening questions, attach 1 project, and submit your current college transcript or you risk losing your opportunity for consideration. No Visa Sponsorship and Relocation Assistance at this time.

Here at KIOXIA America Inc, our creative force in the world of Storage represents extraordinary talent of people with a diverse range of skill-sets, interests and backgrounds carefully orchestrated to architect and design innovative SSD solutions.

Our Culture is composed of intelligent, curious people who collaborate respectfully together and are stimulated when being stretched beyond technical comfort zones and who thrive on engineering challenges and technological diversity. Simply put, our internship program will engage students with the opportunity to experience real work while providing a practical understanding of SSD technologies, as well our culture.

KIOXIA is looking for passionate and driven students from all disciplines and beyond to be a part of our summer internship. We offer an invigorating program where interns will be contributing to projects with meaningful outcomes – this is not a coffee and copy internship. Our Internship runs eight weeks during the summer between June and August and is open to students with a minimum of two years of college. While our goal is to groom a talent pool of future engineers we cannot guarantee an internship will transition to full-time position – but you never know!

Job Description

KIOXIA America, Inc is seeking a highly-skilled student intern to join our SSD Product Development Team to assist in a number of process improvement projects. You will work closely with program managers and engineers in this team to help automate data collection, and analyze the data to aid quicker decision making. You will also be tasked with creating dashboards so data can be monitored/track live. Come join this exciting team of engineers who are always looking to improve their ways of getting work done.

Your responsibilities will include, but not limited to:
Assisting program managers with allocation planning and receiving/distributing SSD's from the factory
Assisting HW team with board measurements, validation and minor reworks
Creating JIRA Dashboards and filters to track/monitor program progress
Automate data collection/metrics using Easy BI
Automate JIRA readout for program schedules
Mine and analyze data with goal to improve

Pursuing BS/MS degree in engineering or computer science
Highly skill with Microsoft Office Suite including: Word, Excel, and Project
Experience in Perl, Python or similar languages - required in automation data analysis projects

Req# i-0021; #LI-JV1

Full Job Description
Do you want to play a role in global commerce?

The beating heart of global supply chains are the logistic real estate assets that aggregate, store, sort, and deliver products. We are that heart. With the largest portfolio of assets in our industry, Prologis acts as a central hub for roughly 2% of the global GDP.

The Advanced Analytics team is dedicated to improving the overall operations of these assets to drive economic value for all stakeholders. We are here, not just to help solve internal problems, but to provide solutions for our Customers and Global partners. Data is just beginning to impact the Industrial Real Estate industry, and we are dedicated to being at the forefront of this trend. Our vision is to establish our work and efforts as the future standards for the rest of the industry. If this sounds exciting to you, please consider applying to our 12-week summer internship.

What's needed in order to do that:
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business.
Designs solutions that are enterprise scalable and maintainable. Able to consider a breadth of data use cases.
Familiarity with cold-start problem, matrix factorization, "item-item" algorithms would be ideal.
Ability in self-learning, entering new domain, managing through uncertainty in an innovative team environment.

Tell us if you're ready.

A Bachelor or Master's degree underway in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or similar domain.
A broad and good understanding of statistics and data science concepts: supervised v. unsupervised learning, hypothesis testing, etc., and when to apply them.
Experience in querying and manipulating raw datasets for analysis.
Machine Learning sense and statistical knowledge.
Experience working independently.

Target base compensation range of: $30.00/hr.

Full Job Description
Our professionals balance analytical skills, deep market insight and independence to deliver solid, defensible analysis and practical advice to our clients. As an organization, we think globally. We create transparency in an opaque world, and we encourage our people to do the same. That means when you take your place on our team, you’ll discover a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel. If you’re ready to share your perspective with the world, then you can make a real impact here. This is the Duff & Phelps difference.

Kroll, a division of Duff & Phelps’ Cyber Risk practice works on hundreds of cases a year, including some of the most complex and highest profile matters in the world. With experts based around the world, supported by ground-breaking technology, we can help protect our client’s data, people, operations and reputation with innovative cyber risk assessments, investigations and reporting. We help enable organization to be more cyber resilient by preparing for and detecting incidents through risk assessments, penetration testing and threat detection/intelligence services. Our clients also count on us for quick and expert support in the event of a cyber breach or attack; we help clients – of all sizes –respond to incidents and restore stability through digital forensics, breach notification, and identity monitoring and restoration services for individuals affected by a data breach.

At Duff & Phelps, your work will help protect, restore and maximize value for our clients. Join us and together we’ll maximize the value of your career.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Cyber Security Intern will perform technical assessments and auditing of our client’s information security programs to assess the maturity of an organization’s information security program and make recommendations for improvement.

Collect, analyze, and investigate information from industry partners and law enforcement to determine various methods and tactics in cyberspace.
Keep abreast of cyber market trends and competitive intelligence through research and the culling of resources from our partners.
Use open source intelligence tools and proprietary technology to conduct research assessments
Assist with writing presentations for diverse audiences, ranging from private industry to law enforcement.
Assist in project management and conduct administrative duties for the Cyber Risk team
Perform statistical analysis of trends in cyber analytics.

REQUIREMENTS:
Currently pursuing Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Forensics, Criminology, Management Information Science, Forensics Analysis, Political Science, Intelligence Studies or related field of study from an accredited college or university
Expected graduation date between December 2021 and September 2022
Minimum current cumulative GPA of 3.0
Basic cybersecurity knowledge preferred (i.e. understanding of the dark web, cyber threat landscape, underground forums and markets)
Programming/scripting skills helpful.
Excellent time management and organization skills
Computer proficiency and ability to maximize applications such as Microsoft Word and Excel
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future

In order to be considered for a position at Duff & Phelps, you must formally apply via careers.duffandphelps.jobs

Duff & Phelps is committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We will not discriminate between applications for reason of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.

Full Job Description
EnerSys is the global leader in stored energy solutions for industrial applications. We have over thirty manufacturing and assembly plants worldwide servicing over 10,000 customers in more than 100 countries. Worldwide headquarters are located in Reading, PA, USA with regional headquarters in Europe and Asia. We complement our extensive line of Motive Power and Energy Systems with a full range of integrated services and systems. With sales and service locations throughout the world, and over 100 years of battery experience, EnerSys is the power/full solution for stored DC power products. We continue to grow in our industry by ensuring all employees possess the following core competencies: customer focused, team player, engaged, ethical, strong communication skills, and works safely.

Job Purpose

Alpha Technologies Inc. is an established leader in the design and manufacture of powering solutions for the Telecom, CATV power supply, and Traffic, Security, Medical, Industrial and Renewable Energy industries. The company offers a broad portfolio of high quality, feature-rich solutions that can be customized to suit almost any application and environment offering the highest performance and best value in the industry. With a focus on being your power solutions partner, Alpha builds on over 35 years of experience to develop solutions that resolve customer’s unique powering challenges.

Test / Networking Intern; to provide engineering support in software verification and validation of our Power Supplies, Gateways and other embedded IP/networked products. Perform a variety of tasks including automation of DOCSIS, TCP/IP, Web UI, SNMP components of products under test. Position requires the ability to generate and execute comprehensive test plans, test procedures, test reports, and detailed bug entries.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Assist in creation of automated test suites to enhance existing automation protocols
Automate (using python, bash, perl, etc) various components such as DOCSIS, network throughput (TCP/IP) traffic, WebUI, SNMP, etc.
Automate cause and effect scenarios (example, an action on the web UI component results in the change in behavior on a different component)
With assistance from the engineering team, document and develop test applications for various components including DOCSIS, networking (TCP/IP), Web UI, SNMP.
Coordinate and document systems level or component level qualification testing of network based communication products (i.e. SNMP, DOCSIS, etc.) in both non-automated and automated test environments.
Write detailed test reports, document feature/requirement deficiencies (A.K.A. bugs) with bug tracking tool, and other related Engineering documents.
Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Candidate should be a graduate student or enrolled in undergraduate program related to Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field with an interest in networking programming with existing C language experience or coursework.
The candidate should have an outstanding academic record, excellent organizational, interpersonal communication and written skills, strong quantitative and computer skills.
General Job Requirements
This position will work in an office setting, expect minimal physical demands.

Full Job Description
At Bozzuto, it’s all about experience. Whether it’s the experience you bring, gain or give, we want your journey to be exceptional. Guided by our core values of creativity, concern, passion and the pursuit of perfection, we’ve been creating inspiring, engaging and vibrant communities for three decades.

Why do we do it? Because home is where aspirations are pursued and memories unfold. We believe in the power to impact the lives of the people we touch through the delivery of extraordinary experiences.

Responsibilities

As a data analytics intern, you will generate insights by conducting extensive analyses of Bozzuto’s rich data. Going above and beyond simply providing reports and analyses, you will advise on opportunities for process improvement that empower our teams to deliver exceptional experiences for employees and customers. In the process, you will develop a deep understanding of the property management business, our obsession with hospitality and further strengthen your analytics, leadership, and presentation skills. You will also gain exposure to a wide variety of functional teams within Bozzuto.

As a Data Analytics Intern, your primary responsibilities include:

Gathering, cleansing and validating both structured and unstructured data to provide internal clients with accurate information
Extracting and modifying data using SQL, Python, R, or other tools
Developing and using knowledge of technology to design innovative approaches to solve data-related challenge
Analyze and interpret historical financial, operational, and transactional data
Create summaries, data visualizations, written analyses, and other presentations of work performed

What You Bring to Us:
Manipulate, standardize, and process data from various sources
Technical working knowledge of the following programming languages and technologies:

Required:
Python (preferred)/ C++/ Java
SQL
Pursuing a Bachelors Degree in computer science, information technology, data science, and/or data analytics

Optional:
Experience with Power BI and DAX
Knowledge of R/ SAS/ NoSQL/Mongo/DynamoDB
AWS/Azure
Proficiency in MS Excel/Pivot table and MS Access

What We Bring You:
In addition to an award winning culture and amazing work spaces, Bozzuto offers a wide range of insurance options, financial programs, and benefits that let you and your family be healthy and plan for the future. Our benefits take into consideration everything from career development to retirement, family matters, health and wellness. Bozzuto is committed to doing everything it can to offer you quality benefits and healthcare coverage—including access to the best doctors and hospitals at an affordable price. Current undergraduate with at least Junior standing in pursuit of a degree in Actuarial Science, Math, Statistics or Computer Science. Recent graduates seeking fulltime employment will also be considered.

Knowledge of Excel, R, SAS, and/or SQL (Structured Query Language)

Service oriented

Quick learner

Team player

Detail oriented

Good written and oral communication skills

This is a part-time 10-week program from September through November. The position is based out of our Administrative Offices in Costa Mesa, California.

The intern will complete a single project that will analyze premium, losses, and expenses to determine the profitability of an auto or homeowner’s insurance product or segments of the product. The project will include exploratory data analysis using appropriate tools, such as Microsoft Excel, Tableau or EMBLEM. Data may be obtained using, software including SAS and SQL.

Full Job Description
Description

Ingram Micro is seeking a motivated and talented IoT R&D Engineer Intern to join our 10-week PAID Summer Internship Program! We are looking for ambitious college and university students who are ready to expand their skills and apply them to meaningful work with a global organization.

Who is Ingram Micro?

Ingram Micro is the world’s largest distributor of technology. We touch about 80% of the technology being used in the world today, which means YES, we’ve probably touched some part of that phone, tablet, or laptop you’re on way before you did! With operations in 56 countries and more than 33,000 associates worldwide, we generated $50 billion in revenue just last year! After over 40 years in the industry, we’re continuing to expand our footprint and we’d love to expand it with you!!

At Ingram Micro, you’ll be part of a team that’s passionate about innovation and excited to work together to make a difference. We’re looking for dynamic team players who are ready to push the limits of what’s possible. We offer a variety of across all IoT solutions and services throughout Ingram Micro. You will immediately work on real projects alongside industry experts. We empower you as a future leader to collaborate with our global teams, develop ideas, and then run with them.

Essential responsibilities of your role:
Assist in developing code for IoT (Internet of Things) sensors to capture data and build out a dashboard based on Azure IoT central or ThinkBoard based cloud platforms.
Collaborate with IoT Solution design team to develop project-specific implementation strategies. Act as an ongoing project consultant to ensure success.
Develop, debug, and maintain code for IoT sensors and Gateways.
Assist in the development of server-side sensor data capture and recording.
Develop and maintain the server-side reporting mechanisms to help visualize data from sensors.
Test and validate the Sensors and Gateways from various vendors.

Knowledge, skills, and/or abilities you need to have:
Actively enrolled in an accredited college/university program, or recently graduated (within the last semester or quarter) from an accredited college/university program
Strong academic record with a cumulative overall GPA of 3.0 or higher
Enrollment in a computer science or engineering degree program is required.
Proficiency in .net C# and Python programming language required.
Good to have a working knowledge of Raspberry Pi or Arduino development boards.
Experience with data transmission standards such as Bluetooth, BLE, Wi-Fi, LoRa and LoRaWAN preferred.
Experience with Azure cloud, Azure IoT central, ThinkBoard other cloud-hosted platforms preferred.
Local candidates preferred.

  • This is not a complete listing of the job duties. It’s a representation of the things you will be doing, and you may not perform all these duties.
  • Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without restrictions or future sponsorship.
Ingram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

Full Job Description
About Us

With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.

Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.

Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.

Reports To

Director, Hardware Engineering

What You Will Be Doing

The Hardware Engineering Intern will participate in circuit analysis and design as well as troubleshooting hardware related issues in the lab and field environments. This person will work with the other members of the Hardware Engineering team to gain a level of understanding of electric vehicle charging stations that will enable the candidate to contribute to the development of the next generation of charging station products.

Depending on the project need specific tasks could range from theoretical Digital and/or Analog circuit design, bread-boarding prototype circuits, prototype circuit test and validation, schematic CAD circuit implementation, board layout supervision, test fixture and cable assembly, beta product electrical and mechanical assembly.

What You Will Bring to ChargePoint

Background in electrical/electronic design.
Desire to innovate and create new technologies in vehicle charging.
Must be hands-on, inventive, curious, and creative.

Requirements

Analog and digital circuit design exposure.
Coding experience a plus - C++ or assembly.
2+ years of college-level coursework.in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines.

Location

Campbell, CA

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.

ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.

Full Job Description
About our Internship Program
As a thredUP summer intern, you will be given a firsthand glimpse at what it’s like to work at the world’s largest fashion resale platform. During the 11 week program, you will tackle projects alongside our world-class team, with the opportunity to make a real impact on thredUP’s business. Our paid internships are ideal for ambitious students or recent grads who thrive in ambiguity, like a good challenge, and want a jump start on their career development. Oh, and who want to help inspire a new generation of consumers to think secondhand first.

About the Data Engineer Internship
As an intern on our Data Engineering team, you will work alongside thredUP's data warehouse team to build data driven products that will be used internally across several teams. You will get an opportunity to work on varied data sets and projects in our production environment that have a direct impact on the business. Your time will focus on one main project, with several side projects to insure the growth of several areas of skill.

About You:
3 years of experience in SQL and Python development
Currently enrolled in a Master's Program in Computer Science or MIS
Relevant coursework in Big Data Technologies and Business Analytics
Strong Data Analysis skills and an eagerness to learn in a business setting
Bonus: hands-on experience building data processing pipelines in Apache Spark
What We Offer

We also believe that each person should help drive the business. As an intern, you’ll be encouraged to speakUP, think big, ask questions and seek the truth, and help influence outcomes for our business and customers.

REPORTS TO: VP, Enterprise Infrastructure Systems
LOCATION: Remote

Position Summary:
ServiceNow is a software platform for IT Service Management. It is based on ITIL guidelines to provide processes and workflows for service requests and systems management. The Intern for Enterprise Infrastructure Systems role will be responsible for collecting information from the Infrastructure Team, compiling technical specifications, developing and implementing ServiceNow workflows for the newly implemented Technology Life Cycle Flexera module. This internship will include immersion within the ServiceNow platform which is used throughout the industry as a standard configuration management tool for ITIL based organizations.

Qualifications Required:
Minimum of 2+ years college experience with concentration in Computer Science or Information Systems
Enrolled in an accredited university/college program to receive credit
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
Must be 18 years of age
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-directed and able to work without supervision

Qualifications Desired:
College focus in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related discipline
Open to new thoughts and ideas
Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas
Willingness to participate\volunteer in group settings

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Participate in ServiceNow training sessions to better understand the platform
Perform end user inquiry sessions and gather user requirements
Translate user requirements into technical specifications (psuedo-code) collaborating with ServiceNow Senior Engineers prior to development

The working environment is generally favorable. position: Incident Response & Red Team Internship - Remote Summer 2021
description:
Full Job Description
Company Description

FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 9,000 customers across 103 countries, including more than 50 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.

Job Description

This role will be remote for summer 2021 but candidates should be open to working in Denver if they are converted to a full time employee after graduation.

Do you love the challenge of figuring out solutions to intricate technology puzzles?
Do you like to help others solve their network and information security issues?
If you answered YES, then consider a career at FireEye Mandiant as a Consulting Intern!

We have the expertise and experience in information security. This is our focus.
You’re not just a number and you won’t get lost in the shuffle.
You will be working on challenging technical projects that make an impact. You’ll be visible.
You’ll be exposed to many different environments and technologies.
You’ll learn from our best incident responders and red teamers.

We investigate breaches that make headlines (and many more that don’t), as well as break into applications and systems to identify security gaps for our clients. We find evil and solve crime, and are seeking candidates who possess the ability to think like an attacker and stay one step ahead of the game.

Find your niche among the cool projects you’ll be involved with, such as:
Incident response
Host and network forensics
Network traffic analysis
Malware analysis and reverse engineering
Penetration testing
Network, web and mobile application security assessments
Source code reviews
And more…

Responsibilities:
Conduct host forensics, network forensics, log analysis, and malware triage in support of incident response investigations
Recognize and codify attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations
Perform network penetration, web and mobile application testing, source code reviews, threat analysis, wireless network assessments and social engineering assessment
Build internal scripts, tools and methodologies to enhance our capabilities
Develop comprehensive and accurate reports and presentations for both technical and executive audiences
Work with security and IT operations at clients to implement remediation plans

Qualifications

Requirements:
Currently pursuing a degree in computer science, computer engineering or information technology

Technical skills in at least two of the following areas:
Strong knowledge of Windows OS and networking protocols
Basic knowledge of tools used for forensic collection and analysis
Knowledge of application testing and network security concepts
A technical security-related internship or other professional experience
Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship

Additional Qualifications:
Strong technical acumen and ability to quickly assimilate new information
Ability to successfully interface with clients (internal and external) and manage expectations of others
Ability to document and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner

Additional Information

At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Requests for accommodation due to disability can be sent directly to HR-Accommodations@FireEye.com.

(Colorado applicants only*)

Minimum Hourly Rate: $20. Final rate will be determined commensurately with cost of living, experience level, and/or any other legally permissible considerations.

Benefits: Employer subsidized benefits include Medical Insurance. FireEye also provides Flexible Paid Sick Time and Paid Holidays.

Full Job Description

What Is GigRoster™?

GigRoster™ is a fully developed, experienced entertainment agency and talent buying organization, now in the process of creating robust booking tools for customers, entertainment planners, member performing acts and our team of Talent Coordinators. We are developing a truly unique model in the entertainment business for finding and booking local musicians and variety performing acts for any kind of event or function. We’ve built a platform which is free to our thousands of performing artists, bands, DJs and entertainers all over the USA. GigRoster™ takes entertainment booking to the next level by providing our member performing acts a way to promote their own business in a targeted and robust way, with no upfront costs. GigRoster™ is the only company in the United states and Canada that features a full suite of online promotional and booking capabilities and also includes personal assistance, from a team of experienced Talent Coordinators. Real humans, who, like our performers, have Real Talent across every phase of the industry. The resources we have brought together create phenomenal growth potential as we continue to enhance our offerings and the interface for our customers who book their entertainment with GigRoster™ Real Talent and the thousands of performers who are promoting themselves in pursuit of booking paying events through our platform and system. We want to have the best online UX and UI in the industry. Our next step is in continuing to upgrade and enhance the sophistication and functionality of our interface to take full advantage of the available technologies that will provide us a competitive advantage. We will automate many functions that can better serve our customers while still involving our team of live talent coordinators as facilitators. We are looking for individuals to join our creative technology team who love the talent industry and want to be a part of GigRoster™, helping to grow the services across the USA and beyond, in the exciting world of music, entertainment and talent booking services.

GigRoster™ is looking for a full stack web developer to help design and develop web applications that match performers with customers looking for entertainment. This role requires strong knowledge of modern web technologies and common user experience (UX) patterns. You will work closely with software engineers, designers, UX specialists, and business stakeholders.

Responsibilities

  • Writing production-ready code with fluency in modern front-end and back-end frameworks.
  • Engineering responsive web applications and deploying in Docker containers to Amazon Cloud.
  • Writing RESTful APIs.
  • Design and architect applications leveraging AWS services.
  • Learning new emerging technologies and taking initiative to offer technical direction and creative solutions.

Duration and Location

The internships are full-time (20 hours per week or as arranged) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May or June 2021.

We are a geographically distributed team. The business operation is in Seattle and the engineers are in Boston, currently working remotely from home. Working hours may be flexible.

Basic Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or will receive a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a STEM related field such as Computer Science and Computer Engineering.
  • Full stack experience with at least one UI and one back-end stack. E.g. HTML5/CSS, Node.js, React, Angular, JavaScript, Ruby, Ruby On Rails, Java, C/C++.
  • Knowledge of fundamental Amazon Web Services: S3, EC2, Fargate, lambda, VPC, IAM, and DevOps services.
  • Understanding of Agile Scrum based Software Development.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Expertise with Node.js, React, Ruby on Rails.
  • Exposure to mobile app development (iOS and Android).
  • Understanding and exposure to database technologies (e.g., postgresql and DynamoDB).
  • Experience in API design and development (e.g., AWS API Gateway and Swagger).
  • Experience with test frameworks (e.g., mocha, chai).
  • Working knowledge of AWS DevOps & CICD services including CDK, CodeBuild, CodePipeline, CodeDeploy, ECR, and ECS.
  • Working knowledge of web technologies and security practices, such as: cross origin resource sharing (CORS), cross site request forgery (CSRF) protection, page load optimization, code splitting, and progressive loading.
  • Superior communication skills with the ability to work directly with business partners.
  • Experience as a musician or entertainer, preferably with professional working experience with an understanding talent booking concepts.

GigRoster™ is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. GigRoster™ is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

A successful candidate will be responsible for building and implementing one or more of our major project initiatives. This will provide real world experience and exceptional examples in this industry or other software development positions going forward.

The NYC Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) enriches the environment and protects public health for all New Yorkers by providing 1.1 billion gallons of high quality drinking water, managing wastewater and stormwater, and reducing air, noise, and hazardous materials pollution. DEP is the largest combined municipal water and wastewater utility in the country, with nearly 6,000 employees. DEP's water supply system is comprised of 19 reservoirs and 3 controlled lakes throughout the system’s 2,000 square mile watershed that extends 125 miles north and west of the City.

The New York City Department of Environmental Protection’s (DEP) Bureau of Business Information Technology (BIT) is responsible for providing quality business, technical and IT system support to our users. This commitment is realized through collaboration, strong relationships and a unified vision with our partners at DEP in order to provide quality technological solutions to our business needs. Providing these services allows us to ensure that DEP continues its tradition of delivering excellent service to the residents of New York City.

The Bureau of Business Information Technology (BIT) Application Development Unit is responsible for highly technical and supervisory activities in the design, implementation enhancement, maintenance, and analysis of software systems and the development of applications programming. The selected candidate will assisting with the updating of web and mobile applications. Also, the individual may be required to test and design system prototypes. The selected candidate should also have a working knowledge of one or more of the following: .NET, HTML, C#, SQL, MS Visio, and MS Dynamics. Additional responsibilities will include assisting with documentation for existing applications, creating reports, and special projects.

About us

Kyte is a technology platform that brings seamless delivery into the rental car experience. We are building the most compelling and customer-centric way to rent a car. With our value proposition of an easy car rental delivery experience with consistent & approachable support, we saw record growth throughout COVID19, and are now doubling down on gaining market share.

We recently raised more than $9M in venture funding from some of the best investors in the industry (amongst others, investors in Auto 1, Bird, Lime, DoorDash, Flexport, and Slack).

-

At Kyte, we love what we do and we believe our diverse team of ridiculously ambitious individuals is what makes our company great. Together, we are mobility enthusiasts that have an assortment of wide-ranging backgrounds from Stanford, Berkeley, MIT, TUM, Uber, BMW, McKinsey, and others.

We are headquartered in the sunny, San Francisco Marina district where we enjoy Bay views, good food, and a proper sound system for those late night working sessions. We have opened our second home strategically close to Oktoberfest in Munich, just 5 min from the Central Station in the beautiful district of Nymphenburg.

We offer competitive compensation, significant equity, and the ability to shape a big vision from early on. We are laser focused on bringing on talented individuals that are aligned with our value and mission, to create a magical rental car experience from end to end. You will have more than significant ownership and impact on our company trajectory, and shape how people get around the cities they live in. Don’t see a position that perfectly fits? Feel free to drop your resume in our open Talent Community post, we look forward to hearing from you!

How we work

  • Our Backend is written with Python using Flask and PostgreSQL
  • Our Frontend is written with Typescript using React and React Native
  • We have the mindset "you built it, you run it"
  • We ship code to production (AWS) several times per day using Gitlab CI/CD
Requirements
Strong fundamentals in software development and computer science through a formal degree or bootcamp.
Programming experience and familiarity, from side projects or classwork, primarily in Python, Java, Go, Javascript, or any other similar language
Hustling-, hardworking- & shipping-products attitude: Go above and beyond to get things done!
Ownership: You are a self-starter and are satisfied by owning large chunks of the product roadmap.
Ambition: You are ridiculously ambitious and want to get the most out of your life.
Nice to have
Very good allrounder experience (Backend services, RESTful APIs, API design, server-side flow)
For frontend: Typescript using React and React Native
For backend: Python using Flask and PostgreSQL
Experience working in an agile setup using continuous deployment and delivery
Machine Learning experience (Tensorflow, Torch, Keras, ....)
Javascript / react experience
AWS deployments & DevOps
Data security and encryption mechanisms
Benefits
The opportunity to be a part of the exciting early stages of a well-funded, Silicon Valley based startup that has massive growth and venture potential
You’ll be able to work, innovate, and grow with a ridiculously ambitious, committed and fun team in the Munich and San Francisco tech ecosystem
You’ll have the ability to have major impact on a product that is on its way to impact millions of users in a profound way
Kyte benefits include significant equity, transportation benefits, gym benefits, office visits across between US and Europe and much more.

Here’s what our “Class of 2020” enjoyed about working at ServiceNow:

Help build the infrastructure and automation to ensure talent data are used effectively across ServiceNow

Experience in Tableau

Strong communication skills at all levels, both verbal and written

ClearVision Optical

Opportunity

Come work for a values-based organization that takes pride in its culture and invests in its talent! Proficient at using Microsoft Word and Excel

ClearVision Optical is seeking a talented college student who is looking for a hands-on Data Science Internship. Full Job Description
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

The Circuit Simulation Intern will assist R&D staff in developing new algorithms and software for the Spectre circuit simulator. Job duties may include hands-on experience in researching new algorithmic approaches, software engineering to implement new features, performing software validation and testing, and investigating performance/accuracy issues in the simulator.

Applicant should have previous exposure to the circuit simulation area and experience in EDA-relevant software development, particular C/C++ unix development.

Understanding of analog/RF/custom IC design and verification practices is a strong plus.

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

We are a hardworking and fun-loving global team with open environment. We have lot of domain knowledge and technical experts in the team to learn from. Our SCRUM teams are completely in control of what and how projects are executed. We support flexible hours and a lot of learning opportunities for our newly boarded team members. Every two week we invite speakers from within the team or from other teams to talk about different projects, products, technical designs , etc to keep ourselves up to date.

Position title: SAP HXM iXp Intern – Agile Developer

Learn how core HR application work, what tools, technologies, and frameworks are used.

Focus on coding, testing, and automating specific product features, being part of the SCRUM team.
Learn about standard cloud application development practices by applying them on real life cases.

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Minimum BS degree in computer science or related field
Gained more than 1 year of experience in application development and automation
Object oriented programming, Database and Java (related technologies)
Logic and solving problems
Designing and executing.
Being supporting and accommodating
Adopting and Improvising
Any automation tool

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. Full Job Description
Zola is looking for an innovative MBA Product Manager Intern to join our product team this summer. This is a 10-week internship, where you will rotate between the Vendor Marketplace team and Core Experience team. You'll be teamed up with 2 dedicated engineering interns for the duration of your internship, while partnering closely with a full-time product manager and designer on each respective team. This is an exciting and unique internship structure that will give you the opportunity to work cross-functionally to solve real business problems in two of Zola's key focus areas.

We're looking for someone who can both sweat the details and tie them back to the big picture. The successful candidate should be equally comfortable talking tech with developers and brand positioning with marketing. We are looking for someone with a strong product mind who is excited to roll their sleeves up and dive into user problems as well as handle the nitty gritty of developing a new feature in a very short amount of time.

RESPONSIBILITIES

● Drive end-to-end feature development, from cross-functional ideation and solutioning to execution
● Develop hypotheses and conduct user research to validate ideas and influence feature direction
● Define and communicate project requirements to working team and stakeholders
● Analyze business impact and present findings to business and product teams
● Deeply understand the customer journey across Zola's products and devices and think creatively about how to serve the customer better
● Evaluate competitors and the market for capability-oriented and emerging development/technology trends specific to your projects
● Develop understanding of technical constraints and knowing where to push the boundaries

QUALIFICATIONS

● Currently pursuing a full-time MBA degree
● Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage competing tasks in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment
● Exceptional technical, business and customer experience judgment
● Creative, scrappy, and customer-obsessed
● Collaborative team player with ability to build business relationships across functional teams
● Strong written and verbal communication skills; presents effectively to audiences of all types (technical and non-technical)
● Excellent quantitative skills. Understanding of SQL, Google Analytics and Segment a major plus!
● Previous experience in a product or analytical role within a high-growth, consumer-focused startup is a plus
● BA/BS required. A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Business is preferred

ABOUT ZOLA

We're Zola, the wedding company that will do anything for love. We're reinventing the wedding planning and registry experience to make the happiest moment in our couples' lives even happier. From engagement to wedding and decorating your first home, Zola is there, combining compassionate customer service with modern tools and technology… all in the service of love.
We built our entire platform from the ground-up in 2013, and quickly became the fastest-growing wedding company in the country. Our team has deep experience creating award-winning online and mobile products that are helpful, intuitive, and simply magical. We're proud to have investor partners including Female Founders Fund, Comcast Ventures, Goldman Sachs, Canvas Ventures, Thrive Capital and Lightspeed Venture Partners, among others.

We are passionate about supporting all forms of love, and we're proud of our thriving community of over 1 million couples. We strive to hire a team that is as beautifully diverse as the couples getting married today, and we encourage individuals from every race, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, marital status, religion and perspective to apply. Zola will always be a place where every employee, couple, wedding guest, wedding vendor, and partner will be respected and accepted and valued.

Our headquarters are in NYC, and we have offices in Charlottesville and Montreal. Come work with us!

POSITION: Intern, Client Delivery – Risk & Control
