Full Job Description
The California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation (CDCR) is looking to hire a Student Assistant to work under close supervision of the Information Technology Supervisor II (IT Sup II), Information Technology Service Center. In a learning capacity, the student will assist with the daily administrative and supportive duties of the unit to include, but not limited to, processing customer service requests, service management activities, monitoring IT applications and networks, and supporting IT staff with the implementation of projects related to the IT Service Center.

Conditions of Employment

This is a part-time, temporary, non-benefited, student position. Employment in all positions with University Enterprises, Inc. is dependent upon the mutual consent of University Enterprises, Inc. and the employee. This means that either University Enterprises, Inc. or the employee can, at any time, terminate the employment relationship at will, with or without cause.

Depending on the type of position you are applying for, a pre-employment background check consisting of one or more of the following may be conducted: employment history, professional references, criminal check, educational verification (i.e., degree, license, or official transcript) and physical exam and drug urinalysis test. Applicants will be required to pass required pre-employment checks to the satisfaction of University Enterprises Inc., (UEI) and the hiring Agency or Department.

Work Schedule

Monday through Friday, between the hours of 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Flexible. Offices are closed for State holidays.

Additional Work Schedule

Student Assistants and Graduate Student Assistants generally work up to 20 hours per work week (Sunday-Saturday) during the academic year and up to 40 hours per work week during breaks; (Winter, Spring and Summer). Another work schedule option for students working off campus through the California Intern Network is to work 28 hours per week, year-round.

Area Sacramento
On/Off Sacramento State Campus Off Campus
Worksite City Sacramento
Pay Range $14.00 - $17.60 per hour
Department/Agency California Department of Corrections & Rehabilitation (CDCR)
Unit/Division EIS - CSFO
Project Description

The mission of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation (CDCR) is to enhance public safety through safe and secure incarceration of offenders, effective parole supervision, and rehabilitative strategies to successfully reintegrate offenders into our communities. To learn more visit www.cdcr.ca.gov.

Majors/Fields of Study Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science and Engineering, Government , Public Policy and Administration, Statistics
Minimum Qualifications

Work at this level requires entry level information technology skills in an IT domain for customer service in order to complete routine assignments in collaboration with team members, including processing of IT requests and budgeting, service desk assignments such as providing support and information related to IT products and services to end-users. Ability to learn and follow IT support procedures in order to assist with first-level monitoring and escalation of service requests and incidents to other units as appropriate related to CDCR applications, networks, and communication devices. Extensive use and understanding of business office applications.

Prerequisites

Must be a college student attending classes during the regular term (Fall, Spring and Winter, if applicable), at one of the accredited colleges or universities on our affiliation list.

To view our current affiliation list please paste the following URL into your browser: http://www.calinterns.org/wp-content/uploads/Affiliation_List.pdf

Students must be enrolled at a minimum in: six semester units or nine quarter units for undergraduate students; four semester units or six quarter units for graduate students.

Students declared major must match the major(s) listed in the job posting.

Preferred Qualifications
Duties and Responsibilities

  • Answers customer calls and reports disruptions in any of the computing services delivered by the Enterprise Information Services (EIS), documents the disruption in an automated problem/request response system, and employs troubleshooting techniques to resolve the least complex problems, following clearly established processes.
  • Answers customer calls requesting new services, documents the request in an automated problem/request response system, fulfills the request, or forwards the request to units who fulfill the service request, following clearly established processes.
  • In a training capacity, supports application system users; troubleshoots user’s computers by use of remote tools whenever possible to resolve issues.
  • Assists in coordinating Change Control Board (CCB) meetings for issues that involve the CDCR computing and network environment and possibly impact the operations of the California Correctional Health Care Services (CCHCS).
  • Assists in resolving technical and analytical problems involving technology recovery (as a result of natural disasters, technology/equipment failure, and negative human actions).
  • In a training capacity, assist IT staff with obtaining vendor quotes and creating purchase requisitions.
  • Assists team with the problem and incident management process in the daily resolution of Service Operations issues such as service outages, in order to identify singular incidents that become reoccurring enterprise-wide problems, and their root causes.
  • Assists with analysis of continual ITSM improvement to meet EIS and business needs.
  • In a training capacity, assists with the least complex network monitoring tasks.
  • Assists with adding and removing information regarding outages or degraded service from network monitoring tools.
  • Attend required team and departmental training and meetings.
  • Provide assistance and support to the CSFO Regionals and Supervisors.
  • Receive and process ITSC and CSFO reports.
  • Participate in various teams to support the enterprise-wide information technology service center.
  • Assists staff with projects and workload; assists with generating reports, maintaining files, sending files to institutions and external state agencies; assists with scheduling and calendaring meeting and appointments; assists with drafting and editing documents or correspondence; assists with making photocopies and confidential shred.
  • Help keep the ITSC area clean and orderly.
  • Assists with staff moves and re locations.
Physical Requirements

Sit for extended periods; frequently stand and walk; manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination; corrected hearing and vision to normal range; verbal communication; use of office equipment including computer workstations, telephones, calculators, copiers, printers, scanners, and fax machines; occasional kneeling, squatting, reaching and lifting of equipment up to 50 pounds (using the approved lifting procedures), with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Working Conditions

Work is performed in an office environment.

description:
Full Job Description
Responsibilities

One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. Growing steadily since its inception into an esteemed Fortune 500 corporation, annual revenues were $11.6 billion in 2020. In 2021, UHS was again recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; in 2020, ranked #281 on the Fortune 500; and listed #330 in Forbes ranking of U.S.’ Largest Public Companies. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS has 89,000 employees and through its subsidiaries operates 26 acute care hospitals, 334 behavioral health facilities, 39 outpatient facilities and ambulatory care access points, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located in 38 U.S. states, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom.

The Corporate Information Services Department is seeking a dynamic and talented Customer Service Center Intern

With guidance from senior team members, the Customer Service Center Coordinator Intern supports the implementation of UHS applications. Meets deadlines and ensures continued progress toward assignment completion. Shares experience with other members of team. Receives, evaluates and assigns or otherwise addresses Acute Care hospital and Corporate user requests for assistance regarding problems related to IS systems in accordance with department problem resolution and escalation protocols.

Key Responsibilities include:

At Citadel Securities, Software Engineers design, develop, and maintain the advanced technology that powers our firm and allows us to challenge the impossible in trading.

As an intern, you’ll get to challenge the impossible in technology through an 11 week program that will allow you to collaborate and connect with senior team members and our CEO Peng Zhao. In addition, you’ll get the opportunity to network and socialize with peers at iconic venues.

Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, complex and highly technical team environment
Intellectual curiosity and passion for solving challenging problems using technology

Opportunities available in Chicago, New York, London
About Citadel Securities

Citadel Securities is a leading global market maker across a broad array of fixed income and equity securities. Our world-class capabilities position us to meet the liquidity demands of our diverse group of institutional clients in all market conditions. In partnering with us, our clients, including asset managers, banks, broker-dealers, hedge funds, government agencies and public pension programs are able to gain a powerful trading advantage and are better positioned to meet their investment goals.

The team makes its mark every day from our offices around the world: Chicago, New York, London, Hong Kong, Toronto, Shanghai, Sydney, Dublin.

Full Job Description
As a Product Management Intern, you are part of the team that sets the vision and strategy for the RTI product portfolio and manages the product life cycle that transforms that vision into reality. In this role, you will develop a deeper understanding of IIoT connectivity while working across multiple RTI teams to help discover, build and launch product capabilities. Your responsibilities involve driving projects for the RTI Connext product suite—our secure, real-time connectivity platform for the Industrial IoT—including:

Researching and capturing market and product requirements for industry-specific development workflows and improving out-of-the-box customer experience.
Developing go-to-market strategies and plans for new capabilities.
Creating sales and marketing content to support our field teams.
Updating and implementing PM processes (in tools like Confluence, Jira and Salesforce).

Real-Time Innovations (RTI) is the largest software framework provider for smart machines and real-world systems. Our software runs the largest power plants on the continent, connects perception to control in over 200 autonomous vehicles, drives the new generation of medical robotics, controls hyperloop and flying cars, and provides 24x7 medical intelligence to hospital patients and emergency victims. We are the best positioned small company in the world to create the very real future of intelligent, distributed systems.

RTI leads the world market for software that connects real-world devices. Our diverse and global workforce believes in working hard and enjoying the journey. We recognize employees for their achievements, offer great opportunities for career growth and development, and provide the tools they need to succeed. We also offer great benefits and flexibility. We commit to making your life as satisfying as your career. And, RTI’s team is unmatched; our collaborative, transparent, and creative culture truly sets us apart from the rest.

We solve some of the greatest challenges in technology. Our mission is to transform industries: automotive, medical, power, defense, and control. Our core values emphasize excellence, teamwork, and your potential. Few small companies can truly claim to make the world run better like RTI. Come help make a real difference.

Responsibilities
Understand and analyze RTI market, customer and product needs to identify product gaps and opportunities.
Translate product opportunities into technical requirements and product backlogs.
Work with engineers to build and launch new features.
Develop sales & marketing tools, including product collateral, getting started procedures, presentations, competitive analysis, videos and blogs.
Qualifications
You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science or related technical field. Business administration coursework is nice to have.
You have excellent problem-solving, organizational, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.
You have a passion for creating and analyzing products through understanding customer needs and market opportunities.
You have some software development experience and are comfortable compiling and running a HelloWorld application.

About RTI

We have a collaborative and inclusive environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers. Our culture embraces transparency, learning, and fun. We offer an attractive compensation package consisting of competitive salary, benefits, vacation bonuses, and equity participation.

RTI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color national origin, sex, age status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

position: Research & Development Intern, Petroleum Engineering & Computer Science
description:
Full Job Description

About Ulterra Drilling Technologies

Ulterra is the largest pure-play, independent supplier of PDC drill bits to the oil and gas industry. Originally founded in 2005 and strategically headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas, Ulterra is the market share leader in North America and one of the fastest growing PDC drill bit companies in the world. With field service locations all throughout the United States, Canada, and international, Ulterra is advantageously located near the drilling activity to provide direct support to operators across the globe. Ulterra is dedicated to the complete design, manufacture, and delivery of customized drilling solutions and application specific technology with unmatched speed-to-market. In addition to supplying operators with consistent quality and innovative designs, Ulterra works alongside operators to target any performance limitations to ensure monetary efficiency and performance productivity.

With over 400 employees worldwide, Ulterra strives to earn the trust of our customers through customer support and consistent performance. Spanning across offices and manufacturing facilities around the globe, Ulterra is a company of people and it’s our people that make the difference. Ulterra takes pride on engaging our employees to create innovative solutions by collaborating with one another and our customers to make a difference in the oilfield. It’s this empowerment and collaboration that fuels our innovation and sharpens our competitive edge.

Position

Research & Development Intern, Petroleum Engineering & Computer Science

Job Description: Individual responsibilities for this position will center on leveraging experience from E&P drilling engineering towards the creation of valuable software assets for use internally to Ulterra and externally to our valued customers.

This includes:

1. Conducting research and exploring valid options to initiate the creation of a machine learning computer vision program that can evaluate and provide actionable recommendations from our database of dull pictures and information.

2. Assisting in the creation of web-based dashboards and evaluation software that improves the understanding and usage of drilling data acquired from Ulterra drill bits.

To be successful as an R&D intern, you must be highly self-motivated, proactive, have working knowledge of petroleum engineering, the inner workings of E&P companies, and software programming, and a drive to learn, build, and innovate on new methods that execute successful value creating campaigns.

  • Knowledge of JavaScript
  • Strong communication skills (written & oral)

Intern: Data Governance

The DMG Data Governance team is currently looking for an individual who has passion for data discovery, modeling, design, curation, interpretation, cataloging and controlling. The top candidate will be adept with modern data platforms and a hands-on expert at mining data using complex tools and software, analyzing that data to find trends, and effectively communicating insights to stakeholders. They will need to work with stakeholders across the organization to uncover the processes that generate, transform, and distribute data. They will be the key resource in defining quality, control, and metadata standards for all enterprise data assets. It is a role that combines hard skills like SQL, data modeling and statistics with soft skills like communication, analytical thinking and problem-solving.

Job Summary
Data Governance Intern will support the broader Data & Analytics organization and is responsible for establishing, operationalizing, and sustaining a program that identifies, defines, manages, and publishes data standards and policies for enterprise data assets material to the success of DMG.
Master Data: Working with Data Owners, Product Owners and Product Engineering to ensure the uniformity, accuracy, stewardship, semantic consistency, and accountability of the enterprise's official shared master data assets. Responsibilities include:
  • Schema mapping
  • Product codification
  • Data enrichment
  • Data aggregation
  • Hierarchy management
  • Business semantics management
  • Data security & regulatory compliance
Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with business and DMG analysts to understand data and business process.
  • Help create data policies, standards, adoption strategies and communication plans.
  • Perform data analysis and document processes to enrich and standardize data values.
  • Participate in the development of data governance products for identifying, monitoring and remediating data quality defects.
  • Create taxonomy for cataloging data governance & quality rules and build data quality rule inventory.
Education & Experience:
  • Actively pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in information technology, computer science, business intelligence or business administration, with 1-2 years completed.
  • Experience with data governance, data quality with an emphasis on developing and implementing data standards, policies, practices, and procedures that lead to improved data integrity.
  • Basic knowledge of SQL.
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, including the ability to effectively present to internal audiences.
  • Proficiency with PC applications for data analysis. Experience using Microsoft Office Suite, with strong Excel skills.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple assignments, work independently and take initiative on assigned projects.

ERT is a global data and technology company that minimizes uncertainty and risk in clinical trials so that customers can move ahead with confidence. With nearly 50 years of clinical and therapeutic experience, ERT balances knowledge of what works with a vision for what’s next, so we can adapt without compromising standards.

Full Job Description
Organization:
The Bail Project is a national nonprofit designed to combat mass incarceration by disrupting the money bail system one person at a time. The Bail Project’s National Revolving Bail Fund provides free bail assistance to low-income individuals who are legally presumed innocent, and whom a judge has deemed eligible for release before trial contingent on paying bail. We enable our clients to return home to their families and communities while awaiting their court dates, connect them with community organizations that can assist them in accessing resources, and provide reminders and assistance to ensure that clients return to court for their court dates.

The Program:
The Intern and Volunteer Program invites members of the community, 18 or older, to intern with The Bail Project. All individuals who intern with TBP will be members of a cohort and that cohort will work with TBP for 2 months. All interns will be expected to participate in educational opportunities, community-building events, and other cohort activities. Interns will be expected to work 10-15 hours a week based on their availability. All interns will begin work on June 1, 2021. This is a hard start date and we encourage all candidates to consider this requirement carefully.

Position Summary:
TBP is seeking an individual with an interest in criminal legal system reform and improving outcomes for incarcerated and returning community members to assist with several data and research projects to improve TBP’s knowledge of system operations and community resources. This individual will also provide data input support by utilizing Salesforce.

Hours: 10-15 hours per week, flexible schedule

Term: June - July 2021

Start Date: 6/1/21

End Date: 7/30/21

Reports to: Volunteer and Intern Coordinator

Compensation: $15 an hour.

Responsibilities:
Document team referrals to social service providers on Salesforce.

Document client experiences with social service providers on Salesforce.

Use case lookup system to vet potential clients and provide recommendations to Bail Disruptors

Use court records and client records to improve TBP understanding of which clients retained private attorneys rather than public defenders and the impact that had on their cases.

Use court records and client records to determine which judges set bail for TBP clients.

Analyze and present preliminary findings on the degree to which judicial discretion plays a role in determining initial bail affordability and subsequent bail forfeitures for TBP clients.

Research client criminal backgrounds to understand past charges in relation to current charges.

Develop a list of community institutions and direct service agencies throughout TBP’s service area that may be willing to partner with TBP in providing support for TBP clients, advocate for the use of said institutions and agencies to the team, and add to the database within Salesforce.

Research and connect with activist organizations working on criminal justice reform that clients may be interested in joining and advocate for the value in promoting said organizations.

Participate in cohort events geared towards education around social justice, policy, nonprofit management, connection, and professional development.

Engage in weekly or bi-weekly check-ins with supervisor to evaluate progress, identify next steps, etc.

Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
You are driven, highly organized, and have a deep commitment to The Bail Project’s mission to eliminate race- and wealth-based disparities in our criminal justice system. We’re looking for someone who is comfortable working independently or in a team-based setting, and with a strong commitment to our clients.

To excel in this role, you likely bring the following:
Passion for understanding and changing the system of mass incarceration and criminal justice

Familiarity or personal experience with the local criminal justice system a plus

Interest in data or computer science

Basic computer skills and familiarity with spreadsheet software (Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel preferred)

Some experience with quantitative research

Must be well-organized and professional

Familiarity with Salesforce a plus

How to Apply:
Interested applicants should submit a resume and cover letter. In the cover letter, please address the following:

Why do you want to intern with The Bail Project?

Please share 1-2 experiences that highlight why you would be a strong candidate for this internship and how you meet the qualifications for the position.

No emails, faxes, or phone calls, please. Applicants will be notified regarding whether or not they have been selected for an interview. Applications without cover letters will not be processed.

The Bail Project is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and actively seeks the candidacy of people of color, women, LGBTQIA people, and formerly incarcerated individuals. We are committed to inclusive hiring and dedicated to diversity in our work and staff.

Note: This position should ideally be filled by an undergraduate or graduate student, someone directly or indirectly impacted by the bail system, or an individual coming from an internship-providing institution. Only candidates who live within the state in question will be considered for this role. For example, if the internship you are applying for is based out of Missouri, you must already live within Missouri.

Quantitative Researchers at Citadel Securities apply advanced statistical techniques to complex data sets to model markets, test hypotheses, and create proprietary trading algorithms. As markets continuously evolve, Quantitative Researchers keep Citadel Securities at the forefront of the industry by constantly adapting models and strategies to identify market opportunities around the globe.

As an intern, you’ll get to challenge the impossible in research through an 11 week program that will allow you to collaborate and connect with senior team members and our CEO Peng Zhao. In addition, you’ll get the opportunity to network and socialize with peers at iconic venues.

Conceptualize valuation strategies, develop and continuously improve upon mathematical models, and help translate algorithms into code
Back test and implement trading models and signals in an active, live trading environment
Use unconventional data sources to drive innovation
Conduct research and statistical analysis to build and refine monetization systems for trading signals

Advanced training in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or another highly quantitative field (Bachelors, Masters, PhD degree)

Experience with NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB), distributed computing (e.g. MapReduce), and analytical packages (e.g. R, Matlab)

Citadel Securities is a leading global market maker across a broad array of fixed income and equity securities. Our world-class capabilities position us to meet the liquidity demands of our diverse group of institutional clients in all market conditions. The team makes its mark every day from our offices around the world: Chicago, New York, London, Hong Kong, Toronto, Shanghai, Sydney, Dublin.

Full Job Description
Who we are:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people love to businesses, schools, and government organizations. After watching hundreds of users struggle to deploy, update, and secure Apple computers, iPads, and iPhones in business and in the classroom, we knew there had to be a better way to handle such pesky IT functions. Removing the barriers of technology and empowering doctors to treat patients, teachers to teach, and businesses to thrive.

Today, more than 34,000 customers from more than 150 countries rely on Jamf to help them succeed with Apple. We don’t say we are the best, but we strive to be the best. We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for making people’s lives easier, paving the way for a better Apple experience in government organizations, hospitals, businesses, and schools.

What you’ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work.The Technical Support Intern position is an opportunity for individuals to compliment school curriculum and gain additional knowledge and experience. The role is key for learning the areas of software product knowledge, contact resource management, company structure, the technologies in the IT process and developing excellent customer service skills. During your time with Jamf, you will sharpen your professional skill set in a fast-paced technology company experiencing outstanding growth.

Responsibilities

Aid in the Service Desk functions, answering the General Support phone line and creating support cases to provide solutions
Apply problem solving skills and knowledge of company software to perform client support to facilitate solutions
Aid in the active development of an internal facing Wiki
Support and troubleshoot issues relating to system configuration, application usage, and software implementation
Create different software configuration & infrastructure environments in a development lab to troubleshoot client issues

Bachelor Degree, in progress; pursuing a degree in of Information Technology, Quality Assurance, Technical Writing and/or Software Engineering preferred (required)
Great written and verbal communication skills
Ability to analyze issues and use judgment to make decisions
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
Capacity to work well with groups and as an individual
Working knowledge of Apple platform is preferred
Possess positive attitude with an ability to learn new technologies
Creative problem solving skills
Flexible along with the ability to operate within a fast-moving environment
Demonstrate practical experiences

How we help you reach your best potential:
We are progressive, but laid back. You are free to be you and work how you work best. Here, you manage your own day and your own work style.
Be your own self-starter. We support each other no doubt, but we thrive taking initiative and are empowered to roll up our sleeves, dig in, and push forward.
Everyone has a voice, and everyone can make a difference, our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 34,000 global customers with the best Apple Device Management solution in the world
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us at a 96% customer retention rate
20 of the Top 25 Fortune 500 companies rely on Jamf to do their best work.
We are relentless, but we are selfless. You can create and be creative, dig in, break it down, and troubleshoot to help others make sense of technology.
Best – in – class training in professional growth and product knowledge.

You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don’t point fingers or pass blame. You take responsibility for your actions, are open, and respect others. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You put people first. You are a good person, someone who just wants to do the right thing.

Why Jamf?
Our mission is simple; we help organizations succeed with Apple. At Jamf, we put people first. We focus on the human before we focus on the technology. We are just good people that have it in their gut to do what’s right – for our customers, our employees, and our communities.

Get social with us: Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter & YouTube

Full Job Description
Job Summary:
Why choose an internship with Wellmark? We strive to offer meaningful work that assists in your professional development and provides value to the team. You will gain valuable experience within the health insurance industry and put the skills and knowledge you’ve acquired in school to practice this summer during our 2021 Summer Internship Program. What’s Data Analytics & Governance at Wellmark? This opportunity is in Data Governance which resides within the broader Business Analytics team and works heavily to improve the quality of the data in the data warehouse by influencing data decisions within both Projects and Application Change Requests, as well as to help identify and resolve data issues in production. We believe strongly in continuously improving both our processes and our people, and in creating a work environment that is both effective and enjoyable to work within.

What projects might I support? Although subject to change, examples of projects are included below:

Support the implementation of a new enterprise Metadata Management application (data about data!) in Informatica EDC and Axon
Support the initiative to expand data quality monitoring & management within a data tool such as Informatica Data Quality (Informatica Analyst/Developer) by setting up rules and building out alerts, scorecards and dashboards
Support Data Governance reporting through the build out of Power BI dashboards

Ability to understand Wellmark's approach to data management and governing data quality
Work with modern data management and data governance tools (may include SAS as well)
Gain exposure to business analytics and business intelligence practices
Work closely to manage, maintain and enhance data sources behind the scenes from consumption

I’m interested! What’s next? Review the qualifications below. If the position is a match with your background and interests, please submit an application for review.

This internship will start in May of 2021 and be onsite in Des Moines, Iowa or potentially virtually pending Wellmark's return to office strategy. Position Description

The Intern of Content & Marketing Insights will be working across the Content Insights and Marketing Analytics teams under the Insights & Analytics department to help guide Starz’s global OTT expansion in content and marketing strategy through data analytics and business intelligence initiatives.

The intern will work with the Content Insights team primarily to track and analyze the competitive landscape on linear, and streaming platforms. The role will include an introduction to Nielsen reporting as well as experience with data queries using SQL. The intern will also support the Content Insights team to create PowerPoint presentations that provide in-depth analysis on Starz content performance.

The intern will be working with the Marketing Analytics team to gather, analyze, and present insights to guide marketing positioning and media buying decisions. This role will work with multiple social and audience insights tools, have hands-on experience with data warehouse using SQL, work with Tableau to build business intelligence projects, and present the insights to the department leadership.

This role involves technical analytical skills, but also requires clear communication with non-technical colleagues.

Responsibilities
Support Content Insights team in tracking competitive brands and reporting findings and/or trends
Help track and identify content performance demographics
Support team in creation of PowerPoint presentations that provide a visual narrative and actionable insights for Starz programming and the broader content landscape
Support trailer release and premiere social insights from data gathering, QA, analyzing, to communicating insights
Work with external partners to ensure the required data is loaded and ready for analysis
Support audience research to identify key behavioral, demographic, and attitudinal traits to inform the development and targeting of future marketing campaigns
Required Skills
Basic analytical and modeling skills including proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint
Basic data visualization skills with a strong preference towards Tableau
Strong communications skills, including the abilities to translate complex customer data into meaningful insights
Statistical background including model building experience a significant plus
Enrolled in B.A. or B.S. programs in relevant fields such as Communications/ Business Communications, Marketing, and/or technical fields such as Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or Economics
A basic understanding of the TV/Film landscape and interest/passion for a variety of content
Internship Details

Lionsgate Virtual Remote Internship Program –Summer 2021

Program Dates: June 21st–August 27th, 2021

The Lionsgate Internship Program is designed to identify, recruit and develop a diverse group of students that will gain meaningful educational experiences, professional growth and career opportunities.

**Lionsgate has remote/virtual positions available within the United States to qualified individuals who live in certain areas of the United States. Remote opportunities are not available in all areas-specific questions about virtual/remote positions will be discussed during the interview process with your recruiter.**

Please read the following information carefully before submitting an application.

Important Dates

The Lionsgate Summer 2021 Internship program dates are: June 21st–August 27th, 2021.

All interns are required to attend orientation on Monday, June 21st, 2021.

Details
All internships will be virtual and remote
Interns can work a minimum of 30 hours/week and up to a maximum of 40 hours/week
Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree during the length of the program

To Apply

Submit a 1-paged resume (PDF preferred)

Explain why your background and experience make you a great fit for Lionsgate & Starz
About the Company

Starz (www.starz.com), a Lionsgate company (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B), is a leading global media and entertainment company that produces and distributes premium streaming content to worldwide audiences across subscription television platforms. Starz is home to the flagship domestic STARZ® brand, STARZ ENCORE, 17 premium pay TV channels and the associated on-demand and online services, including the highly rated STARZ app. With the launch of the STARZPLAY international premium streaming platform and STARZ PLAY Arabia, Starz is expanding its global footprint in a growing number of territories. Sold through multichannel video distributors, including cable operators, satellite television providers, telecommunications companies, and other online and digital platforms, Starz offers subscribers more than 7,500 distinct premium television episodes and feature films, including STARZ Original series, first-run movies and other popular programming.

Business Unit Overview

Starz
With the Company aligning its studio operations behind the growth of its streaming business, Starz has become one of the pre-eminent modern premium global streaming platforms. Offering subscribers more than 7.500 television episodes, including Starz original series and provocative documentaries, along with a broad catalogue of first-run movies, Starz is taking the lead in delivering relatable premium content that makes it the platform of choice among a wide spectrum of female, African-American and other historically underserved audiences. Its focused brand, premium content and freedom from legacy relationships position Starz at the forefront of the new bundles emerging throughout the media ecosystem, a compelling value proposition to complement virtually every kind of subscription platform.

Distinguished by its successful and focused content strategy, top programming, exceptional curation and speed to market, Starz has quickly scaled its platform to become one of the most widely distributed and fastest-growing OTT services in the world, with OTT subscribers making up more than half of its global subscriber base. The Starzplay International premium subscription service offers a “best of global SVOD” content portfolio in more than 50 countries throughout Europe, Latin America, Canada, Japan and India through a bespoke and expanding network of distribution partners. The Starzplay Arabia joint venture is one of the leading SVOD operators in the fast-growing Middle East and North Africa region. The proprietary and highly-rated Starz app, a proven hit with U.S. audiences, continues to roll out internationally.

EEO Statement

In addition, Lionsgate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Lionsgate will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and federal law.

Company Overview:
Schafer Industries has been a leading manufacturer of precision, high-quality machined parts since 1934. Today, Schafer Industries is well established as a premiere manufacturer of superior, low noise gears as well as axles, transaxles, brake assemblies, and other critical components for application in recreational and off-road units. Schafer Industries is one of the few manufacturers of integrated solutions in the off-road vehicle market. Some of the industries Schafer serves with customer gears, axles, and other driveline components include aerospace, agriculture, automotive, construction, defense, gas and oil, material handling, medical instruments, mining, power train, and recreational vehicles.

Schafer Industries is currently seeking a CRM (Customer Relationship Management) Intern. The position will be based out of its South Bend, Indiana facility, with the flexibility to be based out of the Roscoe, Illinois facility or the Fredericktown, Ohio facility. The position is available immediately but there will be flexibility for candidate who cannot start until the end of the school semester.

Job Summary

The CRM Intern’s primary responsibility is to complete the implementation, data loading and training of the Salesforce CRM software system. The intern will report directly to the Vice President of Sales and Business Development.

Essential Functions:
  • Create the training documentation necessary for the integration of the new software.
  • Provide training and support to all necessary employees during the integration process.
  • Assist in the development, modification, and maintenance of the output reports from the CRM system and establish a method of distribution for these reports.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

  • Intern should be in their third or fourth year of a bachelor’s program in either computer science, marketing, sales, or general business administration.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills and comfortable communicating and providing training for multiple employees both remotely and in the plant.
  • Basic understanding of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
  • Travel may be required to other Schafer plants but on a limited basis.

Full Job Description
Internship Overview

The TIBCO Information Security Team works with teams from across TIBCO, including engineering, cloud operations, IT, legal and sales, to ensure continuous improvement in our security posture. The Security Team’s efforts directly affect both TIBCO corporate and our customers. The team has a diverse set of responsibilities to ensure that risks that affect TIBCO customers as well as TIBCO itself are identified and remediated.

This opportunity is for a self-starting individual to join a professional corporate information security team and participate in all areas of information security including risk assessment, requirements analysis, secure design principles, secure software development and validation, and communications.

What You'll Do

Assess internal security processes, recommend changes or enhancements for identified security gaps, and implement recommendations

Align security standards, frameworks and policies with overall business and technology strategy

Work across the company to identify and implement privacy requirements

Collaborate with developers and other internal groups to identify, prioritize and develop improvements to secure software development tooling and practices, including our application security automation tooling

Work together with cross functional teams of Software Developers, Systems and Network Administrators, and others to improve the security of TIBCO product offerings

Make improvements to the open-source vulnerability management software built in Python/Django that we use to aggregate and report on our security findings

What You Will Learn

Information security requirements that affect a multinational software development organization

The identification, analysis and prioritization of risks that affect enterprise software development and their associated remediations

Industry standards and regulations that affect enterprise information security

The tools and technologies that corporate security teams like ours use to manage the complexity of a fast-moving security environment

Who You Are

? Pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Information Security, Computer Science or similar field

? Pride yourself on being an excellent communicator

? Enthusiastic and driven to learn new concepts and participate as part of a cooperative and professional information security team

? Classroom experience or better in programming (e.g. Golang or Java) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, Bash, JavaScript or similar languages) is desired

? Successful past internships at enterprise software companies are a plus

? Prior compliance, security policy and procedures experience is a plus

Full Job Description
Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We’re the company behind the world’s fastest satellite internet service, with technology that’s helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.

We’re looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You’ll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world’s first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today.

Location

This team typically works out of the Carlsbad office location. If you are offered a full-time opportunity after the internship concludes, you may be required to relocate in the future. Please consider your interest in this location for future opportunities when you apply.

Job Description
As part of the Information Technology Global infrastructure team, you’ll build a breadth of knowledge including software development, container orchestration, monitoring and solutions to improve the way Viasat’s infrastructure interacts with our employees. You will design, develop and support systems to automate our infrastructure, help gather and visualize key data, and build front ends and self service solutions to make infrastructure easier to consume and more efficient. Our Infrastructure teams work on a variety of cloud platforms, from AWS, Azure, to on premise OpenStack for compute and platform services. We’re actively improving our ability to ingest all of these disparate systems into a centralized and scalable database, and develop a front end to ingest that data with a heavy emphasis on UX Design to ensure we’re meeting our stakeholders needs. The team works heavily with our container, cloud, and networking teams with and offers a broad exposure and understanding around the infrastructure that sits underneath the cloud everyone works in.

Our ideal candidate would have experience with python, linux, front end web development, leveraging APIs, UX design techniques, and desire to automate complex processes. They are curious, have a willingness to learn new things, and aren’t afraid to peak under the hood to see how our underlying infrastructure operates and be involved in improving those processes.

Job Responsibilities
Flexibility to work among different project teams dedicated to:
System infrastructure development; scripting, automation, data visualization & dashboarding
Network function virtualization, orchestration
Data analytics & cloud application engineering
Distributed enterprise software applications
Cybersecurity software & systems engineering
Web application engineering

Requirements
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math & Computer Science, and/or a related field
Previous experience or exposure to Cloud Technology, Automation, Full Stack, Apps, and/or Front-end
Experience using Python, Java, Linux, and/or C/C++
Ability to commit to a 10-12 week summer internship
Preferences
Courses or experience related to front-end design
Knowledge/Experience with deployment tools like: Amazon Web Services, Azure

The QuaXigma was launched with a mission to make A.I accessible and affordable and deliver AI Products/Solutions at scale for the enterprises by bringing the power of Data, AI, and Engineering to drive digital transformation. The Data Scientist Intern (Fleet and Retail) is responsible for applying advanced analytics including both descriptive and predictive analytics to support AI product development in fleet management and retail business such as driver risk, fuel optimization, retail foot-traffic prediction, demand forecast, cross-sell and up-sell, etc.. Key Responsibilities

  • Design and build models/algorithms to drive predictive & prescriptive analytics to accelerate business decisions and drive real-time analytical insights

We’re looking for a Full Stack Intern to help the RippleNet Engineering Team design and build applications that enable us to build out our growing network and improve the global payments infrastructure. This role would be perfect for someone that wants to work at an agile startup that leverages blockchain technology to create value for fintech customers. You’ll be working closely with our engineering, product and UX teams to ensure a high-quality service for our highly engaged members.

Ripple’s product offering is currently built using and React, TypeScript, GraphQL, and Java Spring microservices. You will work directly with our senior engineers to add new features, fix bugs, and support releases for our flagship user experience - RippleNet Home. This is an opportunity to learn best practices and gain experience in architecture, system design, and product development.

What you’ll do:
Build client-facing web applications integrating with blockchain technologies and all forms of currencies (traditional as well as crypto)
Participate in the full software development lifecycle, from software design and requirements gathering, to unit and integration testing
Integrate with the XRP Ledger, a distributed ledger built on the principles of Blockchain and its native currency XRP, the fastest and most scalable digital asset
Work with teams across the organization, including product, design, marketing, integrations, ops, customer success, legal etc

What we’re looking for:
Junior and Senior students studying towards a degree in CS, EE or a related technical field
Experience in either front-end or backend development, but interest in how to build full-stack applications.
Our stack is ReactJS (TypeScript) on the front-end and Java (Spring) on the back-end and. We don’t discriminate by language but you could have built side projects in Java (Spring), ReactJS, Node.js, Ruby on Rails, or Python (Django)
Interests: entrepreneurship, economics and financial markets, strong work ethic, creative thinking, systems thinking, cryptography, creative logic, fast-paced environment

WHAT WE OFFER:
The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact
Design laptop, software and headphones on loan
Regionally competitive hourly rate
Weekly company meeting - ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
Team outings to sports games, happy hours, game nights and more!

WHO WE ARE:
Ripple provides one frictionless experience to send money globally using the power of blockchain. By joining Ripple’s growing, global network (RippleNet), financial institutions can process their customers’ payments anywhere in the world instantly, reliably and cost-effectively. Banks and payment providers can use the digital asset XRP to further reduce their costs and access new markets.

With offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Mumbai, Singapore, São Paulo, Reykjavík, Washington D.C. and Dubai, Ripple has more than 300 customers around the world.

At Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), we don't just believe in the power of technology, we believe in the power of people when technology works for them. We believe in applying new thinking and ideas to improve the way our customers live and work.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is seeking a highly motivated Software Engineering Intern (Servers). This is a unique internship for current Purdue students as it is full-time over the summer working for Hewlett Packard Enterprise remotely in the US and continues part-time (10-20 hours a week) during the school year on Purdue’s campus (West Lafayette, IN) while you continue your degree.

The position may work with our High Performance Computing (HPC), Volume Compute, or Cyber Security groups as part of the team participating in production level projects including automation of tests, analyzing & resolving technical issues, writing new code or revising current code for HPE programs, communicating with internal HPE and 3rd party teams.

Education and Experience Required:
Computer Engineering or Computer Science majors at Purdue University
Desire to learn new skills and highly motivated.
Very organized and ability to communicate effectively with others.
Python coding experience.
Strong writing skills and ability to document work.
GPA above 3.0

Hewlett Packard Enterprise Values:
Partnership first: We believe in the power of collaboration - building long term relationships with our customers, our partners and each other

Bias for action: We never sit still - we take advantage of every opportunity

Innovators at heart: We are driven to innovate - creating both practical and breakthrough advancements

Full Job Description

Data Science Intern
at Sovrn
Boulder Office

We are looking for a Data Science Intern for May 6, 2021 - August 6, 2021 who will support the Data Science team by developing and delivering projects that fulfill immediate business needs. You’ll gain solid exposure to the digital advertising ecosystem as part of our dynamic internship program and expand upon your professional skill set in a unique and fun environment.

About the Job

As a Data Science intern you will be responsible for assisting the Data Science team in projects that span Sovrn’s multiple business lines, and your assignments will involve a mix of data engineering, data science and machine learning tasks. The anticipated project involves incorporating web site category data into Sovrn’s Ad Exchange, employing this data for auction optimization, and assessing its resulting monetary impact.

What you’ll be doing:
Developing a method of mapping content category data from one taxonomy to another
Automating ETL of re-mapped data into Sovrn’s Ad Exchange
Analysis of subsequent yield impacts resulting from category data
Training of a machine learning model to use this category data as a feature
Analysis of resulting machine learning model performance
Learning many new skills and data science techniques

About You

You’re driven, thoughtful, and curious. You can break down your work into steps, and can sequence deliveries for maximum velocity and impact. You assess risks, but are not afraid to act. Above all, you’re open to learning.

The successful candidate will have:
Undergraduate coursework in pursuit of a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science or a related field.
Facility with Python and SQL.
Familiarity with one or more of: AWS, GCP, Bash, or Git.
Experience with Google Drive programs such as Docs, Sheets and Slides.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong organizational skills and capable of prioritizing and managing daily duties.
Ability to efficiently multi-task and to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees to maximize performance, creativity, problem-solving and results.
Desire for professional growth opportunities and to be in a dynamic learning environment.
Excitement about being part of a fast-paced Data Science team.
Ability to work 40 hours a week.
Ability to commit to a term of no less than 3 months.

Bonus Points

Familiarity with one or more of Java, Scala, JavaScript, and C/C++.

This position reports to: Director, Data Science

Location: Boulder, Colorado

We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of accountability impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We expect you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we're looking for.

Full Job Description
Personalis is a rapidly growing cancer genomics company transforming the development of next-generation therapies by providing more comprehensive molecular data about each patient's cancer and immune response. Our ImmunoID NeXT Platform® is enabling the development of next generation immuno-oncology therapeutics and diagnostics.

Summary:
You will join a team of bioinformaticians and software engineers whose mission is to develop robust, high-performance software that can accurately and reliably analyze large volumes of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. Our bioinformatics software provides the foundation for a wide range of clinical and research applications, from genetic disease research, to cancer clinical diagnostics, to leading-edge developments in immuno-oncology.

We are offering to a summer internship opportunity to promising STEM students who have a professional interest in Bioinformatics. This internship will offer you direct exposure to real world industry applications of bioinformatics to the rapidly growing immuno-oncology space and will focus on developing you in areas which your academic curriculum typically does not.

The internship will be approximately 10-12 weeks in duration (dates flexible depending on your academic calendar); the emphasis of this internship program is to gain exposure to best research & development practices in Bioinformatics.

Responsibilities:
Support R&D efforts to explore new methods and technologies in a cutting-edge Bioinformatics Engineering group at a rapidly growing company. You will be responsible for a summer project from conception through feasibility, development, testing and rolling into "production".

During the 10-12-week program, you will:
Understand current challenges in immuno-oncology, Bioinformatics, Next Generation Sequencing and high-performance computing and where you can best focus your academic research for direct industry applications.
Select your summer project with direct industry application(s).
Create a project plan for your summer project with tight scope and realistic deadlines.
Leverage Agile development practices as more information about your summer project becomes available during the development process.
Participate in our weekly Kanban planning and semi-weekly standups.
Leverage Linux, Bash and Python for effective bioinformatics analysis on large datasets
Version control software source code and file system resources and gain exposure to common versioning/branching strategies.
Learn coding standards/conventions and undergo at least one code review of your project before the Bioinformatics Engineering group.
Write regression and unit tests to ensure desired functionality over time.
Automated deployments & automated testing, signifying your work is ready for "production".
Presentation of your summer project to the Personalis Research & Development group.

Please note that all Bioinformatics Engineering group members are required to work on Pacific Standard Time.

A successful intern will emerge with valuable, hands-on industry experience and find him/herself in a fantastic position for a career in private sector Bioinformatics Research & Development.

Requirements:
In progress degree (Bachelors, Masters or Ph.D.) in a STEM field.
Candidate must desire a career in Bioinformatics.
Exposure to Bioinformatics not required, although candidates without a Bioinformatics background must have a strong Mathematics, Statistics and/or Computer Science background.
The ideal candidate will be completing their junior year of undergrad, or first year of graduate school at a top university and will be returning to school in the fall.
Software development experience
Experience with one common scripting language such as Python or Perl.
Familiarity with Unix/Linux or OS X command line
Due to COVID-19 pandemic, this position will be 100% remote but only available to candidates residing in and authorized to work in the United States.

Application process:
Submit your resume at https://boards.greenhouse.io/personalisinc by April 25th, 2021.
No cover letter necessary.
Please list one academic reference under the box "If you were referred, please provide Personalis employee name:".
Please indicate the institution, like "Dr. von Neumann (Princeton University)"
References will not be contacted unless you are selected for the interview process.
Candidates selected for interview process will be informed by April 30th
Video interviews and programming assessment through week of May 3-5th
Start/end of internship flexible based on academic calendar.

Personalis is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabilities. Personalis offers a competitive compensation package.

When you are part of the team of more than 75,000 extraordinary minds at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will do work with broad societal impact: helping customers find cures for cancer, protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe, and much more. Your work will have real-world impact. Thermo Fisher is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. The IT Digital Engineering AI Engineer Intern position provides an opportunity for students who are currently pursuing a data science, computer science, computer engineering, or similar degree to get hands on experience working with AI engineers and software developers in a fast-paced environment.

Software Developer Internship

Role Overview

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Developer Intern to join our grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development lifecycles in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, or similar

· A foundational first principles understanding of software development concepts like algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Java/Groovy, Scala, or R

· A self-starter attitude to pro-actively tackle substantive and meaningful challenges

Desired Skills

The required skills are intentionally short and sweet, but there are a number of additional desirable attributes that we are also on the lookout for:

  • An understanding of power systems and power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • The development of REST-based microservices
  • Familiarity with agile-based software development

Software Engineer Intern
Department: Engineering
Location: 320 Congress Street, Boston MA 02210
Join a company and be a key part of the Engineering team that provides the hardware, software, and certification platform that brings AI to aviation applications and enables unmanned air vehicles to be used for transportation and other missions.
Autonodyne is a well-funded young company focused on becoming the kernel for unmanned aerial flight. With a world-wide perpetual software license in place with Avidyne that covers $100M in aviation technology IP, expertise in aviation system certification, and a growing customer set, Autonodyne will develop, and if desired by the customer, certify systems and software for civil and defense aircraft that operate without a traditional pilot. While there are many companies providing products and services to the growing UAS market, we already have all of the necessary building blocks and move at higher clock speeds than the competition and are unique in that we are also experts in national and international certification which allows these products to be flown anywhere. Autonodyne is located in Boston, Massachusetts (and has a presence in Concord MA, Burlington MA, Dayton OH, Colorado Springs CO, and greater Los Angeles CA) and is looking for engineers who are interested in swarm/network topologies, artificial intelligence algorithms and the UAS/UAV/Unmanned space. This position reports to the Vice President, Engineering.
This is a paid internship position. Timing of the internship is flexible – it may run during the summer months or academic year, or both.
Position Summary:
As a software engineering intern, your principal work assignments will involve investigating various network topologies that will enable unmanned aerial vehicles. Often described as a swarm, Autonodyne is looking at optimum architectures for airborne vehicles. You will encode one or more algorithms for integration into simulation environments, and if the customer timing works out, potentially install that code onto actual flight platforms.
This work would be integrated with the Autonodyne mission computer software and control station software and the various augmented reality devices we are working with for control of the formation/swarm.
The Autonodyne products are currently a mix of existing product sets and many that are under development or haven’t started yet. We place a strong emphasis on graphical user interfaces (GUI) and natural user interfaces (NUI) along with high levels of autonomy and artificial intelligence.
We will be a focused team of engineers principally based in the Boston area working on a number of rapid-paced, high-energy programs. In short, you will be at the center of making the products a reality.

Responsibilities:

  • Become a subject matter expert in network and control topologies or work with engineers who are
  • Design control methodologies for large formations of autonomous, collaborative vehicles
  • Implement the designs in code (C/C++, iOS, Unity, etc)
  • Integrate these algorithms/code with the rest of the mission management system that is designed to be hosted on the vehicle mission computer hardware and control station system

Full Job Description
Company Description

DNAnexus is the leading cloud-based SaaS company serving the global life science community. DNAnexus' health informatics platform serves customers across a spectrum of industries — government, biopharmaceutical, clinical diagnostics, healthcare, and academic research in 33 countries with compliant protection of data, privacy, and intellectual property. The platform provides a secure and collaborative environment where genomics, multi-omics, and real world data can be combined with clinical data at scale, providing new insights that can lead to improved diagnostics, new targeted therapies and better patient care. For more information on DNAnexus, please visit www.dnanexus.com or follow the company @DNAnexus.

Job Description

We're looking for interns to join our technical scientific outreach team! If you are an intellectually curious and driven student in a graduate or undergraduate program looking for a rewarding internship that combines your passion for science, product development and business, we should talk.

The Science Intern will work closely with the rest of the DNAnexus Research Platform Team to build tools, example resources, training and other documentation to support research done with data provided by UK Biobank and other large datasets.

This includes:
Making cool projects related to machine learning, data federation, spark, image analysis and other realms of data science digestible by and presentable to data scientists
Understanding and then organizing optimal workflows for bioinformatics and image analysis for researchers who will use the UK Biobank dataset.

Qualified applicants will be currently enrolled college or graduate students in a bioinformatics or another genomics/computational biology-related degree program OR is in a business or software management program with a strong passion and background related to bioinformatics, genomics, or precision medicine.

Requirements:
Experience with or exposure to software development.
Experience with rapid software prototyping
Self-starter approach to work, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed objectives
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to prioritize and execute on initiatives
Detail-oriented with high standards of quality work
Ability to interact and team with others is essential. Must be able to partner within organization to generate results
Demonstrated analytical capabilities including the ability to analyze and report metrics
Technical skills, one or more or the following: R, Python, Jupyter Notebooks, github, bioinformatics pipelines

Qualifications

Education and Certifications:
Currently attending a graduate or undergraduate program in Bioinformatics, Genetics, Computational Biology,, Computer Science, or business (MBA or Technology Management preferred).
For business or computer science majors, coursework or another degree in science (biology, genetics, bioinformatics) medicine or healthcare a plus.

Additional Information

Why Our Work Is Important

Science is social. It is about discovering, sharing and building upon the findings of others. For biomedical data to realize its true value, it requires openness and collaboration, but at the same time a secure environment to handle sensitive information. DNAnexus provides a dynamic platform where data protection, analysis, and collaboration allow for open conversations, new ideas and precise outcomes. Precision medicine is the future. Join our team and be a part of this revolution, delivering on the potential to predict, prevent, and personalize treatments through precision medicine.

If you are interested in joining our team, please apply today!

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Temporary Summer INTERNSHIP: CSAIL ALLIANCES: May 20-August 9 (12 weeks)

Hours: 30-40 per week

For Summer 2021 we are seeking a full-time Summer Intern to join the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) in the CSAIL Alliances department. CSAIL is the largest lab at MIT with over 1000 people, 60 research groups and 900+ active projects. The work at the lab spans artificial intelligence, robotics, cryptography, natural language processing, networks, languages, machine learning, computer vision and more.

CSAIL Alliances is responsible for creating and maintaining productive relationships in all research areas with industry, organizations and governmental entities. Alliances is a global program that includes the CSAIL Alliance Program (CAP); Startup Connect; Startup Connect Plus; and research initiatives FinTech@CSAIL, SystemsThatLearn@CSAIL (AI), MachineLearningApplications@CSAIL, and MIT Future of Data, Trust, and Privacy; recruiting activity, professional development programs and the Industry Visiting Researcher program.

This is a paid temporary summer position (30-40 hours per week) located on the MIT campus in Cambridge, MA (or remote?). Anticipated timeframe for the assignment is from May 20-August 9, 2021.

Responsibilities:

The Alliances intern will assist the Marketing and Communications and Client Relations teams with tasks supporting content creation, data management, research curation, updating collateral, and additional tasks if needed.

  • Pull the latest news from the Startup Connect, Startup Connect Plus, and CSAIL Alliances members on a weekly basis to update website content
  • Update the open source technology search tool with the latest projects available from CSAIL PI’s, researchers, and students
  • Review and edit current startup database and collateral (Start-up Hunter’s Guide)
  • Identify new CSAIL startups and startup resources
  • Research and document CSAIL start-up success stories (Where are they now?)

MIT has a large startup ecosystem with many independent parts. We are seeking an intern with strong research and writing skills to map out the ecosystem and write the book to help MIT students, startups and affiliated companies better understand the resources and how to make connections. Savvy internet research, ability to synthesize information, interviewing skills and excellent writing skills is a must.

The Summer Intern will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience, work with top researchers and connect with technology leaders from a variety of companies and industries.

No experience necessary. Open to Rising college sophomore or Rising junior with a degree in process. Journalism, communication, English, Marketing, Business, or related with strong writing skills, interest in technology, and desire to learn more about a start-up ecosystem. A positive attitude and solid team player is required. Excellent writing and communications skills. Familiarity with databases a plus.
