Full Job Description
Accelerate Your Career

Drive global technology

With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.

We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.

From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.

CDK Global Stability meets Agility. CDK is the largest technology provider to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. We’re hiring to support your growth and ours.

CDK Global works with a broad variety of technologies, so your Java, .Net, C#, C++, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 or other technology interests and skills may work well with us. We build software that is used by consumers to shop for cars, as well as the systems used by about two-thirds of the dealers in the US to take care of their customers and their interface with the manufacturers. The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full-stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.

The most important thing to us about you is that you have a passion for working on cool stuff. And can work well with cool people. We love the energy shown in your projects (and those side projects you do, ‘just for you’). And we love that you can get in a room with amazing developers and learn and teach and contribute and grow. Our Agile, collaborative approach is important to everyone here.

As a Software Development Intern you will help to engineer the next generation of enterprise class software solutions at CDK utilizing a broad range of the latest technologies. The intern's primary responsibilities include development of application, services and components. The internship will provide hands-on technical experience and will work with other team members, architects and product owners in the early and continuous delivery of high quality software products that delight our customers. Students must be a result oriented individual, who can use agile software development principles to delight our customers.

Requirements:
Software skills
A great attitude
A drive to learn and innovate
Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree in progress, ideally as a Sophomore or Junior
The ability to participate in a Summer internship program of 10+ weeks (June start date)

Location: 4460 Legendary Dr., Destin, FL 32541

#GreenLightYourCareer

Questions? Contact Molly Szabo at molly.szabo@cdk.com

CDK Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer; Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled.

We believe that diversity in all aspects of business leads to strength.

CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.

At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

position: R&D Web Developer Intern - Data and Analytics
description:
Full Job Description
Company Description
Since Kitware’s founding in 1998, we have built our business on open source software. We have built a strong reputation by partnering with leading organizations to create and support large, collaborative, and open communities that use and improve our open source software platforms. When working with our customers, these platforms enable us to focus on innovation and deliver customized solutions cost effectively, without vendor lock-in, and with our customers maintaining full ownership and control of their products.

Kitware is seeking to hire Research and Development Web Developer Intern for our Data and Analytics team, to work on open source, scalable web and distributed processing projects, analytics, data science, and visualizations. We do most of our development in a combination of Python and JavaScript.
Qualifications
Python or JavaScript programming, preferably both
B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. students in computer science, computer engineering, math, physics, statistics or a related field
Demonstrated software development expertise, e.g., active GitHub account, successful school or co-op projects, programming competitions, or documented open-source contributions
Enthusiasm for programming, learning, problem solving, and tracking technology trends
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills
Understanding of algorithms, computer systems, programming language constructs, and design patterns
Preferred Qualifications
Web software development experience, including REST services, web application security, client side HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript (ES6, Webpack, Vue.js or other reactive frameworks). Experience with web server environments such as Node.js, Django, or Flask is highly desirable
Database management systems such as MySQL, SQLite, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra
Familiarity with high-quality software processes, such as unit and integration testing, revision control (git), documentation, software review, and continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Travis, CircleCI)
Data science tools, including NumPy, Pandas, Jupyter/IPython, R, machine learning tools, data cleaning tools
Third-party cloud service platforms such as Amazon AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Microsoft Azure
DevOps tools, such as Docker, Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, etc.
Good eye for aesthetic and intuitive user interfaces
Web visualization technologies such as D3, WebGL, and HTML5 Canvas
Additional Information
Kitware’s Data and Analytics group is distributed between our three offices in Clifton Park near Albany, NY; Arlington, VA near Washington DC; and Carrboro near Chapel Hill, NC. Interns at the Clifton Park headquarters will enjoy visiting beautiful and vibrant areas including the Adirondack Mountains, entertaining Lake George region, and historic Saratoga Springs. There are numerous outdoor music concerts and festivals during the summer in the area. Compensation is competitive and work schedules are flexible within an open atmosphere which encourages collaboration.

Kitware actively subscribes to a policy of equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, protected veteran status, uniformed service member status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

Full Job Description
SWBC continues to be a strong and stable employer during these challenging times and a vast majority of our interviewing and on-boarding is being done virtually due to COVID-19.

SWBC is seeking talented students to join our College Intern Program in San Antonio, Texas. This is an exciting opportunity for college students who are motivated and eager to learn within their educational field of study.

Interns will gain practical hands-on experience and training that will provide an opportunity for growth, learning and development within the financial services industry. Full-time and part-time paid internship opportunities will be available in numerous departments, which may include: Information Technology, Accounting, Marketing, Human Resources, Mortgage, Insurance, Legal, PEO, Lender Placed Operations, Financial Institutions, Investment Services and Training. We will develop, teach, mentor, and support your efforts throughout the internship. Our interns are given projects that are impactful and meaningful to SWBC, so interns will feel they are a valued team member of our SWBC family.

Essential duties include the following:
Build awareness and gain exposure to the Financial Services Industry while growing your talents.

Learn key technical skills to apply acquired knowledge and assist in problem solving.

Gain practical, hands on experience that will provide an opportunity for growth.

Work alongside and shadow team members while expanding your knowledge base with the ability to further develop your skills.

Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Cyber Security, Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related program at an accredited university/college.

Expected graduation date of December 2021 or later.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Strong analytical and interpersonal skills required.

Detail oriented and possess excellent follow up skills.

Must be organized and adapt well to change.

Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.

Passion and desire for learning and a proactive energy for getting things done.

Display maturity and a high level of professionalism.

Full Job Description
Clarity Partners is seeking emerging technology professionals who have strong technical instincts combined with the ability to think and communicate about how technology is used in the real world. This will be an onsite Summer 2021 paid undergraduate internship in downtown Chicago in one of four tracks:

Software Developer Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you learn highly marketable “full-stack” software development job skills in current software development platforms including Microsoft C#.NET, React/Redux, Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server. You will learn on-the-job as you work on projects for our exciting clients under the guidance of senior Clarity application developers. If you demonstrate progress and self-sufficiency, you will be given the opportunity to develop code independently. You will also be exposed to cloud hosting, API microservice, and DevOps concepts and will certainly see your code in production.

Qualifications for Software Developer Track

Completed at least 2 years of a 4-year BS degree in Computer Science or related field
Excellent programming skills. Experience with object oriented programming languages, preferably C#, Java, or C++
Knowledge of data structures and understanding of database transactions
Ability to translate technical specifications into working code, and solve complex problems with consideration of the end user experience
Familiarity with system architectural concepts
Written and verbal communication skills

Analytics Developer Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you learn to model, capture, transform, and visualize data using prevailing commercial and open-source platforms such as Tableau and Microsoft Power BI. You will have a real world opportunity to work on Clarity’s long term consulting engagements with our clients to leverage their numerous data sources for predictive policing and other analytical applications.

Qualifications for Analytics Developer Track

Completed at least 2 years of a 4-year BS degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or related field.
Strong Data Modeling skills
Understanding of comparative statistics and predictive analytical concepts
Hands on experience with SQL database concepts (tables, views, foreign key constraints, indexes, outer joins, etc.)
Some programming skills

Technical Manager / Analyst Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you learn information technology project management processes and tools. You will gather customer requirements, write functional specifications, analyze use cases, and validate requirements for real world technology projects. You will learn how technology projects work in the real world under an Agile development approach and be exposed to DevOps management and communications tools. You can also gain marketable job skills as you apply your understanding of data structures and relationships to industry leading business intelligence and reporting platforms. You will shape the outcome of actual enterprise software development work and see your results in production.

Qualifications for Technical Manager / Analyst Track

Completed 2 years of a BS degree in Management or related field with some technical course work
Understanding of project/program knowledge areas such as schedule management, scope management, communication management, quality assurance, etc
Strong analytical, diagramming, organizational, writing and documentation management skills
Some Data Modeling skills and an understanding of transaction processing concepts
Strong written and verbal communication skills, leadership role in extracurricular activities

UX Designer Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you apply your graphical and interface design skills to responsive web applications, websites, and mobile applications. You will work along side our software developers to produce design artifacts that will be merged into the developers’ code. You will have the opportunity to interact with end users and guide the application developers toward more intuitive and usable interfaces while learning the constraints of what is practical. You will learn how to design for industry leading and highly customizable content management systems such as Drupal and Wordpress.

Qualifications for UX Designer Track

Completed 2 years of a BS degree in Computer Graphics Technology or related field
Experience with relevant professional tools such as Adobe Illustrator
Strong instincts for usable and intuitive designs for web applications and websites
Candidates for this particular track will be evaluated on their portfolio of past design work. Portfolio entries need not be specific to user interfaces but should convey some degree of artistry. Having this portfolio published and accessible on the internet is highly encouraged

Full Job Description

Company Overview

Spectral MD, Inc. is an uptown Dallas based medical tech company that answers clinical questions through the development of data pipelines, artificial intelligence (“AI”) algorithms and proprietary optical technology. Spectral MD Inc.’s DeepView® Wound Imaging System (“DeepView®”) is an advanced medical device that uses a digital approach to deliver images of blood flow under the skin's surface to look deep into the body without ever touching the patient. Our mission is to provide physicians with the ability to accurately assess perfusion and wound healing potential for patients suffering from burn wounds and peripheral artery disease.  We are scientists, engineers, and forward-thinkers striving to modernize the management of wound care.

Position Overview

Spectral MD, Inc. is seeking a highly motivated Data Engineering Intern with experience in AI or deep learning, imaging or computer vision algorithms. The Data Engineering Intern will gain exciting real-world data engineering experience at a thriving and rapidly expanding company. This candidate will be responsible for developing new machine learning and deep learning algorithms that will impact future Spectral MD products focusing on medical imaging device data.

Primary Duties/Responsibilities

  • Work with a cross-functional technical team composed of frontend developers, software engineers, data scientists, and product designers.
  • Design and evaluate developed algorithms, summary research findings in technical documents or papers.
  • Perform data cleaning for machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
  • Research and develop novel machine learning and deep learning models for medical imaging data analysis, especially in the field of image classification and semantic segmentation.
  • All other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Required Education and Experience:

  • Must have a Bachelor’s degree and currently or recently enrolled in a Master’s or PhD program in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
  • Coursework on AI/Deep learning, imaging or computer vision algorithms

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Good understanding in machine learning and deep learning algorithms
  • Excellent programming skills in Python, C#, C/C++, CUDA
  • Knowledge of common deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch, Tensorflow, or Keras.
  • Knowledge of basic computer vision tasks of image classification, semantic segmentation, and object detection.
  • Knowledge of transfer learning, domain adaption and data augmentation
  • Knowledge of processing multispectral image data
  • Implementation of machine learning and deep learning algorithm in latest research papers
  • Good publication record

Spectral MD, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and participates in E-Verify. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, gender identity, results of genetic testing, service in the military, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Full Job Description
Power the Possibilities
The CDK Global technology team is looking for collaborative innovators who are passionate about making their mark on emerging enterprise software products. We’re building and developing cloud technology for the automotive retail industry
that will change the landscape for automotive dealers, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and the customers they serve.

Be Part of Something Bigger
Each year, more than three percent of the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) is attributed to the auto industry, which flows through our customer, the auto dealer. It’s time you joined an evolving marketplace where research and development
investment is measured in the tens of billions. It’s time you were a part of something bigger.

We’re expanding our workforce – engineers, architects, developers and more – onboarding early adopters who can optimize, pivot and keep pace with ever-evolving development roadmaps and applications.

Join Our Team
Growth potential, flexibility and material impact on the success and quality of a next-gen, enterprise software product make CDK an excellent choice for those who thrive in challenging, fast-paced engineering environments.
The possibilities for impact are endless. We have exceptional opportunities to evolve our industry by driving change through new technology.

If you’re ready for high-impact, you’re ready for CDK.

We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.

The Drive Platform Engineering team provides the tools, training, and services needed by application teams in the areas of operating system development, tools, testing, building, and deploying software.

As a Software Engineering intern on this team, you will be using industry standard tools such as: source control (Git), build management (Bamboo), deployment (Bamboo/Ansible), portfolio (Jira), and testing (Sonar, Saucelabs). You'll have opportunities to learn about DevOps technologies such as Terraform, AWS, Python, etc. The internship will provide hands-on technical experience as you work with other team members, architects and product owners in the early and continuous delivery of high-quality software products that delight our customers. Student must be a results oriented individual, who can use agile software development principles to achieve the desired business outcome.

Requirements:
Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree program
Current Juniors with an anticipated graduation date after December 2021
Software skills
A great attitude
A drive to learn and innovate
The ability to participate in a summer internship program of 10 weeks (June-August)

CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.

At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Professional with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Problem-solving skills
Attention to elegant design, performance, user experience, scalability, clean and documented code is required

Visually able to communicate the product or service in a manner that will appeal to the target audience, while supporting the IQAir brand and image
A positive attitude a must!

Responsibilities

Work closely with Project Managers and other members of the Internet Development team to build and refine functionality for web applications, developing websites from initial installation through configuration and theming.

description:
Full Job Description
Siemens Industry Software Inc.

Strategic Student Program (SSP)

Discover your career with us at Siemens Industry Software Inc!

We are a leading global software company dedicated to the world of computer aided design, 3D modeling and simulation— helping innovative global manufacturers design better products, faster! With the resources of a large company, and the energy of a software start-up, we have fun together while creating a world class software portfolio. Our culture encourages creativity, welcomes fresh thinking and focuses on growth, so our people, our business, and our customers can achieve their full potential.

We’re currently recruiting interns for our summer 2021 Strategic Student Program. Our internship program will allow you to find a career path that most inspires you. Here, you will apply your education to solve real-world problems, and turn theory into practice. At Siemens, our goal is to empower our students to become the next leaders of our company.

We have positions available in software development & data management. More information on our specific roles are included in this document.

Baseline Requirements:
  • Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future sponsorship by the company
Preferred sophomore or pre-junior status
Available to work remotely during summer 2021

Perks:
Victorious daily ping pong tournaments
Paid volunteer time off
Employee discounts at our top customer sites
Networking with our global leaders
Mentorship from senior engineers
Individual career development planning
Professional and technical workshops
Leadership opportunities
Potential for full time offers after university graduation and completion of the program

Lifecycle Collaboration Software

Teamcenter Visualization

As part of our Lifecycle Collaboration Software (LCS) organization, you will become immersed in development projects for our Teamcenter software. Teamcenter is our database management software, which allows customers to digitally manage product and manufacturing data. Teamcenter virtually connects and enables collaboration with key players across the product development line. The Visualization Development team is specifically responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of software programming for Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) products. In LCS you will help define new approaches and create fresh functionality. Your responsibility will be to engage in one of our innovative teams by:

Designing and developing new software features for the Teamcenter Visualization suite of products
Creating tools, utilities and script development for automation
Diving into requirements definition, in-depth analysis, and code implementation
Providing solutions to customer issues
Studying for a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, or a related Engineering field
Driven and self-motivated
Able to understand complex technical problems and simplify them into easy-to-use solutions
Strong coding skills in C/C++, preferably in the Microsoft Visual Studio environment
Able to write clean, robust, and maintainable code
Able to work as part of a geographically dispersed team
Experience on Unix and Linux preferred
Experience using CAD/CAM/PLM software preferred
Experience in graphics programming preferred
Championing all steps in the software development lifecycle (specs, design, construction, test planning and execution)
Validating software quality through unit testing, writing automated tests, and bug fixing
Analyzing data and reviewing our build/test metrics to make key recommendations

Organization Requirements:
  • Studying for a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
  • Strong coding skills in C, C++, JAVA, and XML.
  • Commanding grasp of JavaScript, HTML, and AngularJS
  • Have experience with, or able to learn, development environments (Microsoft Visual Studio), development tools, and Windows/Unix environments
  • An interest in automated testing and test driven development
  • Write clean, robust and maintainable code
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent oral and written communications
  • Inspire collaboration / curious question asker
  • Driven and self-motivated with ability to work independently and conduct research under guidance
Organization: Digital Industries

Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc.

Full Job Description
Accelerate Your Career

Drive global technology

With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.

We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.

From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.

CDK Global Stability meets Agility. CDK is the largest technology provider to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. We’re hiring to support your growth and ours.

CDK Global works with a broad variety of technologies, so your Java, .Net, C#, C++, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 or other technology interests and skills may work well with us. We build software that is used by consumers to shop for cars, as well as the systems used by about two-thirds of the dealers in the US to take care of their customers and their interface with the manufacturers. The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full-stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.

The most important thing to us about you is that you have a passion for working on cool stuff. And can work well with cool people. We love the energy shown in your projects (and those side projects you do, ‘just for you’). And we love that you can get in a room with amazing developers and learn and teach and contribute and grow. Our Agile, collaborative approach is important to everyone here.

As a Software Development Intern you will help to engineer the next generation of enterprise class software solutions at CDK utilizing a broad range of the latest technologies. The intern's primary responsibilities include development of application, services and components. The internship will provide hands-on technical experience and will work with other team members, architects and product owners in the early and continuous delivery of high quality software products that delight our customers. Students must be a result oriented individual, who can use agile software development principles to delight our customers.

Requirements:
Software skills
A great attitude
A drive to learn and innovate
Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree in progress, ideally as a Sophomore or Junior
The ability to participate in a Summer internship program of 10+ weeks (June start date)

Location: 4460 Legendary Dr., Destin, FL 32541

#GreenLightYourCareer

Questions? Contact Molly Szabo at molly.szabo@cdk.com

CDK Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer; Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled.

We believe that diversity in all aspects of business leads to strength.

CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.

At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

position: Software Systems Intern - System Analytics and Observability
description:
Full Job Description
Internship Project Description

The intern at RefleXion will be part of the Software Systems team that is responsible for the full stack (UI, DB, server, embedded, network, etc.) of our system's health and performance. Primary task for this position will include researching, prototyping and developing tools to produce data from our distributed real-time system for analytics. The goal from the intern's project will provide our organization with observability (i.e. answering the "why" in addition to the "what" when issues occur) from our system. This goal will benefit the organization with:

Root cause analysis
Machine pattern recognition

Intern Responsibilities and Learning Objectives

Researching, prototyping and developing tools to produce data from our distributed real-time system for analytics to provide the following features:
Capture system characteristics into defined models.
Identify system anomalies.
Analytics to help with identifying root cause of anomalies.

Minimum Qualifications

Senior in an undergraduate program for computer science or related engineering field.
Knowledge and/or experience with end-to-end (Software and Hardware) system design/architecture
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Robust testing standards when verifying work
Dedication and determination to get through challenging problems
Autonomous worker that has excellent research skills
Ability to adapt and work quickly in a fast paced, high transaction environment
Ability to communicate effectively across all levels and organizations
Ability to build and maintain relationships across supported organizations
Excellent communication (written, oral), presentation and documentation skills
A passion for creating robust and reliable product

Nice to have

Graduate program for computer science and/or engineering with prior internships, co- op, or research lab work.
Linux OS, writing bash scripts and/or CLI tools
Programming experience with object oriented and functional languages
Webstack development experience
Build automation experience
Network experience
DB experience (Relational or Document-based, SQL, MongoDB)
C++, Make
MEAN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, AngularJS, Node.js)
Jenkins
Git
Packet capturing tools (TCPdump, Wireshark, etc.)
Network packet analysis
Opentracing tools (e.g. Jaeger)
APM tools (e.g. Elastic)

Full Job Description

This job is a 100% remote, unpaid internship for college credit.

Minority Programmers Association is an international network of programmers and activists empowering underrepresented communities through STEM education, mentorship, job placement, and the development of socially impactful software solutions.

https://minorityprogrammers.com/

A key to developing impactful software solutions is designing responsive and beautiful web applications. As a result, the Minority Programmers Association is proud to announce the creation of a UI/UX Design Intern (Unpaid) position.

We are seeking a determined and creative designer who is passionate about changing the world through technology!

This role will report to the Senior Software Engineer at the Minority Programmers Association.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the brand.
  • Work with designers and engineers to brainstorm application ideas.
  • Collaborating with the marketing team, and internal and external designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user
  • Accurately translate user and business requirements into digital prototypes
  • Adhering to style and brand standards on typography and graphic design
  • Ensuring user experience determines design choices
  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows, and sitemaps
  • Develop wireframes and prototypes on applications such as Figma
  • Testing UI elements such as CTAs, banners, page layouts, page designs, page flows, and target links for landing pages
  • Ensure that web applications are optimized for various devices.
  • Reflect on data to analyze trends
  • Create test models to gauge user enjoyment and engagement.
  • Execute layout adjustments based on user feedback
  • Generate reports on project statuses and thoroughly track on ClickUp (project management tool)
  • Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
  • 15-20 weekly hours (with the ability to make synchronous daily standup meetings) for at least a 3 month commitment

QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

  • Must be 18 years or older
  • Currently enrolled or completed Bachelor’s degree in UI/UX Design, Graphic Design, Software Engineering, Data, Computer Science, or related field(s) with a Cumulative GPA of 2.7 or above OR completion of full-stack coding bootcamp
  • A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms
  • Available to work before or on April 12, 2021
  • Understanding of key design principles.
  • Understanding of SEO principles
  • 1+ year experience in UI/UX and graphic design
  • Passion for technology and community
  • Strong attention to detail + deadlines.
  • Passion to learn and advance career
  • Must have own laptop and phone
  • Not afraid to ask questions!

position: Intern to focus on the cause of Homelessness and Make a Difference!
description:
Full Job Description

Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Homelessness

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Homelessness.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Homelessness Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Homelessness.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Homelessness and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekends

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

  • College Credit

  • Remote interview process

Full Job Description
Paya (Nasdaq: Paya) is a leading provider of integrated payment and frictionless commerce solutions that help customers accept and make payments, expedite receipt of money, and increase operating efficiencies. The company processes over $30 Billion of annual payment volume across credit/debit card, ACH, and check, making it a top 20 provider of payment processing in the US and #6 overall in e-Commerce. Paya serves more than 100,000 customers through over 2,000 key distribution partners focused on targeted, high growth verticals such as healthcare, education, non-profit, government, utilities, and other B2B goods and services. The business has built its foundation on offering robust integrations into front-end CRM and back-end accounting systems to enhance customer experience and workflow. Paya is headquartered in Atlanta, GA, with offices in Reston, VA, Fort Walton Beach, FL, Dayton, OH, Mt. Vernon, OH and Dallas, TX.

Job Description

Paya is looking for an undergraduate student to assist the PayaConnect Development Team for the summer of 2021. The ideal candidate will contribute in producing, coding, testing and troubleshooting feature for our primary payment gateway. This individual should have development knowledge and experience necessary to design and implement algorithms for handling data-centric workflows and should have knowledge in API development. This is a fulltime internship.

Cornerstone Project:
The interns will be focusing on Payaconnect’s logging and monitoring functionality. This includes standardization on the platform as well as additional monitoring functionality. This project will include development of production code that will be incrementally added to PayaConnect platform during the summer.

Essential Functions

Conduct coding in Node.js/Javascript and typescript.
Resolves bugs and improve overall system performance.
Collaborates with other development teams to implement long term fixes that will reduce overhead and allow better scalability of system.
Works in a product development team.
Assist in analyzing systems software problems and help with developing technical solutions.
Evaluates issues as part of a wholistic review of system health, stability and scalability.
Participate in system validation and testing.
Attend meetings to help document any discussions, requirements, needed follow-up, etc.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Development experience with either NodeJS or PHP
Familiarity with API integrations
BDD and/or TDD experience is a plus.
Understanding of SQL (MySQL)

Education and Experience

Enrolled in four-year program with 3.0 cumulative GPA preferred
Major in Computer Science or related field
Strong communication and customer service skills

Paya is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Matterport is leading the digital transformation of the built world. Our groundbreaking spatial computing platform turns buildings into data making every space more valuable and accessible. Millions of buildings in more than 150 countries have been transformed into immersive Matterport digital twins to improve every part of the building lifecycle from planning, construction, and operations to documentation, appraisal and marketing.

We're excited to announce that Matterport will be publicly listed on NASDAQ this year. It's an exciting time to join us!

The Business Development team is responsible for helping accelerate the growth and monetization of Matterport by identifying, executing and managing partnerships and strategic initiatives in collaboration with product and other cross-functional teams.

Matterport is looking to hire a Business Development Intern to play a critical role in developing and executing on a platform partnership strategy focused on driving Matterport adoption and usage within key vertical markets.

We are seeking an individual who can help with several key initiatives including market data/opportunity analysis, financial modeling of growth opportunities in key technology segments, developing strategies to optimize business opportunities in existing markets, and more. This role will require you to have an understanding of various technology markets and our ecosystem in order to collaborate with technical stakeholders and create meaningful experiences for our business partners.

The position can be remote while our headquarters are in Sunnyvale, California and reports directly to the Sr. Manager of Business Development.

#LI-Remote
Responsibilities
Assist in analyses to evaluate active and prospective partnerships (e.g., market opportunity sizing, industry trends, competitive due diligence, GTM strategies, and modeling of deal economics)
Support planning and execution of new partnerships by collaborating with cross-functional teams (e.g., Product, Engineering, Distribution, Operations & Legal)
Conduct research to assess competitor positioning and landscape of strategic partnerships
Support the development of presentations for internal stakeholders and senior management
Basic Qualifications
Current Rising Junior or Rising Senior pursuing BA/BS in Business, Economics, Information Systems, Computer Science or related degree.
Strong written and verbal interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with senior stakeholders
Hard-working, quick learner with a passion for the technology industry
Preferred Qualifications
Currently pursuing an MBA degree graduating in Spring 2022
Prior work experience in a strategic, corporate/business strategy consulting role at a technology company
Strong skills in financial modeling and an understanding of corporate finance and accounting principles
Detail-oriented individual who is self-motivated and able to prioritize multiple responsibilities
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and through ambiguous challenges
Results-driven with a high level of teamwork, accountability, and integrity
Creative problem-solver, both quantitatively and qualitatively
Ability to work with all level of management and cross-functionally within Operations, Legal, Finance, Accounting, Marketing, Product, Engineering and Business Development teams
Experience with Google Slides and Sheets and/or Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel
At Matterport, we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate it and recognize the value it brings to our customers and employees. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most meaningfully to each other’s success.

Application Instructions

If you're interested in this position, please complete an Employment Application.

If you have any questions, please contact us at careers@ElectricomInc.com.

Position Description

ElectriCom, a Utility Construction company founded in 1960, has experienced continuous growth since its inception. The company takes pride in focusing on family values both in the workplace and with its customer base. ElectriCom seeks employees with the ability and desire to work for a progressive company. ElectriCom offers a competitive package for both wages and benefits. Employees who show quality performance will have the opportunity for advancement and further development of skills.

This role is based in our home office in Paoli, Indiana. This is a dual-purpose role, focusing both on employee training and development, as well as the employee lifecycle specifically relating to the onboarding and offboarding processes. To be successful in this position you must be self-driven, passionate about helping people, and maintaining exceptional data entry accuracy. In many cases you will work with both multiple levels and functions within the organization. This position will report primarily to Training & Development, but have direct ties to Human Resources.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

CDK Global works with a broad variety of technologies, so your Java, .Net, C#, C++, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 or other technology interests and skills may work well with us. We build software that is used by consumers to shop for cars, as well as the systems used by about two-thirds of the dealers in the US to take care of their customers and their interface with the manufacturers. The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full-stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.

The most important thing to us about you is that you have a passion for working on cool stuff. And can work well with cool people. We love the energy shown in your projects (and those side projects you do, ‘just for you’). And we love that you can get in a room with amazing developers and learn and teach and contribute and grow. Our Agile, collaborative approach is important to everyone here.

As a Software Development Intern you will help to engineer the next generation of enterprise class software solutions at CDK utilizing a broad range of the latest technologies. The intern's primary responsibilities include development of application, services and components. The internship will provide hands-on technical experience and will work with other team members, architects and product owners in the early and continuous delivery of high quality software products that delight our customers. Students must be a result oriented individual, who can use agile software development principles to delight our customers.

Requirements:
Software skills
A great attitude
A drive to learn and innovate
Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree in progress, ideally as a Sophomore or Junior
The ability to participate in a Summer internship program of 10+ weeks (June start date)

Location: 4460 Legendary Dr., Destin, FL 32541

#GreenLightYourCareer

Full Job Description
Company Summary

TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 23 000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.

PURPOSE:
This position fulfills the purpose of an intern level software design engineering position. It includes limited responsibility for the testing and/or modification of code for assigned engineering design and development projects which may include legacy, new and improved products/systems and analysis of OEM products. Responsibilities include ensuring that the product function and accuracy meet the specified requirements as assigned.

Participates in engineering solutions as part of a NMP/PLM projects, in accordance with TechnipFMC standards, procedures, processes, schedules, and budget, with a continuous concern for quality, targets, and customer satisfaction.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Receive instructions from Design Engineering Management and/or Responsible Design Engineer as assigned.
  • Perform assignments with instruction on specific objectives. Evaluate, select, and apply standard software design coding practice, engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria, utilizing good judgment.
  • Prepare test plans to fully exercise features of products according to provided specifications. Execute test plans and evaluate results.
  • Troubleshoot problems and issues with products.
  • Expand capability with engineering tools including learning new tools as assigned.
  • The position of Intern in Mechanical Engineering is provided to allow Engineering Students the opportunity to practice in industry while assisting in activities within the mechanical development discipline.
  • Position accountability is based on close supervision and includes responsibility for accuracy of design and calculations, success of proposed adaptations and modifications to existing designs, and follow-up to completion of assigned activities.
  • Procedures exist that outline the processes utilized for product development/design and modification.
  • Writes and issues technical specifications and reports related to own activities within SSE projects and/or operations.
  • Assists in the development of design basis for projects and/or manufacturing operations.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Intern must be pursuing a Bachelor Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering Technology and be at least a second year (Sophomore) student.
  • The incumbent should have knowledge of Linux, JavaScript, C/C++ and assembly language programming.
  • Knowledge of Python, and communications protocols such as TCP, TCP/IP, HTTP, MODBUS, MQTT (etc.) is considered a plus.
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Analytical and logical reasoning.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office products.
  • Work is performed primarily in an office or lab environment.
  • During the course of product witness testing or product testing there may be exposure to flow test lab conditions where there may be more significant temperature swings, higher level of noise and dust, and exposure to petroleum products.
  • Basic knowledge in engineering
  • Show evidence of good organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Service/Customer oriented
  • Ability to work in a team-oriented environment and project culture
  • Good command of English

Responsibilities:
Apply modern Data Analysis and AI technologies and development tools to search, categorize, filter, and profile tens of thousands of operations that are extensively traced through a heavily multi-threaded multi-user server system. Multiple teams of embedded SW, applications SW, and signal processing engineers use this information to visualize and optimize the design.

About Litepoint

LitePoint creates wireless test solutions and services for the world’s most innovative wireless device makers, helping them to ensure their products perform for today’s demanding consumers. A leading innovator in wireless testing, LitePoint products come out of the box ready to test the most widely used wireless chipsets in the world. LitePoint works with the leading makers of smartphones, tablets, PCs, wireless access points and chipsets. LitePoint is also at the forefront of testing the burgeoning world of connected devices…the Internet of Things. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, California and with offices around the world. LitePoint is a wholly owned subsidiary of Teradyne (NYSE: TER), a leading supplier of automation equipment for test and industrial applications. In 2019, the combined corporation had revenue of $2.3 billion and employs approximately 5,500 people worldwide.

Full Job Description
Who We Are:
For more than 25 years, Aptima's mission has been to improve and optimize performance in mission-critical, technology-intensive settings. We apply deep expertise in how humans think, learn, and perform to today's challenges. Whether for fighter pilots functioning in the cockpit, medical staff in the ICU, or teams collaborating across distributed networks, our solutions:
  • Ensure synergy: between humans, the technologies they use, and the organizations within which they operate
  • Enhance productivity: through human-AI teaming, unobtrusive measurement, data analytics, and intelligent interfaces
  • Accelerate learning, training, and readiness: with precision learning that is customized, personalized, and efficient
Why Aptima?:
At Aptima, our culture is founded on three principles that our founders planted and our staff have embraced: innovation, impact, and empathy:. At our core is innovative research and development in an area that most engineering firms ignore: the human component. But innovation without application is navel-gazing—our aim is to impact the world in meaningful ways by brining those innovations to light.

We encourage entrepreneurial and creative efforts, and provide a work environment that promotes excellence through an emphasis on continuing education and professional publication. Teamwork, collaboration, and an unrelenting focus on the customer are integral to our corporate culture. Work hard. Take care of each other. Lead by example. Accept others for who they are. So while the world knows us as a company that is moving humans, technology, and AI forward, we think of ourselves as something more.

What You’ll Do:

Full Job Description
LOCATION 2006 Route 130 North Burlington NJ US 08016

Overview

If you want hands on experience working in Information Technology (IT) for one of largest off-price retailers in the nation, join the nationally-ranked Burlington Stores, Inc. IT internship program! Are you a full-time student pursuing your Bachelor’s degree? Do you have at least a 3.0 GPA? Are you interested in a career as an IT professional? Are you a self-motivated, team player, with strong planning, organizational and communication skills? If so, this may be the right opportunity for you!

As an IT intern, you’ll work in one of our HQ Campus facilities located in Florence or Edgewater Park, NJ with the opportunity to explore our Infrastructure internship track. This won’t be your typical internship experience making copies and getting coffee!

Throughout the comprehensive 10-week summer program, you’ll be partnered with an experienced member of the IT team, who will serve as your “buddy” for support and guidance as you work in the fun and fast-paced world of IT in off-price retail! You will have the opportunity to work side by side with knowledgeable professionals, gaining practical knowledge, skills, and an understanding of IT’s role in supporting many of our company’s goals.

Throughout the summer, you will participate in Leadership Development Seminars, Classroom-style trainings in areas related to your program, tours of our stores and distribution centers, and community service projects – not to mention a variety of team-building social activities to help you get to know your intern class (including an Technology specific group project with your fellow IT Interns!)

Upon graduation, many alumni of our internship program go on to join our team as full-time associates, either rejoining the team where they completed their internship program or in a different branch of the organization! We are a rapidly growing brand, providing a variety of professional development opportunities so our associates can grow with us.

Infrastructure Track– IT Support Center and Tech Services rotation – As an infrastructure intern you will gain firsthand knowledge of the inner workings of what it takes to support IT Systems in a fast paced Retail business. Your time will be spent supporting our Stores, Distribution Centers, Corporate, and Field associates, rotating between our IT Support Center and Corporate Tech Services teams. Through these experiences you will also have exposure to various Networking, Security, Telecomm, and Systems support approaches. You will participate in the team meetings and have opportunities to shadow other IT technical areas that can help determine the direction of your professional career.

Our IT Support Center is a critical support component of our business, handling over 100,000 incidents a year. Working on our IT Support Center, you will work on the front lines of our support team as a Support Technician. Some of the experience you can expect to gain:

An understanding of basic troubleshooting techniques, managing situations, and customer interaction skills that could impact the productivity of systems and associates.
Leverage various knowledgebase and technical resources to solve technical problems remotely.
Contribute to projects, process improvements and be part of a great team environment!

Our Tech Services team offers face-to- face technical support to our associates in Corporate Offices and Distribution Centers. As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to work throughout our campus locations with:

An opportunity to work in our corporate environment and fine tune your technical and customer interaction skills.
Assignments to meaningful projects that support the organizations rapid growth including deploying some of the latest technology

Candidates must be full-time students pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering (or related field) and must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above .

If you…

…are excited to deliver great values to customers every day;

…take a sense of pride and ownership in helping drive positive results for a team;

…are committed to treating colleagues and customers with respect;

…believe in the power of diversity and inclusion;

…want to participate in initiatives that positively impact the world around you;

Come join our team. You’re going to like it here!

Perks and benefits include an associate discount, free on-site gym, summer Fridays and much more! We work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. Burlington Stores, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity."

Full Job Description
Join our team! As a global leader in providing title insurance, settlement services and risk solutions for real estate transactions, First American (NYSE: FAF) is an ideal place to build your career. We have been entrusted with helping our customers achieve and protect their dream of homeownership since 1889. We believe that our people are the key to the company’s continued success, and we invest in diverse talents and backgrounds and empower our teams to achieve more than they could anywhere else. First American has created an award-winning culture and has been named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the fifth consecutive year and to more than 50 regional Best Places to Work lists. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com

Job Summary

We are looking for a Network Engineer (intern) who will assist with maintaining and administering our company's computer networks. Your primary duties will include maintenance of computer networks, hardware, software, and other related systems, performing disaster recovery operations, protecting data, software, and hardware from attacks, and replacing faulty network hardware components when necessary. You will also be working closely with the users of our network to identify potential issues and fix existing problems.

Job Summary

First American’s Internship Program is a full-time, remote, paid internship that starts on June 14, 2021 and ends August 13, 2021. The Intern will work in a program designed to help college students gain experience and develop the technical, professional and interpersonal skills that will be invaluable throughout their career. As a First American Intern you will gain exposure to working in a corporate environment within the Financial/Title Industry—balanced with intern-specific activities, executive level presentations and networking opportunities—while under the close supervision and guidance of a manager and/or mentor. For this intern role, undergraduate students are assigned significant work assignments to support a specific business function within IT.

Job Qualifications:
We are seeking College/University students enrolled in Bachelor’s degree programs with 0-2 years' of work experience. Preferred Field of Study in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or Information Systems. Network experience is a plus.

Responsibilities

Help with day-to-day activities of the Network Engineering Team
Work with senior network engineers on troubleshooting and building proof-of-concept labs
Verify and validate configurations
Review logs of devices and do basic maintenance
Assist with various networking tasks, documentation, and testing

Network engineers are responsible for building and maintaining the day-to-day operation of computer networks that companies and organizations rely on. These networks typically include an intranet, extranet, local area network (LAN), and wide area network (WAN).

To qualify, candidates will possess the following:
Current undergraduate student majoring in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Basic network knowledge
Proficiency with various operating systems
Understanding of basic networking open source tools iPerf, ICMP, etc…
Willingness to be a team player and work outside of standard hours

First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Full Job Description
Onshape is a next-generation Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) product development platform that helps businesses of all sizes modernize and accelerate their design and manufacturing processes. The cloud-native platform is the only all-in-one system that combines robust computer-aided design (CAD) with powerful data management and collaboration tools. Onshape helps extended design teams work together faster from any location and helps executives make better decisions with real-time business analytics and unprecedented visibility into their company’s operations.

Your Impact
You will help with improving the Onshape CAD system, both as far as user-facing functionality and infrastructure. The work is likely to focus on our FeatureScript language ecosystem, including writing tools for FeatureScript developers, expanding geometric capabilities, improving performance, etc. Interns will work on several projects throughout their time that will be deployed to customers, and due to Onshape’s agile and frequent release cycle, interns will often see their work in the hands of the customers before their internship is over!

Your Team
You will be part of a team that is responsible for developing functionality that provides the underpinnings of Onshape's part modeling capabilities, as well as many other aspects of Onshape, like versioning, branching and merging, collaboration, and performance. We treat interns like full time developers who just happen to be around for a shorter period of time, so an intern will be a full-fledged team member with many of the same responsibilities as a full-time engineer.

Your Day-to-Day:
Develop new code to improve Onshape
Work with UX to figure out how new functionality should work
Participate in the code review process both as reviewer and reviewee
Fix bugs both in your new code and in existing code

Basic Qualifications:
Must be enrolled in some type of degree program in one of the following or related fields: Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science.
Comfort with at least two of (JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, C++)
Experience working on a software engineering team.
Experience with geometric computation is a plus.

Learn and Grow with Us

PTC is focused on developing the workforce of tomorrow, and we offer a world class internship experience to do just that. Our internship program provides students with hands-on work experience in a fast-paced, dynamic, work environment. As an intern, you will be tasked with several impactful projects that will help you learn and develop in your field. At PTC, we believe that a strong internship program focused on growth and development, will turn the students of today into the highly skilled workforce of tomorrow. Each program has a unique structure, goals, and is designed to do just that.

PTC Company Description

PTC enables global manufacturers to realize double-digit impact with software solutions that enable them to accelerate product and service innovation, improve operational efficiency, and increase workforce productivity. In combination with an extensive partner network, PTC provides customers flexibility in how its technology can be deployed to drive digital transformation – on premises, in the cloud, or via its pure SaaS platform. At PTC, we don’t just imagine a better world, we enable it.

ALLETE is an innovative company with more than a century of experience engaged in transforming the energy landscape in the upper Midwest. Our businesses include: Minnesota Power, the largest electric utility in northern Minnesota; BNI Energy in North Dakota; ALLETE Clean Energy, a developer of energy projects with limited environmental impact; Superior Water, Light and Power in Superior, Wisconsin; and ALLETE Renewable Resources, which operates and maintains wind generation facilities in North Dakota.

What will I do?

If hired, you would join ALLETE’s Cyber Technology Services department and would assist the ALLETE Clean Energy Cyber Technology Team. ALLETE provides Interns with the opportunity to collaborate with employees, participate in real projects, learn new skills and gain valuable experience. Whatever your IT interests, if you are a motivated self-starter with a passion for digging in to the details figuring out how something works, or finding a better way of doing things, we would love to talk to you about this opportunity.

Responsibilities for the ACE Cyber Technology Intern will include, but not limited to the following:

Assist in validation and improvement of data historian and analytics systems.
Develop intelligent reporting and visualization of operational data.
Advance the monitoring and awareness of Operational Systems.
Integrate vendor documentation and specifications into Operational Data systems.

Opportunities to work with the following will also be available:

VMWare Virtualization platforms.
Industrial networking and communications protocols.
Scripting and automation tool development.

To really grab our attention, tell us about your experiences with any of the following:

PowerShell scripting, Linux shell scripting, and/or other scripting languages
Python, JavaScript or other programming languages/frameworks
Database and Data Analytics concepts
Linux systems
Cyber Security

What are the qualifications for this internship?

Must be enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering or Data Analytics with an expected graduation date between June 2021 to December 2023
Cumulative GPA: 3.0 or higher
Candidates may be subject to assessment of skills, job match, or aptitude

What is the expected duration of this internship?

The internship will be full time during summer and breaks and part time (minimum of 12 hours per week) during the school year.
This role may potentially run until candidate graduates.
Hours and duration are subject to change based on company need.
Pays $18.00 per hour

Description:
About Ameritech College of Healthcare:

A degree from Ameritech is a sign of excellence for hospitals and healthcare facilities. Focused exclusively on healthcare since 1979, Ameritech has built a reputation for producing graduates who are skillful, sought after and ready to succeed on day one. We are a smaller institution with a history of growth that operates differently with great intent. As we take our next big step forward, we seek individuals to join our team that will match our values and will adopt our vision for the future.

Our Culture

Our values of integrity, excellence, service, student centricity, and caring are woven in to our everyday activities. We treat each other with kindness and respect but do not shy away from difficult conversations. Communication is key, and Ameritech College of Healthcare focuses on winning with people.

Every month we celebrate our successes, express gratitude, acknowledge special occasions such as birthdays and work anniversaries, and launch monthly themes to help us learn, grow, and focus our community service efforts.

Time Off Philosophy

Paid time off from your first day. Employee satisfaction is important at Ameritech College, and self-directed time off is an integral part of that sentiment which helps employees lead full and meaningful lives by supporting time away from work to pursue hobbies, projects and causes, be with family and friends, and recharge the body, mind and spirit.

In addition to our progressive philosophy on time off, we have eleven paid holidays where our campus is closed: New Years’ Day, Martin Luther King Day, President’s Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Pioneer Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Day after Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, and Christmas Day.

Employee Development

Every employee partners with human resources to create a personal development plan and receive ongoing support to meet their goals. As a group we participate in ongoing training and development opportunities such as lunch-n-learns, book clubs, and quarterly special sessions.

We have a three-prong education assistance suite that offers tuition reimbursement, student loan assistance, and family member tuition reduction at Ameritech.

Benefits at Ameritech College of Healthcare:

We offer fully paid short term disability, long term disability and life insurance. Our traditional benefit line up of 401k, medical, dental, and vision are offered to you with generous employer contributions. There is an array of other optional benefits, a fully integrated employee assistant program, and pre-paid legal.

Ameritech College seeks a self-directed IT intern with a passion for technology, collaboration, and creative problem-solving. The intern will actively contribute to meaningful projects and work closely with a mentor and with senior leadership.

Work Standards

Sets high standards of performance for self, assumes responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks on time; work demonstrates a high degree of excellence and accuracy.

Analytical Proficiency

Leverages extensive knowledge of qualitative and quantitative methods to identify, organize, interpret and report data needed by organizational decision makers to achieve favorable organizational outcomes; establishes ongoing procedures to collect and monitor information.

Continuous Improvement

Identifies opportunities for improvement and originates action to improve existing conditions and processes; uses appropriate methods and systems thinking to implement solutions and measure impact.

Teamwork and Engagement

Participates as an active member of the team and works towards common goals; builds positive relationships in the workplace and participates in learning and social functions.

Organizational Alignment

Models the behaviors expected of all employees including an adherence to the mission, vision, values, and core themes of the organization; high levels of mutual respect, emotional maturity, professionalism, communication, and a drive for results.
