position: Consulting Summer Associate, Analytics & Data Strategy
description:
Full Job Description

Consulting Summer Associate, Analytics & Data Strategy
Chicago, IL; New York, NY; Remote
About Breakwater Solutions
Breakwater helps mitigate risk and gain insight from sprawling information by combining technology automation and human expertise. Our expert consulting, software, and managed services address the challenges within information governance, disputes and investigations, regulatory compliance, privacy, and cybersecurity.

Breakwater launched in 2020 with technology from IBM and private equity funding from JLL Partners. We are a global hyper-growth company. It is an exciting time to join us!
Job Summary
Summer associates will have the opportunity to work on a variety of consulting engagements, learn from technical training sessions and challenges, engage in valuable internal initiatives, and participate in social events. The program is designed to develop technical and business skills, provide hands-on consulting experience, and build relationships with professionals across the firm.
Responsibilities
Summer associates will be immersed in a real consulting experience, including skills development, team building, client engagements, and fun. To start, summer associates will participate in a series of technical trainings which will provide the foundational skillsets for client engagements and technical challenges. Summer associates will then work closely with Breakwater professionals to contribute to real client engagements, which could include designing and building technical workflows, interpreting results of data analyses, reporting findings to other project team members, and preparing client-ready deliverables. In addition to client work, summer associates will participate in technical challenges – projects based on real client issues that require critical thinking and creative problem-solving. Additionally, the internship program provides the opportunity to research new technologies and present a business case for adoption and use. Summer associates will also participate in various social events and a day of community service. Breakwater offers full-time positions to high-performing summer associates.
Skills + Qualifications

  • Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, or a similar analytical discipline
  • Analytical approach to problem-solving
  • Attention to detail
  • Critical thinking
  • Commitment to quality
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Valued, but not required, technical skills: SQL, Python, VBA, C#, Tableau

Application Instructions

Position Description

ElectriCom, a Utility Construction company founded in 1960, has experienced continuous growth since its inception. The company takes pride in focusing on family values both in the workplace and with its customer base. ElectriCom seeks employees with the ability and desire to work for a progressive company. ElectriCom offers a competitive package for both wages and benefits. Employees who show quality performance will have the opportunity for advancement and further development of skills.

This role is based in our home office in Paoli, Indiana. This is a dual-purpose role, focusing both on employee training and development, as well as the employee lifecycle specifically relating to the onboarding and offboarding processes. To be successful in this position you must be self-driven, passionate about helping people, and maintaining exceptional data entry accuracy. In many cases you will work with both multiple levels and functions within the organization. This position will report primarily to Training & Development, but have direct ties to Human Resources.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Content Developer for the LMS platform (Cornerstone).
Build content, utilizing primarily a SCORM format (Articulate), that will meet multiple needs within the organization.
Shop and select content (as applicable) from 3rd party providers.
Assist with deployment of content to our Field and Support groups.
Work with the LMS Administrator and Sr. Training Manager to refine and continue to improve/develop the LMS platform.
Facilitation of classroom, virtual, and hands-on training.
Thorough data collection and exceptional data entry is a MUST for accuracy and compliance.
HR records audits to ensure accuracy and compliance.
Strong organization is a MUST because there are typically multiple new hires to process at the same time daily.
Identify and implement process improvements.
Perform other duties as requested by Manager.
MUST maintain strict confidentiality.
Position Requirements
High School diploma required.
Current college student preferred – pursuing a degree in Human Resources, Education, Communications, Computer Science, or related field.
Previous Training, HR, and onboarding experience preferred.
Previous experience with content development and deployment preferred.
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook) required.
Ability to multi-task while maintaining accuracy.
Ability to communicate in professional manner, both verbal and written, is required.
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.
Willingness to travel, both overnight and day trips, if needed.

Full Job Description
THE COMPANY

For more than 170 years, National Life Group (“NLG”) has aimed to keep our promises to provide families stability in good times and in bad. Throughout that history, we have provided peace of mind to those families as they plan their futures.

As a mission-driven business, the cause of what we do is as important as the products we sell, and our cause is a very simple one, directed at the people who live and work on America’s Main Streets: to “Do Good” in our communities and with the individual families we serve.

Sentinel Investments, the investment management company of NLG, manages approximately $30 billion in AUM. Our purpose is simple – to allow NLG to keep its promises. How we do this – an obsessive focus on delivering investment results. We drive results through a rigorous and collaborative investment process and we hold ourselves to the highest of standards, both as investors and teammates. While our process is based on rigor, our culture is based on our guiding principles: Meritocracy, Uncompromising Transparency, Intellectual Honesty, Performance Driven Learning, and Relentless Pursuit of Excellence. These principles guide the way we conduct ourselves, how we work together, and how we approach every investment decision. We fulfill our responsibilities while acting with integrity and humility, while focusing on what is right for the firm, and ultimately, our policyholders. Our culture has been deliberately built to nurture inclusiveness and curiosity, and provide opportunities to learn and grow, both as people and investors. The flat and collaborative nature of our team promotes an atmosphere where the best ideas are continually expressed and rewarded. Our pursuit of excellence is unwavering.

THE POSITION

Position Title Trading Analytics Intern

Reports to Head of Trading

Position Summary

Supporting the Structured Products and Trading teams, the Trading Analytics Intern will aid development of analytical systems and reporting for analysts and traders designed to aid the investment decision and transaction process. The high impact role will offer exposure to key areas of the National Life fixed income investment process.

Responsibilities

Create and improve analytical tools that aid analysts and traders in understanding and visualizing complex data sets
Integrate insights into practical workflows utilizing Excel, Tableau / Microsoft BI, and email-based reporting
Learn trading and analytical workflows and apply technical skills to improve and automate processes
Improve ad-hoc desk analytics and assist in developing repeatable processes for research analysts and traders

THE PERSON

Pivotal Experience & Expertise

Candidate for undergraduate or advanced degree in Financial Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field of study
Experience with either a workplace or academic setting in quantitative financial analysis and/or development roles
Experience using Excel, Microsoft BI, Tableau, and other data visualization tools, and the ability to demonstrate capabilities as part of the interview process
Skilled in SQL and Python; knowledge of additional programming languages considered helpful
Experience with code development best practices
Intense intellectual curiosity with the desire to seek new challenges while continuously learning
Solid interpersonal skills and ability to connect to form meaningful working partnerships
Inclusive team player with a collaborative and cooperative approach
Strong work ethic and proactive professional disposition
Experience driving projects to completion

Cultural Fit

Results-driven mindset
Thrives in a collaborative environment where the best ideas that drive the best results are rewarded
Has the integrity to communicate all relevant facts and information in evaluating decisions and the humility to admit what you do not know
Love of learning – comfortable in an organization that seeks to continually learn from its mistakes and successes to drive better investment decisions
Comfortable with ambiguity and the mentality required to address and ultimately own those ambiguous situations – finding answers and solutions
Proficient in giving and receiving constructive feedback in both real time and structured environments
Demonstrates transparent, direct, and open communication across the organization
Promotes collaboration and has a “firm first” attitude – does what is right for National Life Group
Commitment to our mission and values

Sentinel Investments® is the unifying brand name for Sentinel Financial Services Company (Member FINRA), Sentinel Asset Management, Inc., and Sentinel Administrative Services, Inc. National Life Group is a trade name of National Life Insurance Company (Montpelier VT) and its affiliates. All companies referenced are affiliated.

This role is not open to applicants residing in Colorado effective 1/1/2021

Full Job Description
Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to be based out of Seattle, who thrives on designing, coding, and maintaining high performance data processing applications on the JVM platform (primarily in Clojure and Scala), running on AWS.

Your ideal internship should be one where you work in a small team and are empowered to make yourself and your team more productive on a daily basis. You should want to be part of a team where your desire to grow and learn are valued and aptly rewarded; where using and contributing to open source are looked upon as an asset; where innovating and executing are core to your teams' beliefs.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will:
Write performant code and write automated test to validate correctness of code
Develop and deploy large-scale microservices and/or data processing systems
Meet development milestones and business requirements on schedule
Independently analyze, propose and develop solutions for technical problems and issues
Ensure the adherence to the standards and procedures that result in an environment compliant with information security policy

Our ideal Software Engineering Intern will have:
A willingness to learn new languages and techniques to solve challenging problems.
Experience in functional programming fundamentals.
BS degree in Computer Science, related degree or equivalent. Graduating before August 2022.
Ability to write clean code that works, is readable, maintainable and follows best practices and coding standards
Understanding of OO and functional design, languages, algorithms and data structures
A philosophy of iteration and continuous improvement
A desire to own design and architecture end to end

Unwavering in our pursuit of standardizing global identity data, we are approachable, real people that genuinely care about the success of those we partner with. With a commitment to service, innovation, and ownership, Ekata is a dynamic place to work for folks who want to make an impact on a global scale. We provide learning & development opportunities for each employee and promote work-life flexibility through self-managed time off. Headquartered in downtown Seattle, Ekata is growing internationally with offices in Budapest, Hungary, Amsterdam, and in Singapore.

To learn more about the experience of working at Ekata visit: https://ekata.com/careers/

Ekata prides itself on celebrating diversity, inclusivity, and being an equal-opportunity employer.

The intern will work remotely for most of the summer, but may be required to occasionally come into our corporate office in Mundelein, IL. This individual will work closely with their manager and the Core IT Network staff to meet the needs of Medline's internal and external customers.

As an IT Network Analyst Summer Intern, you will gain experience supporting Networking technologies in a business environment. This position helps you to understand how businesses implement new network hardware/software, maintain existing products or services and participate in troubleshooting operational issues. Full Job Description

About Accelerant Agency

Accelerant Agency is a Chicago-based Digital Strategy agency that scales companies focused on growth.

*
What Accelerant Agency Does:

Accelerant’s motto is More Strategy, Less Marketing, Bigger Business. Instead of solely offering standard marketing services to companies, Accelerant instead prioritizes creating a sound, multi-channel digital strategy.
*
*
What makes Accelerant Agency different?

Accelerant isn’t your standard marketing agency, we’re a digital strategy agency. We don’t advertise, or collect business leads. Instead, we strategically and meticulously analyze certain industries for a year or longer before approaching an ideal local partner in that industry. At that point, we’ve become so knowledgeable in the field that we know which company most needs our services and the expected return a partnership will create for them.
*
*
Our Values

Think strategically

Set goals

Outwork everyone

Collaborate honestly

Celebrate often
*
*
Internship Description

The Marketing Internship at Accelerant Agency requires a growth-focused mindset and a desire to think strategically. The primary focus of this role is to give interns the opportunity to learn new skills in evolving markets and put them into practice.
*

*
What you’ll do

In the same way we adjust to our Chicagoland clients, this internship will flex to the current and desired skillset of our intern. Although a majority of this internship position will be based around WordPress Design and WordPress Development, the successful intern will take on other projects. On any given week, though, you might expect to work on projects like:
*

*

  • Web Design and development -- Whether you can hand-code or don’t even know what HTML stands for, you’ll likely learn website design 101. Accelerant’s founder has built websites for more than 20 years, and prides himself on breaking down the tech barrier to give interns a basic understanding of taking an idea from concept to public.
  • SEO and copywriting -- It’s not as daunting as it may seem. You’ll learn what Search Engine Optimization is, why it’s important, and why businesses of all sizes need it.
  • Conversion Rate Optimization -- How can you turn visitors into paying clients and customers? In this internship, you’ll learn first-hand from someone with a decade-plus experience in conversion rate optimization, a highly desired skill in today’s workplace.
  • Business intelligence and competitive analysis -- Yup. You’ll learn this in an internship. Accelerant has developed a process to identify a company’s growth potential on multiple digital platforms. You’ll learn how to spot a company’s blind spots online, and how to create opportunities to address those blind spots using enterprise-level software, tools and techniques.
  • Google Analytics and Google Ads optimization -- Google owns the internet, for better or worse. An Accelerant intern will become well-versed on all of Google’s products, including Analytics, Ads, Search Console, Tag Manager and others.

*
*
Qualifications

  • Experience in WordPress design or WordPress development
  • Basic understanding of digital marketing
  • Desire to pursue a career in Web Design, Communications, Advertising, Sales, Journalism, Public Relations, Marketing, computer science, Information Technology, Internet Marketing, Data Analytics, Data Science or related fields
  • Growth-mindset and eagerness to learn
  • Ability to have a ton of fun while doing the above

*
*
Perks + Pay

  • Opportunity to work with industry professionals and experienced marketers
  • Ongoing training and personal instruction from Accelerant team members, partner creatives, and specialized online courses
  • Monthly stipend based on hours worked
  • Portfolio piece opportunities with real clients

*

Full Job Description
About JLG, an Oshkosh company

JLG began in 1969, when our founder, John L. Grove set out to resolve growing safety concerns in the construction industry. Since then we have been committed to understanding the challenges and delivering innovative solutions to the access market. We partner with customers to provide quality equipment, training opportunities and trusted support within the access industry. We are a global company, and our products—including mobile elevating work platforms, telehandlers, utility vehicles and accessories—can be found all over the world.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Software Engineer Intern will prove support for the Software Engineering team. Activities will include designing reliable, functional, and cost effective vehicle control software; develop and test programming for vehicles and systems; support various systems through troubleshooting or reprogramming the system. This role will work on a variety of key projects and initiatives ranging from simple tasks to more complex analytical projects.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.

Write quality, maintainable, object oriented C++ software.
Develop and maintain PC programs used for the configuration of truck specific programming.
Identify and control vehicle operation and maintenance risks.
Prepare and maintain the software documentation necessary to support the configuration of truck specific programming.
Test truck specific programming to ensure the programming operates as specified.
Participate in peer reviews and other engineering activities.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong academic record, GPA 3.0.
Undergraduate degree student majoring in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of various degrees of information.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience with C or C++ programming or similar programming language.
Experience writing embedded applications on microcontrollers.
Experience working with Controller Area Network (CAN) and the J1939 protocol.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Proficiency with various web-based software applications including Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.
Detail oriented and quality focused.
Ability to work independently while prioritizing workload.
Flexible and adaptable to working under tight deadlines and/or changing needs.

position: STEM Entry Level Data Analyst and Visualization - Paid Internship
description:
Full Job Description

** The job descriptions will vary depending on the individual project but here are the primary roles you could be working on after internship **

Descriptions of some of them: **

-SQL Developer

**Responsibilities

  • Help write and optimize in-application SQL statements.
  • Ensure performance, security, and availability of databases.
  • Prepare documentation and specifications.
  • Handle common database procedures such as upgrade, backup, recovery, migration, etc.
  • Write TSQL scripts and objects such as stored procedures, user-defined functions, views, indexes per business requirements.
  • Create ETL SSIS packages to migrate data from OLTP sources to OLAP destinations through available tasks and transformations in SSIS.
  • Design and create user-interactive reports in SSRS, Power BI, and Tableau.
  • Profile server resource usage, and optimize and tweak as necessary.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

**Qualifications

  • BS or MS of a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related field is required
  • Proficiency with SQL and its variation among popular databases
  • Skilled at optimizing large complicated SQL statements
  • Capable of configuring popular database engines and orchestrating clusters as necessary
  • Ability to plan resource requirements from high-level specifications
  • Good communication skills

-Business Intelligence Developer

  • Maintain, support, and enhance the business intelligence data backend, including data warehouses and data lakes.
  • Build interfaces between the business intelligence systems and other colleges' information systems to maintain a timely and accurate integration of data.
  • Collaborate and work with data analysts in various departments to ensure that data meets their reporting and analysis need.
  • Provide technical guidance for design and implementation of data governance systems and policy.
  • Work extensively towards SQL Server development in writing core TSQL scripts to implement complex business logic.
  • Develop SSIS packages to implement complex ETL strategies as a part of business requirements for the population of dimensional data structures.
  • Work on creating SSAS cubes and various cube objects such as KPIs (Key Performance Indicators), calculated members, attribute hierarchies, and perspectives.
  • Design eye-catching reports with data from OLTP database, dimensional data structure and OLAP cubes for business reporting purposes.
  • Keep abreast of new business intelligence technologies

**Qualifications

  • BS or MS of a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related field is required
  • At least 1 year of experience using Microsoft SQL Server Database, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS is required
  • Experience with other relational databases, BI reporting and data discovery tools are preferred

-Data Analyst/Engineer

**Responsibilities:

  • Provides plan with data, reporting, and analyses that enable data driven decision making.
  • Provides summary analyses in written and oral presentation settings.
  • Builds database from scratch. And prepares complex presentations.
  • Develops system test cases and documents results, researches system issues, and documents findings.

**Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics
  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
  • Understanding of addressing and metadata standards
  • High-level written and verbal communication skills

-Junior Data Analyst/Engineer

**Responsibilities:

  • Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
  • Managing users and user roles.
  • Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analyst if necessary.
  • Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
  • Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
  • Helping develop reports and analyses.
  • Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
  • Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
  • Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
  • Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
  • Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
  • Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
  • Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
  • Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
  • Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.

**Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics
  • 1-3 years of work experience as a data analyst or in a related field is preferred
  • Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
  • Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide a software solution recommendations.
  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
  • High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases.
  • Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
  • Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
  • High-level written and verbal communication skills.

Due to the global situation, this internship will be remote until COVID-19.

Full Job Description
Twilio is looking for an Information Security Assurance Analyst intern who wants to advocate and support development of Twilio's foundational value, trust. This includes testing and analyzing information security controls to demonstrate confidence in our controls to senior management, customers, and regulators.

Who?

Twilio is looking for interns who live the Twilio Magic and have a demonstrated track record of learning, growth, impact, and success. Ideal candidates:

Are working towards a BS, MS, or PhD degree in computer science or, preferably, cybersecurity engineering
Broad knowledge and proficient background in cybersecurity
0-3+ years of engineering or information security experience
Knowledge of cloud and/or telecommunications networking are a plus
Have a keen interest in objectively demonstrating and proving that written requirements are operationalized
Have a passion for implementing automation of repeatable tasks and processes to improve process efficiency.
Have a hungry entrepreneurial and "can do" spirit, as evidenced by successful interest in learning new technologies

What?

As an Information Security Assurance Intern, you will live the Twilio Magic values:

BE INCLUSIVE: Work in a small, high-impact, diverse team
EMPOWER OTHERS: Bring in your expertise and experience to empower the your team and make things better in all aspects
DRAW THE OWL: Collaborate with the team to tackle complex problems to meet Twilio, customer, and regulatory security requirements.
BE AN OWNER: Design and conduct security control assessment, analyze results, communicate with stakeholders, and provide subject matter expertise to stakeholders to remediate issues.
DON'T SETTLE, RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: Constantly look for areas of improvement in security control assessment processes and work to optimize them.

Why?

Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

Our intern will be working remotely due to COVID but we're looking for interns primarily in the Bay Area. We employ diverse talent from all over the world and we believe great work can be done anywhere. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

About Us

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Full Job Description
General Statement of Duties
This internship position will acquire broad experience in information system fundamentals across multiple Information Technology disciplines. Task may involve assisting full-time employees with Application Development, Systems Integration, Data Analytics, Data Scrubbing, Help Desk, Systems Administration, Network monitoring, monitoring, and physical teardown and construction of server racks and personal desktops.

Supervision Received
Works under the direct supervision of the Business Intelligence Analyst and under the general supervision of the Information Technologies Manager.

Program Features and Benefits:
Broad range of assignments that will provide real-world experience in applying Information Technology knowledge, skills, and abilities to Enterprise projects.
Exposure and opportunities to meet with members of our Senior Leadership Team and learn about their personal experiences.
In-depth education on our organization, our industry and how water and wastewater companies protect public health and the environment.
A comprehensive understanding of the water and wastewater industry and real insight into the variety of IT career tracks that are available within many utility organizations.
The chance to shadow professionals in a variety of disciplines throughout IT.
Professional and personal development activities and ongoing feedback and coaching on performance.
Presentation of your project results to the Leadership Team and the opportunity to gain insightful feedback regarding your achievements.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

Analysis: Performs research, Information Technology analysis, and calculations of information to support Enterprise systems.
Data Management: Collection, compilation, trends analysis, and interpretation of data sets.
Reporting: Preparation of technical reports detailing activities performed, results, conclusions, and recommendations.
SQL Database optimization, queries and analysis.
Support Information Technology team with hardware, software and other related systems.
Provide field support with network and security systems installation.
Provide help desk support troubleshooting client-side technical problems.
Opportunity for field visits may arise during the internship.
Identify and develop an Information Technologies project that will benefit PWSD Enterprise business processes.
Performs simple to intermediate analysis and design. May assist in preparing information technology project plans, designs, specifications, cost estimates, evaluations, and studies.
Assists in research, business process documentation, studies, or technical reviews. Conducts analyses, investigations, verifications and summarizes results or findings in written reports or oral presentations.
Utilizes internal resources to learn business/engineering operations/functions and apply learning in completion of work assignments.
Coordinates efforts with other disciplines, and/or departments in achieving project goals and task assignments.
Performs other duties as required.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Advanced computer knowledge including, but not limited to, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Access.
Basic knowledge of Active Directory, Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, T-SQL.
Ability to interpret and use information from technical specifications, reports, and regulatory documentation.
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships; communicate effectively, orally, written and graphically.
Ability to obtain information and utilize this information to prepare written documents that are clear, concise, courteous, and within accepted grammatical standards.
Basic knowledge of safety procedures and use of personal protective equipment and ability to apply safety principles. Ability to anticipate unsafe circumstances; act accordingly to prevent accidents, and promptly report accidents and hazardous conditions.
Ability to work independently with broad direction and limited supervision. Ability to work effectively with supervisors, co-workers, vendors, contractors, developers and the general public.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications

Candidates must be actively enrolled in, or just graduated from an accredited college or university undergraduate/graduate Information Technology related degree program.
Must possess a valid Colorado Drivers license and a Motor Vehicle Record within the acceptable limits of the Districts insurance company.

Working Conditions/Physical Activities

Monday through Friday, 40 hours per week.
Work is performed primarily in an office setting; however, may be performed on construction sites where there may be exposure to dust, noise, traffic and moving construction equipment; and/or at a wastewater treatment facility where noise, irritants, dust, dirt, bacteria, hazardous chemicals/air/materials and fumes are present.
Works indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions and over all types of terrain. May be exposed to risks typically associated with working around water, chemicals, electricity and other man-made and natural hazards.
Full range of body movements including stooping, twisting, kneeling, bending, leaning, reaching, climbing (heights), stretching and working in awkward positions. May stand for extended periods of time.
Vision is needed for reading, computer input, recording, and interpreting information; speech and hearing are used to communicate with other employees over the telephone, radio and in person.

description:
Full Job Description

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
We are seeking a Transformation and Planning Senior Associate, Engineering and CloudOps to join our Transformation and Planning organization located in South San Francisco, CA.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern- Business Operations and Planning
Location: (Virtual)
Expected start date to end date: 6 Months

In this role, you’ll:
  • Develop a deep understanding of our product development process, capacity and technical details.
  • Validate team’s output and technical design decisions against the product strategy and timeline
  • Contribute to product technology roadmap and business planning activities
  • Support program teams with business case development by quantifying cost impact of infrastructure build of material (BOM), software development activities, and IT service operation activities.
  • Drive and actively participate in engineering training and DevOps operating model improvement initiatives
  • Create an environment for continuous learning and improvement
Skills / Competencies
  • Demonstrated strong interest in enterprise software technology and human capital management (HCM)
  • Independent thinker with both technical background and business perspectives - backed by data and structured analysis
  • Intellectual curiosity in building and supporting innovation technologies
  • Business acumen to connect technical impact with strategy and accounting knowledge
  • Data analytics skills – can create pivot table, run basic regression, and construct SQL statements
  • Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.
  • Strong execution orientation – find creative ways to get questions answered and thing done
  • Be a responsive and dependable source of information in a fast paced, multi-functional environment
Desirable Additional Skills & Experience:
  • Experience with Product Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and enterprise Software-as-a-Service(SaaS) cloud delivery model
  • Experience with enterprise SaaS business model, sales process, customer segments, and market analysis
  • Experience with Agile, Scrum methodologies
Qualifications
  • 0-2+ years of software engineering or related consulting experience
  • Information System Management OR Computer Science degree
  • MBA or business degree a plus
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Full Job Description
At Johnson & Johnson, we use technology and the power of teamwork to discover new ways to prevent and overcome the world’s the most significant healthcare challenges. Our Corporate, Consumer Health, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceutical teams leverage data, real-world insights, and creative minds to make life-changing healthcare products and medicines. We're disrupting outdated healthcare ecosystems and infusing them with transformative ideas to help people thrive throughout every stage of their lives. With a reach of more than a billion people every day, there’s no limit to the impact you can make here. Are you ready to reimagine healthcare?

Here, your career breakthroughs will change the future of health, in all the best ways. And you’ll change, too. You’ll be inspired, and you’ll inspire people across the world to change how they care for themselves and those they love. Amplify your impact. Join us!

Auris Health, Inc., part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is redefining medical intervention. By combining advancements in medical robotics, instrumentation, navigation and data science, Auris is building a platform technology capable of expanding the applicability of robotics to a spectrum of medical procedures. Learn more about Auris Health at https://www.aurishealth.com/.

Auris Health, Inc., part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is redefining medical interventions. By combining advancements in medical robotics, instrumentation, navigation and data science, Auris is building intelligence platforms capable of growing the applicability of robotics to a new spectrum of medical procedures.

We are seeking a talented individual for a Computer Vision Internship position within the Algorithms/AI team at Auris Health. As a computer vision intern you will work closely with other Research Scientists and Software Engineers in the Algorithms/AI team within the R&D Flexible Robotics organization to develop novel solutions in the area of machine learning, computer vision, and robotic navigation. This will be an exciting opportunity to develop your skills in solving challenging problems and contribute to technology development for next generation robotic intervention platforms.

Core Job Responsibilities:
Development, implementation, and testing of machine learning and computer vision algorithms (in Python/C++)
Experiment design, testing, and analysis of machine learning algorithm performance and comparison between different algorithms (in Python)
Development of new RGBD datasets and implementation of new data processing architectures
Port computer vision results into augmented reality and prototype solutions
Work closely with other research scientists, robotics engineers and SW engineers to transfer solutions into Monarch products and application

Qualifications

Actively enrolled in an accredited PhD program majoring in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or a relevant field preferred
Graduation date after August of 2021
Experience and understanding of state-of-the-art computer vision, machine learning, and deep learning algorithms
Good knowledge of 3D reconstruction and scene understanding
Hands-on experience with machine learning/deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow)
Experience in processing of RGBD datasets desirable
Experience with development in Augmented/Mixed Reality devices (e.g. Hololens and Magic Leap) and Unity desirable
Proficiency in Python, C++
Familiarity with cross-platform software development and version control systems (Git, etc.)
Ability to work in a regulated environment in compliance to ISO 13485 and 21 CFR 820.
Experience working in an FDA regulated environment a plus

Please note that most, but not all, Johnson & Johnson roles are currently virtual due to COVID-19. While locations/facilities have been aligned to our Internships and Co-Ops positions, assignments could be virtual due to the uncertainties of COVID-19.

position: Student Assistant - Office of Innovation & Technology - Information Security (Two Positions)
description:
Full Job Description
The Department of Managed Health Care (DMHC) is seeking to hire two student assistants to work in their Information Security Office. The students will have the opportunity to gain practical, real world work experience in a fast-paced, technologically advanced environment.

Conditions of Employment

This is a part-time, temporary, non-benefited, student position. Employment in all positions with University Enterprises, Inc. is dependent upon the mutual consent of University Enterprises, Inc. and the employee. This means that either University Enterprises, Inc. or the employee can, at any time, terminate the employment relationship at will, with or without cause.

Depending on the type of position you are applying for, a pre-employment background check consisting of one or more of the following may be conducted: employment history, professional references, criminal check, educational verification (i.e., degree, license, or official transcript) and physical exam and drug urinalysis test. Applicants will be required to pass required pre-employment checks to the satisfaction of University Enterprises, Inc. (UEI) and the hiring Agency or Department.

Work Schedule

Flexible hours, Monday through Friday, between 8:00am and 5:00pm. Final schedule to be determined between supervisor and student.

Additional Work Schedule

Student Assistants and Graduate Student Assistants generally work up to 20 hours per work week (Sunday-Saturday) during the academic year and up to 40 hours per work week during breaks; (Winter, Spring and Summer). Another work schedule option for students working off campus through the California Intern Network is to work 28 hours per week, year-round.

Area Sacramento
On/Off Sacramento State Campus Off Campus
Worksite City Sacramento
Pay Range $15.00 - $20.22 per hour
Department/Agency Managed Health Care, Department of (DMHC)
Unit/Division Office of Innovation & Technology - Information Security
Project Description

The Department of Managed Health Care protects consumers’ health care rights and ensures a stable health care delivery system. The Information Security Office (ISO) orchestrates efforts and provides services to protect the information assets that are important to the DMHC. The DMHC ISO collaborates with partners throughout the department and the state to build and maintain a comprehensive cybersecurity program.

To learn more visit www.dmhc.ca.gov

Majors/Fields of Study Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science and Engineering, Health Science, Engineering
Minimum Qualifications

  • Must have basic computer knowledge/skill in Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint, Adobe Acrobat.
  • Must be able to communicate effectively through email, phone, and in person.
  • Must maintain a 2.0 GPA for each semester/quarter.
The candidate selected and not currently employed by the DMHC will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation. The investigation will consist of fingerprinting and an inquiry to the California Department of Justice to disclose criminal records.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three Reasons to Intern at SAP

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
SAP Software Development teams have embarked on an audacious vision to build applications to bring sellers and buyers closer together like never before. We are looking to build several applications that add value to both ends of the spectrum and create a smart global profile for the supplier to meet any procurement business needs without any friction. If you are passionate about building user-centric enterprise software applications and be part of a strong technical team then this is your dream opportunity.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Software Developer

Location: St. Louis Park, MN; Chicago & Naperville, IL; New York, NY; Pittsburgh, PA; Reston & Vienna, VA

Expected start date to end date: June 7 ,2021 – August 13, 2021

Have the unique opportunity to design, develop and deliver core experiences of our new applications using Java, Angular, C, C++
Document and test new software applications
Solve complex problems and design systems that enable best-in-class operation of SAP cloud services and communications with our customers.
Be part of a team that believes in complete ownership of products, tools and services which inspires other teams to deliver better software and build customer satisfaction.
Evaluate and leverage the latest and greatest AWS Cloud technologies as you build and innovate.
Collaborate and innovate with Product, Design and other engineering teams to deliver a seamless, consistent and engaging user experience for millions of users
Design and develop front-end interfaces, RESTful APIs and backend systems

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience).
Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
Preferred experience: familiarity with Gradle, Microservices (Springboot), Redis, CI/CD tools using Jenkins, Github. Experience building cloud applications (eg. Google Cloud Platform, AWS and Azure).

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Full Job Description
About our group:
Seagate has one simple mission: to help the world save more of its precious data. Multiple studies have shown that machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data analytics are all improved with larger data sets. These methods are what is needed for the world to solve its important challenges from developing vaccines to combating climate change to improving autonomy in driving that saves lives. Unfortunately, however, the IDC projects that 158 of the 175 predicted zettabytes of data produced in 2025 will not be saved. By lowering the cost of storage, Seagate aims to rescue as much of this at-risk 158 zettabytes as possible to provide larger data sets and correspondingly improved learning, autonomy, and analytics. To achieve this goal, Seagate is harnessing the power of open source software to reduce data center costs. Our group is dedicated to this goal.

About the role - you will:
As a Developer Advocate intern, your role will be central to this important corporate strategy as you will help create the public face of Seagate’s open source initiatives. You will interact with a community who shares this vision to deliver the world’s best overall data center storage solutions optimized for both capacity and performance. In this role, you will evangelize Seagate’s vision and open source initiatives via blog posts, hackathons, meet-ups, and code integrations with popular third-party software suites such as pytorch, Map-Reduce, Kubernetes, and Spark for example. You will work to support and learn from our full-time developer advocates and gain valuable experience as well as an understanding of whether this unique type of role is suitable for a full-time career.

No community can be successful without an inclusive culture and you will be responsible for modeling and ensuring inclusive and respectful community behaviors to promote healthy growth and nurturing of the community. Additionally, you will represent the external community in internal forums to amplify their voices and smoothly deliver their contributions and ideas appropriately within Seagate.

Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.

About you:
  • PhD Degree (in progress) in Computer Science, Data Science or related fields
  • Currently enrolled student returning to school in fall 2021
  • Knowledge of third-party software suites such as Kubernetes, pytorch, Map-Reduce or Spark
  • Love to learn
  • Love to teach
  • Love technology
  • Love open source

Travel: 0-10%

The Advanced Analytics team at Chamberlain is looking for enthusiastic data engineering interns to build and maintain big data pipelines to support advanced analytics and data science solutions.

During the internship program, you will initiate, manage, and deliver a project, including identifying and understanding valuable internal and external data and collaborating closely with data scientists to wrangle data for the design, development, and deployment of new solutions. Upon completion of the project, you will have the opportunity to present your results and findings to Chamberlain’s Executive Leadership Team.

Internships at Chamberlain are designed to give college students opportunities to complement their formal education with career-related experience. Interns will have an abundance of hands-on development opportunities and interactions in a real-world business environment. As a member of the Advanced Analytics team, you will work closely with senior data scientists, engineers, architects, and business partners.

Essential Functions:

  • Develop and maintain optimal data pipelines into the advanced analytics platform, including design of data flows, procedures, and schedules
  • Collaborate with data scientists to prepare data for model development
  • Understand and contribute to the models and machine learning methods developed and deployed
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and advanced analytics business partners to understand business needs and translate requirements into scalable data engineering solutions
  • Collaborate with data visualization and reporting application developers to ensure the sustainability of production applications and reports
  • Protect Chamberlain’s reputation by keeping information confidential
  • Create documentation and training materials for end-user understanding
  • Effectively communicate results and findings to stakeholders and Chamberlain’s Executive Leadership Team upon internship completion

Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in in computer science or related quantitative field of study
  • Experience building data pipelines and datasets
  • Experience working with Python, Pandas, and Spark
  • Familiarity with modern machine learning techniques
  • Experience with using data structures and algorithms
  • Good knowledge with SQL, working with structured and unstructured data
  • Problem solving and analytical thinking and skills
  • Teamwork and collaboration
  • Strong communication and organizational skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office

Additional Requirements:

  • Must be enrolled in a program of study at an accredited college or university.
  • Must be committed to the duration of the internship program, generally 12 - 14 weeks.
  • Must possess an unrestricted right to work in the United States
  • GPA minimum: 3.2 overall and 3.5 in major on a 4.0 point scale

Career Development Intern Opportunities

CGI’s Career Development Intern Opportunities are designed to give college students an opportunity to complement their formal education with career-related experience.

In an effort to accomplish this, students must:

  • Share ideas and provide new insight
  • Handle confidential information in a professional and ethical manner
  • Assume personal and professional responsibility for his/her actions and activities
  • Maintain professional relationships with Chamberlain Group’s employees, clients, and customers, both internal and external
  • Develop a self-awareness of attitudes, values, and behavior patterns that positively influence the work environment
  • Contribute positively to maintain a workplace culture that is consistent with the Chamberlain mission, vision and values.
  • Work on applying knowledge acquired in the classroom to real-world business situations

  • Complete work assignments in a thorough, consistent, and punctual manner
  • Create and deliver an end of program presentation to Top Leaders

Oak Brook Headquarters

CGI's headquarters is a 4-story, state-of-the-art new building in Oak Brook, Illinois. Designed for natural light and surrounded by a 3/4-mile walking path, CGI HQ was designed for better health, better collaboration and better performance.

Full Job Description
The Emmes Company, LLC is searching for a Data Management Intern to participate in our Summer 2021 Virtual Internship Program. Therefore our intern can be located anywhere in the United States and will work remotely.

The Emmes Company, LLC is a private Contract Research Organization (CRO). Headquartered in Rockville, Maryland, Emmes employs over six hundred staff worldwide with offices located in Frederick, Maryland, Tysons Corner, Virginia, Vancouver, Canada and Bangalore, India. Ranked as a top area workplace of choice by the Washington Post, Emmes fosters an environment of collaboration, professional growth, and exceptional work life balance.

Our studies impact public health initiatives on a global scale occurring in more than sixty countries spanning across six continents. We are dedicated to providing statistical and epidemiological expertise, computer systems deployment, data management, study monitoring, regulatory guidance, and overall operational support to clients engaged in biomedical research. Emmes offers support for the entire process of clinical trials from study design and protocol development through data analysis and manuscript generation.

The Position

We have two Data Management Intern openings. One of our interns will support a new NIH-sponsored prospective observational cohort study on health disparities of pregnant women and their offspring.

The other intern will support The Blood and Marrow Transplant Clinical Trials Network (BMT CTN or the “Network”) that was established in October 2001 to conduct large, multi-institutional clinical trials to improve the outcomes of hematopoietic cell transplantation (HCT) for patients facing life-threatening disorders. The BMT CTN allows the HCT community to conduct prospective, collaborative, clinical research within an infrastructure expressly designed to:

Facilitate effective communication and cooperation among transplant centers and collaborators at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), particularly the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) and the National Cancer Institute (NCI)
Implement and complete well-designed, multicenter trials of high scientific merit
Offer participation in HCT clinical trials to patients in all regions of the United States (US)

The Network:
Effectively fosters development of innovative and important concepts into well-designed trials that answer questions in an efficient manner
Supports timely implementation and completion of those trials
Ensures protection of subjects (both donors and recipients)
Provides high-quality data and adherence to regulatory requirements in an increasingly complex environment
Promotes timely publication of study results, which advances the field of HCT and impacts patient care
The BMT CTN and its network of Core and Affiliate Centers play a critical role in improving patient outcomes and advancing the science of HCT

Responsibilities

Interns will participate in clinical trials data management activities
Responsibilities may include assisting generation and review of technical reports and documents including data tables, figures and listings
Perform data audits and quality control review of databases, web sites and spreadsheets
Provide administrative support including copying, filing and other related tasks
Perform other duties as assigned

Experience

Must currently be enrolled in an Undergraduate, Masters or PhD program, in a STEM or Health-Related major
Strong problem solving, organizational and analytical skills
Demonstrate high attention to detail, abi/lity to multi-task and prioritize workload
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite products and basic office equipment including but not limited to MS Word, Excel, copying, and scanning
Strong oral and written communication skills including writing, proofing, and editing
Previous Clinical Research and/or Public Health experience within an academic or professional work environment desired
Preference for individuals who have a background and interest in computer science

The Emmes Company is an equal opportunity affirmative action employer and does not discriminate in its selection and employment practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, age, or other legally protected characteristics.

Full Job Description
ThinkMarkets is a global online brokerage firm, specializing in providing multi-asset trading solutions to thousands of clients around the world. With our flagship ThinkTrader platform, we allow our clients to trade the world 24-hours a day. Our mission is to disrupt the brokerage industry by allowing access to global markets and thousands of products to allow our clients to trade the world in the palm of their hand. We use the latest technologies to give traders seamless access to our proprietary trading platforms. Our Chicago office is in the heart of the financial district in the Loop, and is made up by our Leadership, IT, Analytics, and R&D teams.

We are seeking a Marketing Data Science Intern to join our rapidly growing global workforce in Chicago. This position is tasked with establishing a reporting framework for our worldwide marketing and sales activities. You will guide growth in underserved areas such as building a reporting and visualization suite along with delivering insights on acquisition efforts. This role is based in our Chicago office and reports to the Head of Performance Marketing.

Responsibilities:
Enhance ThinkMarkets knowledge of our marketing channels performance, from data collection to formulating analytics visualizations
Measure the impact of our various sales channels and marketing campaigns, and how they interact with each other
Assist in model development to harness large data sets to improve flexibility in automated marketing decision making
Help with the development of modeling algorithms to analyze the customer, market, and trading data signals to influence marketing decision making
Assist with the development and maintenance of dashboards and visualizations that inform both tactical and strategic decision making
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Deliver well-documented datasets, tools, and reports to key technical and business team members
Help standardize the ThinkMarkets analytics approach for version controls, code sharing and improving operational efficiency

Requirements:
Pursuing and/or recently obtained Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics, related quantitative discipline, or equivalent practical experience
Foundational knowledge of analytics platforms, Excel, Tableau or other BI visualization software
Experience with SQL and Python for data manipulations, data aggregations, and statistical analysis
Experience with data cleansing, from data preparation to analysis and deployment

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with marketing platforms such as Google Analytics
Prior internships in an analytical or statistical role

Full Job Description
About us

Founded in 2009 and headquartered in San Jose, California, Nutanix is a passionate team of 6000+ employees worldwide. Our people (we call ourselves “Nutants”) are the heartbeat of #LifeAtNutanix and one of the many things that makes Nutanix a great place to work at. We share an intellectual curiosity, a bias for action, and an obsession for our customers. We are builders and problem solvers with an entrepreneurial spirit. Above all, we celebrate what makes each of us unique.

We are humbled to be recognized as one of Bloomberg’s Top 50 Companies to Watch in 2020 and one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2020 .

We’re growing fast and disrupting the computing industry. Join us and make your mark.

About our business

Nutanix is a global leader in cloud software and a pioneer in hyperconverged infrastructure solutions, making computing invisible anywhere. Companies around the world use Nutanix software to leverage a single platform to manage any app, at any location, at any scale for their private, hybrid and multi-cloud environments.

The Role: DR Team - Software Engineer - System Test

The Engineering Summer Internship is an opportunity to gain exposure to one or more Nutanix engineering roles according to your skills and interests. Some potential roles include (but not limited to) working on the core data path, storage and filesystems development, distributed systems, infrastructure and platform/hardware deployment, data protection and replication, tools and automation, development of a big data processing platform, development of the API and analytics platform, and Web and front-end UI/UX development.

Each intern is paired with a Member of Technical Staff (Software Engineer) who serves as a guide through our engineering culture, toolsets, and development methodology. Our internship program also includes a series of lunch and learns, training events, and social outings to expose you to other aspects of a rapidly growing Silicon Valley technology company. This a full time, 12 week internship program.

Responsibilities:
Designing high level test approaches and implementing detailed test plans.
Writing New Automated test cases for existing and new features.
Executing automated and manual tests during product testing phases to find all bugs in your assigned feature area(s).
Working closely with the Development team to analyze and find root cause of failures.
Filing defects and tracking them to closure.

Requirements:
Strong programming skills in Python or Golang
Interest in test plan design and test case development for complex software projects.
Ability to debug and extend automated tests.
Interest testing a “systems” product (file systems, storage systems, databases, operating systems, hypervisors, or networking).
Knowledge of systems administration in UNIX, preferably Linux.
Experience using virtualization technologies such as VMware, Hyper-V, or Xen. VMware and Hyper-V is preferred.

Qualifications and Experience:
Pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related field is required

We’re an equal opportunity employer

Nutanix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and (in the U.S.) an Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or any other category protected by applicable law. We hire and promote individuals solely on the basis of qualifications for the job to be filled.

We strive to foster an inclusive working environment that enables all our Nutants to be themselves and to do great work in a safe and welcoming environment, free of unlawful discrimination, intimidation or harassment.

As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If you need a reasonable accommodation, please let us know by contacting hr@nutanix.com .

Full Job Description
Okta is the leading independent provider of identity for the enterprise. The Okta Identity Cloud enables organizations to securely connect the right people to the right technologies at the right time. With over 7,000 pre-built integrations to applications and infrastructure providers, Okta customers can easily and securely use the best technologies for their business. Over 10,000 organizations, including 20th Century Fox, JetBlue, Nordstrom, Slack, Teach for America and Twilio, trust Okta to help protect the identities of their workforces and customers.

The Okta Solutions Engineering team is involved in all stages of the customer's development lifecycle and are experienced using presentations, email, phone and social media to connect with customers. We are looking for great teammates who want to acquire the skills to build sales presentations, product demonstrations, and educate customers (everyone from developers to product managers to C-level executives) on the best ways to leverage cloud security technology.

We believe in Okta's Solutions Engineers empathize with customers and quickly discern their true technical needs by asking detailed and clarifying questions and presenting solutions that target those needs. You have the rare combination of technical savviness and business insight and you're looking for a career where you can utilize both. As a Solution Engineering Intern at Okta, you will develop each of these skills through a structured learning and development program that includes classroom, self-study, and shadowing opportunities with senior level colleagues.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Support the sales team in helping customers understand what they can achieve with Okta
Learn how to understand customer technical/business requirements and communicate how to leverage to provide solutions
Assist in execution and delivery of RFP responses, demos & POCs for customers
Learn how to craft technical content to show customers how to implement specific use cases or standard methodologies for new technologies
Learn how to distill and communicate customer needs and product feedback to Product Management, Engineering, Marketing and Sales

Required Skills:
Currently pursuing a BS or MS in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Informatics, Data Science, or related field)
A passion to serve the customer by learning how to communicate complex ideas and solutions to their business challenges
A desire to learn to quickly communicate complex ideas around a technical topic, ideally on the fly at a whiteboard
We are looking for someone with hands-on experience in one or more of the following areas: web (JavaScript, HTML, frontend frameworks) development, mobile (iOS, Android) development, backend (Java, C#, Node.js, Python, PHP, Ruby) development, IP-based real-time communication.

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Endpoint Management and Data Cleanup

Our company has a need to remove retired software from existing computers, identify and resolve outdated account information and work with end users to convert allocated storage from on-site locations to Microsoft Office 365 OneDrive storage. Details of these projects and required skill sets are listed below.

1. Encryption Software removal

One security application in use consists of a full drive encryption package complimented with specific profiles that assign access types to computers. These computers require direct hands on actions to decrypt and remove old profiles, then re-encrypt and assign new profiles. This work may incur challenges that require the candidate to replace the computer if the process fails. Replacement would require:

  • Imaging computers using Microsoft Deployment Tool (MDT) to ensure computers are available when needed
  • Communicating with users to schedule time that they will not have access to their computer, informing them of potential risks, and arranging for return of old computers at the time that a replacement is shipped or delivered to their current work location (on-site or remote)
  • Performing a prescribed set of steps to update computers to the new encryption package
2. Abandoned user account cleanup

Candidate will be provided a list of inactive accounts for analysis and remediation. Specific steps will include:

  • Researching Active Directory and the ITSM ticketing tool to identify user contact information (or appropriate USL manager)
  • Creating Microsoft Forms to collect responses regarding:
o Need for account

o Purpose of account

o Frequency of usage

  • Creating and populating a SharePoint list with required information to update records or note accounts to be removed
3. Home Drive to OneDrive Conversion

Approximately 200 user accounts are configured to store personally generated company documents within an on-premises file share location. Candidate will be tasked with performing the following actions:

  • Assist users with moving data from existing storage locations to their Office 365 OneDrive account
  • Perform prescribed conversion steps to configure their new user profile configuration
  • Quickly troubleshoot and remediate issues in Windows or File Explorer related to copy or movement of files
Skills Required:
  • Working knowledge of Active Directory Users and Computers
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 and Microsoft Forms & Teams
  • Excellent familiarity with Microsoft Windows 10 in an enterprise environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to maintain Microsoft Forms data and SharePoint lists
o Experience creating SharePoint lists preferred

  • Strong technical troubleshooting experience with Laptops, Desktops, and Windows 10 OS
  • Ability to work on-site in the USL Maple Grove Facility as needed for hands-on imaging, troubleshooting, and inventory management
Intern would work within the IT Services team, and tasks would be directed by both the Help Desk and Client Solutions teams.

Learning Objectives for Intern:
  • Effectively remediate software conversions relation to encryption and security
  • Utilize SharePoint, Microsoft Forms, and Power BI to analyze and resolve discrepancies in records and accounts
  • Create and maintain effective professional communication templates to inform and instruct users on relevant processes and steps
The ideal candidate will be actively pursuing a career in IT related to data warehousing, network support, endpoint systems management, computer science or help desk support, and possess strong analytical skills. Experience in SharePoint, Power BI, and Microsoft Office 365 is preferred. Ability to follow standardized processes and work independently often is required.
