Full Job Description
By giving our customers and partners, some of which are Fortune Global 500 companies across all industries, the most flexible commerce platform, which is based on a Microservices, API-first, true cloud, and headless architecture (we call it the MACH architecture*), we are not only helping them maintain their competitive advantage but we are also changing the e-commerce platform market. Founded in Germany in 2006, our international expansion has reached Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. In October 2019, with a $145M investment from global venture capital and private equity firm Insight Partners, commercetools is in full gear going forward.

PRODUCT INTERN

When large enterprises buy software, they often resort to putting Request for Proposals (RFPs) out, which are long questionnaires full of questions that help the buyer to evaluate options from different software vendors. Buyers can then evaluate different vendors head to head, using the same criteria. Unfortunately, the RFPs that buyers often use are badly outdated. We at commercetools invented an entirely modern approach to commerce that is not reflected well in RFPs. In 2018, we built ModernCommerceRFP.com which is a website used to generate RFPs for modern commerce. It's been use hundreds of times by large enterprises to generate RFPs and is widely seen as the standard for modern RFPs. We would like an intern to work directly for our Chief Product Officer to give ModernCommerceRFP.com a major refresh and expand it into adjacent products such as content and search.

In this internship, you would work with commercetools senior management to define the scope of the new ModernCommerceRFP.com, work with commercetools employees and partners to define update/extend the list of RFP questions, add the questions to the website, thoroughly test the functionality, and then lead a campaign to publicize its re-launch. This internship will pay $20/hour.

SKILLS + QUALIFICATIONS

Pursuing degrees in business and computer science
Ability to analyze RFPs (50% of role)
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal (35% of role)
Light web development skills (15% of role)
Proactive approach to problem solving and excellent interpersonal skills

Check out our Career Page and our Website for more information.

We are all different and that is what makes us stronger! We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company better.

At commercetools, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

At commercetools, we hope to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people choose to come, stay and do their best work. We pride ourselves on bringing modern principles to ecommerce through both technology and company culture. We know success comes from the hard work and dedication of our passionate and creative employees.

Are you ready? Come grow with us!

Company Description:
Merkle is a leading technology-enabled, data-driven customer experience management (CXM) company. For over 30 years, Fortune 1,000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with us to build and maximize the value of their customer portfolios. Merkle is an agency of dentsu.

Diversity is embedded in who we are and all that we do: our mindset, our solutions, and in our teams to empower an inclusive, equitable environment. We put our people at the center, creating space for growth, understanding and learning so they can thrive. Our differences make us richer and enable stronger relationships with each other and foster greater impact for our clients. We engage with our communities to drive positive social impact by fostering equity and working to create a digital society that works for all.

Job Description:
This is an ideal opportunity for college juniors and seniors or anyone looking to gain exposure in an innovative, fast-paced technology company. This is a full-time, virtual, paid internship from June 7 to August 6. Employees from diverse or underrepresented backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

Merkle partners with industry-leading cloud technologies – like Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud Platform – to help clients build end-to-end consumer journeys they can use to market at scale while keeping a keen focus on the customer experience. The Cloud & Big Data Engineering Intern works with these Cloud platforms to design, develop, and implement next generation analytical solutions that provide clients with comprehensive access to their data and a more complete view of their customers and prospects. Under the supervision of a Cloud Architect, the Intern will work on client-facing projects and gain real-life experience in Cloud native and Commercial/Open Source Big Data technologies.

Contribute in building data pipelines, loading datasets, generating insights leveraging Cloud based Big Data technologies
Participate in Unit Testing, Integration Testing of applications
Be hands-on in developing prototypes and conducting Proof of Concepts
Work under the supervision of Cloud Architect
Evaluate and analyze new commercial/open-source services/technologies offered by public Cloud providers, and Big Data technology vendors
Develop repeatable/reusable componentry for typical Cloud based Marketing solutions implementations
Participate in creating project documentation such as handbooks
Opportunity to get AWS or Google Cloud certified

Qualifications:
Rising Junior or Senior pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Management Information Systems / Computer Science OR related experience
Solid programming skills (Java/Python/any other)
Knowledge of RDBMS experience using SQL
Conceptual and working knowledge of Big Data technologies and relational databases preferred
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to both large and small audiences
Passionate about learning new technologies and applying them in your daily job
Understanding of data warehouse/data engineering concepts
Problem-solving mentality
Exceptional verbal and written communication
Ability to connect technology with measurable business value

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. Employment-based visa sponsorship (including H-1B sponsorship) is not available for this position.

Information Technology, Computer Systems and Application Development are core components of our business and key to our success as one of the world’s largest steel producers. Steel, you will enhance your knowledge and understanding of the IT field and the relationship between our operations and our systems. This assignment is a paid internship that offers personal and professional development. Depending on your background and experience, you will be working in one of the following areas:
  • Advanced Analytics
  • Digital Technologies
  • Salesforce
Responsibilities (may include, but are not limited to the following):
  • Participate in application development training as needed, dependent upon the application area assigned, and apply training to work assignments.
  • Work on advanced analytics projects using Python, R & ML algorithms.
  • Develop skills on Data Visualization technologies such as Tableau, and Java script frameworks
  • Knowledge of Java or any other programming language
  • Work on Salesforce projects
  • Work independently and with minimal direction in the areas of application software maintenance and development, analysis, and troubleshooting per customer requests.

  • Ability to think and act both strategically and tactically

Student Employment

This is a dual-purpose role, focusing both on employee training and development, as well as the employee lifecycle specifically relating to the onboarding and offboarding processes. In many cases you will work with both multiple levels and functions within the organization. This position will report primarily to Training & Development, but have direct ties to Human Resources.

Strong organization is a MUST because there are typically multiple new hires to process at the same time daily.
Identify and implement process improvements.

Current college student preferred – pursuing a degree in Human Resources, Education, Communications, Computer Science, or related field.
Previous Training, HR, and onboarding experience preferred.
Previous experience with content development and deployment preferred.
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook) required.
Ability to multi-task while maintaining accuracy.
Ability to communicate in professional manner, both verbal and written, is required.
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.

Our technology enables us to transform an antiquated and inefficient labor market – creating a real-time marketplace for labor that will provide more work opportunities and relieve the burden on producers, improving overall productivity and enabling organic growth.

Full Job Description
UGI Energy Services supplies and markets natural gas, liquid fuels, and electricity to 40,000 customer locations across the Mid-Atlantic and Northeastern US.

We are a supplier, marketer, and midstream services provider – one backed by 135 years of natural gas experience, plus our own expanding energy infrastructure. Along with buying and selling energy commodities at the wholesale level, UGIES owns and operates key electric generation and midstream natural gas assets throughout Pennsylvania.

With headquarters and supply sources near the heart of the Marcellus Shale, UGIES is well positioned to meet the changing energy demands of commercial, industrial, institutional, and government customers for years to come.

We offer comprehensive benefits, some of which are:
Paid Vacation time starts with 3 weeks off
8 Paid Holidays
Sick time
Short term & Long term disability

Overview:
This is a summer internship position designed to assist UGIES on our efforts to deploy Robotic Process Automation (“RPA”) to business processes within the Supply team. This internship will require someone who has general programming skills and can automate business processes using the UiPath technology platform. The employee will be responsible for gaining an understanding of the business processes identified for automation, develop the automation within UiPath, and coordinate and document all testing of the automation with the business.

Work with business unit to gain full understanding of business processes to be automated. Assist business with efforts to document business processes.
Utilize the UiPath platform to design and develop the automation for the identified business processes.
Coordinate and document all testing of the automation with the business until automation is signed off by the business as complete and accurate.

Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite.
Must possess good verbal and written communication skills.

Education and Experience:
Currently pursuing a Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field.
Previous internship or job experience in a similar position is a plus.

Full Job Description
ASRC Federal (ASTS) provides Software Engineering Services throughout all aspects of the engineering process of the entire space systems arena. Our focused solutions offer efficiency, agility, and innovation. We resolve issues quickly and provide ideas and solutions to help our customers fix problems and overcome challenges. ASTS is looking for a Flight Software Sustaining Engineering Intern to support its Software Engineering Services - II contract at the NASA Godard Space Flight Center (GSFC) in Greenbelt, Maryland.

Roles/Responsibilities:
As a Flight Software Sustaining Engineering Intern, you will work with the Goddard Flight Software Sustainment Team (FSSE). The candidate will support NASA missions from pre-launch through decommission. The candidate will analyze flight software and investigate and recover from spacecraft anomalies. The candidate will develop flight software changes. The candidate will be involved in maintaining the flight software test beds.

Essential Job Functions:
Analyze requirements, design, implement, and test flight software changes according to a rigorous life-cycle development process.
Investigate spacecraft anomalies by analyzing operations commands, telemetry, memory dumps, FSW code and documentation.
Attempt to reproduce anomalies on the test bed.
Operate flight software test facilities and maintain a flight like configuration.
Configuration management of flight and ground products.
Continuous flight software sustaining engineering process improvement.

ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. HS Diploma or equivalent and currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
Prior experience with NASA, specifically with Flight Software Sustaining Engineering
Flight Software Sustaining Engineering interns must be proficient with a modern programming language such as Python, JavaScript, Matlab, C/C+ or similar.
Must be a self-starter able to work independently and able to learn quickly to changing requirements.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with a project team in a research environment.
Individual must meet government NAC and citizenship/permanent residency requirements for access to NASA GSFC. Extensive background investigation will be performed as a requirement of the job.

Are you a current college student in an Information Technology program? The Quality Assurance - Software Applications Intern will work with the QA Lead and QA Manager to learn the overall development process and work within a team to execute testing on projects, report testing results and contribute to the overall software delivery quality. The QA Software Testing Intern will work cross-functionally with our software development team and will learn the business processes and systems to determine the impacts of changes and if they meet requirements. This internship will ideally begin in April 2021.

This Internship is located on-site at the Batteries Plus Bulbs corporate office in Hartland, WI, as part of our Information Technology team. Batteries Plus Bulbs has been acknowledged as an "essential business" and we have remained open to provide our customers with essential products during the current pandemic. Does this sound like the right internship opportunity for you? If yes, apply today for consideration.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for the design, creation, and execution of test cases.
Assist teams with manual functional and regression testing as needed for enterprise applications.
Analyze, interpret, and summarize test results and metrics and communicate to appropriate teams.
Create test data needed to execute tests.
Estimate, prioritize, plan, forecast and coordinate testing activities.
Track testing progress and report failed tests as bugs in Azure DevOps.
Work closely with development, management, and operations to ensure defects are resolved properly.
May work on an agile scrum team which includes participating in scrum ceremonies including daily scrum, sprint planning, backlog refinement, retrospectives, and sprint reviews.
Other projects and duties as assinged

Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in an Information Technology related college degree program

Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to work a flexible schedule, hours of the position may vary based on needs
Detail-oriented
Prior experience testing software applications
Experience with software development
Available to start working ASAP

A Bit About Us:
Batteries Plus Bulbs is the nation's largest and fastest-growing battery, light bulb, phone repair and key fob replacement franchise with a nationwide network of over 720 stores. position: Intern for Device Modeling (Device Physics, Numerical Analysis, Circuit Simulation)
description:
Full Job Description
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

Spectre is the leader in circuit simulators. Device modeling is very important part of circuit simulator. This intern position is responsible to exploit various new device and Spice modelings, including radiation modeling, cryogenic modeling, quantum device and modeling. The ideal candidate would have expertise in device physics, device modeling, and numerical techniques for VLSI circuit simulation. Candidate should have an advanced degree in electrical engineering, computer science, applied mathematics, or similar. Candidates with experience in related fields will be considered, particularly:

1. Device physics, compact device modeling, behavioral modeling, statistical modeling, reliability modeling
2. Numerical analysis, numerical methods for solution of ordinary and partial differential equations
3. Statistical analysis, reliability aging analysis, electro-thermal analysis, circuit check algorithms
4. High performance computing / large scale scientific computing and deployment of parallel numerical algorithms

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

position: Automation and Controls System Engineering Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably. A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Siemens Healthineers develops innovations that support better patient outcomes with greater efficiencies, giving providers the confidence, they need to meet the clinical, operational and financial challenges of a changing healthcare landscape. Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as an Automation and Controls System Engineering Intern.

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As an Automation and Controls System Engineering Intern, you will be responsible for:

Supporting our manufacturing network migration project by working within the team to transfer equipment from one network to another in a validated environment.
Supporting the TrakSYS Process Monitoring project to upgrade the current application into the current, web-based platform.
Developing your technical writing skills by creating technical documentation such as validation documentation.

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to develop your career with Healthineers

You have a working knowledge of Industrial Control Systems
You have a working knowledge of Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) and electro-mechanical equipment such as motors, photo-electric sensors, etc.
You have a working knowledge of SQL Database and SQL Reporting solutions
You have good PC skills (MS Office software like Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook)
You have very good organization skills as multiple assignments will be progressed in parallel within a fast-paced environment.

Required skills to have for the success of this role

You are currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program (rising junior or senior) majoring in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science.
Course work in programming (C,C++, C#, HTML, Java, SQL)
Developing programs in any object-oriented computer language
Ability to work in Microsoft Office products (MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint)
Must have minimum GPA of 3.2 or higher
Must be available to work full-time (up to 40 hours/week) during summer 2021
Must feel comfortable going onsite into office and follow site COVID-19 protocol.

Start date: May/June 2021; 3-month duration.

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

If you want to join us in transforming the way healthcare is delivered, visit our career site at https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/careers

If you wish to find out more about the specific before applying, please visit: https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/about.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

IT Hardware/Software Support Intern - IN PERSON at Downtown Cincinnati Office COVID-19 Safe Environment- Part-time 20 hours a week Summer 2021 Internship.

Burke, Inc. (www.burke.com), founded in 1931, is one of the world’s leading marketing research companies providing innovation and insights to many top Fortune 100-500 companies in all industries throughout the US. We are great at what we do! That's shown by our top client satisfaction ratings and continued growth. We are also a great place to work with the proof to back it up! Just ask anyone here. And, it's easily shown by our long tenures and just 5% turnover (after all, someone decides to retire occasionally!) Check us out!!

It’s never only about the work we do – Burke’s dynamic culture offers a well-rounded experience for you to grow and give back. You can join in with us as we partner with local organizations each year to give back to our community with ongoing gifts and volunteering roles. We also support and practice environmental sustainability, including our LEED® certified building and solar parking canopies. Have fun while at work with monthly planned onsite and offsite activities where employees interact, relax, and have fun together! Stay well through participating in any of our on-site fitness classes or checking out the corporate wellness programs. Thinking more about your career development? Help with input on your customized plan for ongoing development plans, and train and learn on the job and from others in your department too.

Our Network Services team is the group that runs all things computer, network, security, software, and related. They help the rest of us get our jobs done without a glitch! As an Intern in this group, you'll work in a small collaborative environment to provide quality technical support by working on hardware and software installations and roll-outs that support approximately 230 internal users. What you’ll do:
Install, configure and maintain PCs and Mac computer equipment ensuring that all technology is ready for use.
Support various troubleshooting, network and system administration efforts with the rest of the team, and other technology-related projects within the department to help improve equipment and processes.
Burke's office is closed due to COVID-19 regulations and the safety of all employees. This position in Information Technology, however, is considered essential business to keep technology running for business to continue. There are only a few employees allowed in the office, and this is one. All are working at safe distances, and abiding to all federal and state regulations plus extra precautions we employ to keep you safe. This person must be in the office to perform this job.

What You’ll Need:
Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - in progress or newly complete.
A minimum of six months of experience in a similar role with technical support of hardware and software in a professional business environment.
Experienced with using and tech support on Dell laptop and desktop computers, Apple/ Macs, Windows 10, and Microsoft Office at a minimum.
MS Office Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel is preferred.
Knowledge of Windows Server, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft SQL, Microsoft SCCM, McAfee, O365 Office 365, Cisco Call Manager, Cisco Unity, Cisco networking
Ability to communicate positively and professionally with all levels of the company

As part of our hiring process, Burke conducts a criminal background check on all potential employees. You may be asked to provide additional information for that purpose. (A conviction does not necessarily bar an applicant from employment.) Burke is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Join a team that is changing millions of lives.

Transforming smiles, changing lives

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

Ready to join us?

About this opportunity

Align Technology, Inc. (the makers of Invisalign® aligners) is looking for 3D Software R&D Intern. The intern will work in the 3D Device Software Team, which is part of the R&D Product Innovation department. The position is for a full-time role with 10 weeks or until schools starts back up.

In this role, you will…

Work independently under supervision on one or more software projects and create a final presentation to share with the 3D Device Software Team and cross-functional teams. Activities may include:
Write MATLAB, Python, or C++ code to contribute to the orthodontic CAD product
Create SPLUNK dashboards and panels
Concept generation and iterative software prototyping
Formulating and testing hypotheses
Investigative research and root cause analysis
Participate in multiple stages of software Product Life Cycle
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as Biomechanical team and Materials team
Participate in project update meetings and effectively present data and findings
Assist with experiments, tests, documentation and organization of various projects
Assist with development of presentation materials including handouts, posters, graphs and PowerPoint presentations
Follow all departmental and company procedures as indicated in quality, administrative, or other systems
Comply with all safety policies, practices and procedures. Report all unsafe activities to supervisor and/or Human Resources.

In this role, you’ll need …

To be a student currently pursuing a Bachelor’s (junior or senior year), Master’s, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or other STEM major
Experience with Python and/or MATLAB programming
Ability to read and understand existing code base, and improve the existing code and functionality
Good technical communication, documentation and presentation skills
Fast learner and good team player

Experience/Knowledge/Skills that are nice to have:
C++ programming
Familiarity with 3D geometry, algorithms and/or CAD software
Previous software R&D or internship experience

Sound like a good fit?

Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network.

About Align

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials.

By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work.

We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information.

Global Diversity Statement:
At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time.

Hendrick Motorsports, a leading NASCAR Motorsports operation, is currently seeking a highly motivated engineering student for the Competition Systems Group. Raytheon is seeking a rising college senior in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics for a Summer 2021 Internship Position to work a team performing system integration, testing, and deployment of software maintenance releases or system infrastructure for the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS) Common Ground System (CGS). This ground system supports low earth orbiting environmental satellites and provides global coverage, monitors environmental conditions, collects, disseminates and processes data about the Earth's weather, atmosphere, oceans, land and near-space environment.

The successful candidate for this position will possess an interest in space systems and work with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers. In this role, tasks will be composed of about 50% planning/process analysis and support, and 50% hands-on test support in the factory test environment. The CGS is a large, complex, and geographically distributed system. Team members depend on each other’s expertise in different subsystems, so fluid communication, cooperation and cohesion among all team members is a necessity for success. This is a continuous-learning environment where everyone must teach each other and have the confidence and interest to acquire knowledge that may be outside of one’s particular academic background.

This position requires the ability to access systems that contain information restricted to U.S, Citizens based on certain Federal Government contractual requirements.

This position requires access to export-controlled Technical Information, hardware, software, and/or services that is restricted to U.S. Citizens

Support the planning, tracking, and analysis of team tasks/functions
Execute ground control system software test procedures in the factory test environment
Support COTS and hardware integration in the factory test environment

Full Job Description
We are currently accepting applications for Summer 2022 internships, and we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis starting in late Spring 2021!

HRT is seeking exceptional, full-time students across all degree levels to join our Algo summer internship program. Algo developers at HRT focus on research and implementation of automated trading strategies. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to rotate with our high-frequency trading, multi-frequency trading, and/or machine learning teams. In close collaboration with your mentors, you will apply sophisticated quantitative modeling techniques to understand and predict market behavior and write software to improve our trading strategies.

We are looking for quantitatively-driven and practically-minded programmers, scientists, and mathematicians who want to work on the most challenging problems in our field, enjoy collaboration, and hate the idea of climbing corporate ladders.

WHAT TO EXPECT

A fast-paced summer training program to give you an introduction to the quantitative trading industry. You will have the opportunity to get exposure to our high-frequency trading, multi-frequency trading, and/or machine learning teams.
Leverage our proprietary infrastructure (Python/C++) in conjunction with third-party tools to conduct quantitative research and data analysis.
Use machine learning and time series techniques to derive novel insights regarding market behavior from large and complex datasets.
Work on real projects in close collaboration with experienced researchers, traders, and developers.
Use our world class compute cluster to run simulations and crunch data
Build predictive models for financial markets using a combination of market and non-market data.
Participate in seminars that will give you an overview of markets and HRT's trading philosophy.
Enjoy a curriculum of talks, trading games, mentorships, and social events throughout the summer.

REQUIREMENTS

You are a full-time undergraduate, masters, or PhD student in a quantitative discipline (e.g. math, physics, computer science, statistics, or a related program)
You will be graduating and looking for full-time roles in 2023.
Experience programming in Python is a must; C++ is a plus for those interested in high-frequency trading.
You have experience with statistical analysis, numerical programming, or machine learning in Python, R, or MATLAB.
A passion for applying quantitative models and technology toward solving real-world problems.
Strong communication skills.

CULTURE

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we come from all sorts of backgrounds: mathematics, computer science, statistics, physics, and engineering. We're a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automated trading. Our culture celebrates great ideas whether they come from HRT veterans or new hires. At HRT we're friends and colleagues, whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Seem like something you might be interested in? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are, we'd love to get to know you.

Full Job Description

CT Advanced Algorithm Scientist (Intern)

Vernon Hills (Chicago), IL

www.research.us.medical.canon

CANON MEDICAL RESEARCH USA, INC.

is currently hiring for our ADVANCE Internship Program

Canon Medical Research USA, Inc. (CMRU) is proud to announce the launch of our 2021 ADVANCE internship program. Students will contribute at the forefront of innovation in medical imaging working alongside leading scientists and engineers as we develop and deliver the latest technology to our parent company Canon Medical Systems Corporation.

The ADVANCE Program is a structured program with goals and expectations designed to provide students with an opportunity to gain hands-on work experience by participating in significant work projects. Students will take on assignments throughout the term related to CMRU project needs depending on their skills and interests. The goal of these activities is to make important contributions to CMRU programs while at the same time significantly advancing the student’s professional and personal development. The program runs either 12 weeks during the summer term or 26 weeks during the summer and fall terms. This is a full-time, 37.5 hours a week, paid internship.

SUMMARY OF POSITION

CMRU is looking for two qualified interns to join our Computer Tomography (CT) research department where the students will participate in exciting projects using latest technology for medical imaging. Students will be mentored by leading experts in the field to gain hands-on experience to develop and validate products, explore the full potential for various clinical applications and features, and contribute to the next generation of CT systems. It offers a great opportunity to see how your research ideas can come to life and make a difference in countries around the world.

RESPONSIBILITIES

· Develop advanced algorithms to improve current image quality and workflow.

· Design and develop advanced algorithm for next generation products.

· Improve physical corrections in CT reconstruction.

· Work on image quality evaluation with other group members.

· Summarize work in the form of reports and presentations.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education

The ideal candidate is a full-time graduate student at an accredited college or university working towards a M.S. or Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Medical Physics, Physics or related field in STEM.

Experience & Key Competencies

· Strong background in machine learning, image analysis, computer vision, signal processing and image processing.

· Experience in tomographic reconstruction, medical imaging, data correction or other imaging-related fields is preferred.

· Experience in Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning is preferred. Hands on experience in CNN/DCNN network training is a plus.

· Knowledge of CT clinical applications and anatomy is a plus.

· Strong analytical and programming (C/C++/ Python/ MATLAB, etc) skills

Time Commitment

These two positions are full-time, temporary positions that require a commitment of 12 weeks (Term 1: Summer) or 26 weeks (Term 2: Summer and Fall) and 37.5 hours per week, Monday-Friday onsite during regular business hours. The term can be adjusted somewhat to accommodate the academic calendar on an as needed basis.

Requirements

· Students must be working towards a M.S. or Ph.D.

· Student must have taken several related courses in the field in which they will be assigned.

· Students must be at least 18 years of age.

· Students must be eligible to work in the U.S.

· Students are responsible to secure their own housing. CMRU will provide a few housing options located nearby our offices.

Full Job Description
Volvo Cars Technology USA Internship Program 2021

Everything we do starts with people.

Our human-centric focus is what makes us different from all other car companies, and it’s at the heart of everything we create. The path you choose today will have a big impact on the future. As an intern, you’ll be immersed in a global organization that currently employs over 40,000 colleagues around the world. If you want to join us in our mission to make people’s lives less complicated, we offer you a chance to grow with talented people who want to make a true difference.

Department & Position Summary

We are looking for an enthusiastic technology intern to join the BizOps unit of our Commercial Solutions Platform (CSP) team! As a CSP Intern, you will work with our distributed team rolling out Volvo Valet to ensure a premium customer experience. For more information on Volvo Valet, visit this link.

This intern will help empower our National Sales team and retailers by unlocking executional opportunities through data insights. The intern will gain hands-on experience on how to increase operational awareness of Volvo Valet at the retailer level and promoting Volvo Valet’s benefits to the retailer which includes two major product updates around customer web tracking and Volvo On Call integration. The intern will work closely with the National Sales team to ensure retailers are properly educated on Volvo Valet and executing a seamless transparent customer experience.

Major job responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

Perform data analysis to gain operational insights.
Increase product adoption through engagements with the retailer network and educating them on Volvo Valet.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and departments to ensure operational excellence.
Help refine our overall approach with scaling new products in a market to enable further innovation.

We are ideally seeking an individual in pursuit of a Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics or related field with a desire to help inform business strategy.

Are you up for a challenge?

This is a great opportunity to join a career boosting 10-week program designed around your potential. You will have the opportunity to support different tasks and projects which include weekly learning sessions on various areas in the organization, individual career development supported by your manager and other department team members, out-of-the-office activities as well as fun-competitive events supported by the People Experience team.

Do you want to change the world with us?

We are looking for undergraduates who are full of energy, committed to success and eager to make a difference. We’re looking for team members who have the ability to drive results, a strong work ethic, and show initiative. You need to be organized, agile, and curious to discover opportunities in a constantly changing business environment.

As an intern, you are results-oriented and committed to go the extra mile. We believe you are a great networker, and communicator. You are a team-player with a positive attitude, interested in developing yourself, others, and our business.

In order to be considered for this program, you need to be currently enrolled in a related Undergraduate degree program as a rising, Junior, Senior or anticipate graduating within the calendar year. Program is set to begin early June 2021.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Detail oriented
Ability to work autonomously
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office products, especially Excel and Access
Experience in SQL, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) and VBA Automation

Job Description

The Opportunity

Help develop intranet sites that serve the internal communications, transparency, and documentation needs of PNNL’s science and technology (S&T) and Mission Support groups as part of the Communications and Publications Division! As a communications intern, you’ll join a talented, diverse team and work to establish, populate, and socialize SharePoint-driven internal websites (“intranet sites”). You’ll be mentored by communications leaders as you develop site maps, preliminary designs, and content.

What you’ll do:
Learn the value of and collaborate with the specialized teams in the division—S&T Communications, Internal Communications, Creative Services, Content and Quality, and News and Media—and lean on the skills and professional support of others to complete projects as per the standard workflow.

Learn how to use a workflow and job management system.

Learn about the process and importance of setting up a well-functioning SharePoint-driven internal website for PNNL’s groups

Team with leaders in Internal Communications and S&T Communications to develop a project timeline,draft a site map, and write content for various websites as identified by the intranet manager.

Team with Creative Services to deliver mock-up designs and coordinate graphic elements for the intranet sites.

Participate in client showcase meetings to socialize drafts of each site, provide status updates, and collect client feedback from leadership.

Interact, communicate, and problem solve with a diverse team of communicators within the Communications and Publications Division and across PNNL.

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be degree-seeking students enrolled at an accredited college or university. Candidates must be taking at least 6 credit hours and have an overall GPA of 2.5.

Preferred Qualifications

If you’re a junior or senior-level college student with a major in communications, computer science, or a related major that has led to an advanced proficiency in SharePoint and you have great skills in writing and editing, we want to connect with you! Details are below, and you don’t need to meet all requirements to be considered.

Interest in the field of communications

Communications-related college major or area of focus; “Rising Junior,” “Rising Senior,” or 2021 graduate status

Training and advanced aptitude in SharePoint

Strong written and verbal communications skills

Job Description

KIOXIA America Inc. is seeking a highly skilled student intern to join our Business Development Team, where you will learn how a multi-billion dollar organization defines, develops and executes marketing strategies to promote data storage technologies (specifically, solid state drives) to major end markets such as personal computing, data centers, and embedded applications. You will assist with the creation of detailed marketing analyses to scope out key emerging markets for solid state drives, and will have the opportunity to learn how and why the leading technology companies in the world are moving much of their critical data to flash storage. Don’t miss out on this great chance to sharpen your data analytics and presentation skills in a real-world, high-paced environment. Data is considered the new gold – learn how KIOXIA is helping our customers maximize the use of their data sets.

Responsibilities

Assist in developing models to quantify solid state drive business opportunities in several key markets including data center end users (i.e. cloud service providers, content distribution networks, financial institutions, edge computing etc.), industrial applications, and automotive / autonomous driving
Learn how to create marketing presentations and pricing strategies using a combination of data analytics and market intelligence
Learn how to use critical tools/applications to execute deliverables: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint and PowerBI

Qualifications

Pursuing degree from four year university – BA/BS/MS degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics, data analysis, data science, information services, marketing, and/or business/economics is preferable (however other degrees will also be considered)
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint

Req# i-0007; #LI-JV1

Additional Information

KIOXIA America, Inc. (formerly Toshiba Memory America, Inc.) is the US-based subsidiary of KIOXIA Corporation, a leading worldwide supplier of flash memory and solid state drives (SSDs). From the invention of flash memory to today’s breakthrough BiCS FLASH™ 3D technology, KIOXIA continues to pioneer cutting-edge memory solutions and services that enrich people's lives and expand society's horizons. The company's innovative 3D flash memory technology, BiCS FLASH™ is shaping the future of storage in high-density applications, including advanced smartphones, automotive, personal computing devices, enterprise server and storage environments, and major hyperscale cloud providers – all of these end customers are transforming how data is stored, managed, and analyzed by embracing cutting-edge flash storage solutions.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Full Job Description
Volvo Cars Technology USA Internship Program 2021

Everything we do starts with people.

Our human-centric focus is what makes us different from all other car companies, and it’s at the heart of everything we create. The path you choose today will have a big impact on the future. As an intern, you’ll be immersed in a global organization that currently employs over 40,000 colleagues around the world. If you want to join us in our mission to make people’s lives less complicated, we offer you a chance to grow with talented people who want to make a true difference.

Department & Position Summary

We are looking for a technology intern to join our newly created Volvo AI Research Internship Program. As our AI Research Intern , you will work alongside our AD/AI Team on identified challenges that warrant deep domain expertise and early technology development. While the Volvo AI Research Internship Program is hosted at our Silicon Valley office, you will also be co-supervised by colleagues at Volvo Cars Sweden. This program is solely designed for PhD-level applicants, and will aim for top-tier publication.

This AI Research Intern position will be focused on evaluating the use of distance sensors (e.g. radar, ultrasonic etc) for near-field sensing. This includes setting up experiments for comparing sensor performance metrics, as well as develop and evaluate software for handling sensor outputs.

In this position, you will gain hands-on experience on how near-field sensing is configured on Volvo vehicles and you will lay the groundwork for evaluating whether to drastically transform it.

We are seeking PhD students in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or related fields. Desired skillsets include, but are not limited to the following:

Signal processing
Data analysis
Software development

Are you up for a challenge?

This is a great opportunity to join a career boosting 12-15 week program designed around your potential. You will have the opportunity to connect with colleagues in both US and Sweden, join weekly learning sessions on various areas in the organization, individual career development supported by your manager and other department team members, out-of-the-office activities as well as events supported by the People Experience team.

Do you want to change the world with us?

You should apply to this position if you are passionate about solving difficult problems applied to the automotive industry. We are looking for team members who have the ability to drive results, has strong work ethic, and shows initiative. As an AI Research Intern, you are a hands-on problem solver, you need to be organized and able to document your progress for publication-level writing.

In order to be considered for this program, you need to be currently enrolled in a related PhD degree program. This year’s Volvo AI Research Internship Program is set to begin early June 2021.

Full Job Description
Organization
U.S. Department of Defense (DOD)
Reference Code
USAMRMC-RIEM-2021-0018
How to Apply

Description

The US Army Research Institute of Environmental Medicine (USARIEM), Health Readiness and Performance System (HRAPS) is offering two bachelors level summer learning opportunities at the Natick, Massachusetts facility.

What will I be doing?

You will join a community of scientists and researchers in an effort to develop sensors and algorithms that can prevent Soldier illness/injury and also use those sensors to optimize Soldier performance. As part of the HRAPS program we are developing a heat injury illness algorithm and algorithms to pace Soldiers as they complete a known training exercise such as a 12 mile ruck march. To improve and validate the heat injury prevention algorithm we are automating our data analysis pipeline. For the validation of the pacing algorithm we are developing a real-time feedback smart phone App that can automatically pace Soldiers or study volunteers.

Why should I apply?

Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience to complement your education and support your academic and professional goals. As part of this learning experience you will have an opportunity to learn the end-to-end data collection process of a large field research study, including how to collect data in the field with military personnel. This learning experience will also provide you with an opportunity to learn industry standards for data processing, cleaning, and analysis. You will learn advanced machine learning approaches to identifying and classifying exertional heat injuries, and how to translate advanced Artificial Intelligent algorithms to an Android Smart phone platform. By the end of this experience you will gained the knowledge and understanding of industry standards in writing code for a smart phone, ergonomic design aspects such as information flow and human computer interaction principles.

Where will I be located?

Natick, Massachusetts (Some travel to US Army and Marine bases for data collection may be required.

What is the anticipated start date?

The USARIEM is ready to make appointments effective May 31, 2021. Exact start dates will be determined at the time of selection and in coordination with the selected candidate. Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis and internships will be filled as qualified candidates are identified.

Appointment Length

An ORISE appointment period can be a short-term (less than 2 weeks), summer (10-12 weeks), or year-long appointment. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by Department of Defense (DoD). Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location. Other benefits may include the following:

Health Insurance Supplement. Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE.
Relocation Allowance
Training and Travel Allowance

Nature of Appointment

The participant will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DOD, or any other office or agency. Instead, the participant will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment.

About USARIEM

The US Army Research Institute of Environmental Medicine (USARIEM) is an internationally recognized center of excellence for Warfighter health and performance science located in Natick, Massachusetts. USARIEM functions as a world-class laboratory for research related to environmental medicine, biophysics and biomedical modeling, military performance, thermal physiology, physiology, and nutrition.

For more information about the USARIEM, please visit https://www.usariem.army.mil/.

Qualifications

Participants should be working towards a Bachelors in a biomedical or computational science field (such as biomedical engineering, or computer science). Participants should have familiarity with advanced coding languages such as C# and Java, and have demonstrated this in developing their own programs. Participants should have experience programming within statistical software programs (such as Matlab or equivalent). Participants should have a general knowledge of basic statistics, i.e., how to use descriptive and analytical statistics such as a t-test.

A complete application consists of:
Zintellect Profile
Educational and Employment History
Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
Resume (PDF)
Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.
One Recommendation

Submitted documents must have all social security numbers, student identification numbers, and/or dates of birth removed (blanked out, blackened out, made illegible, etc.) prior to uploading into the application system. All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.

If you have questions, send an email to to ARMY-MRMC@orise.orau.gov. Please list the reference code of this opportunity USAMRMC-RIEM-2021-0018 in the subject line of the email.

Connect with ORISE...on the GO! Download the new ORISE GO mobile app in the Apple App Store or Google Play Store to help you stay engaged, connected, and informed during your ORISE experience and beyond!

Eligibility Requirements
Citizenship: U.S. Citizen Only
Degree: Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree.

Discipline(s):
Computer, Information, and Data Sciences
Engineering
Life Health and Medical Sciences
Age: Must be 18 years of age

BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. Full Job Description
Job Title: GIS Analyst Intern

FLSA Status: Nonexempt

GENERAL DESCRIPTION / PURPOSE:
An internship position in the area of GIS analyst in a challenging engineering environment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Functional & Technical Skills

Support an ongoing project to bring all Enterprise-wide data into a central spatial database managed by GIS group
GIS data creation and editing
Produce visually appealing maps and dashboards using geospatial data
Design and configure GIS dashboards in Portal for ArcGIS Enterprise
Perform other GIS support duties as needed

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactory. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

1-2 years of experience in the Esri suite of GIS software: ArcGIS Pro, ArcMap, ArcGIS Field Apps, ArcGIS Online, Portal for ArcGIS
Completed courses in Python, SQL, and JavaScript
Strong mathematical and/or statistics skills
Multi-tasker
Able to work independently and as part of a team
Motivated and committed to learning

Education and/or Experience: The individual must be pursuing a BS degree in Geography/GIS, Computer Science, Software Development, Statistics, Data Analyst, or related field and shall have achieved junior status or higher. The individual shall also have completed the “core” coursework for his/her chosen discipline.

Computer Skills: Solid computer skills consistent with the position requirements to include Microsoft Windows Office Suite.

Language Skills: The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing. The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.

Mathematical Skills: Knowledge of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, statistics, and their applications. The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem in regression analysis, measures of central tendency and comparative labor statistics.

Reasoning Ability: Ability to correctly make decisions involving issues/problems including when to escalate the problem to a more senior consultant.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit or kneel; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee may frequently work near moving mechanical parts, in outside weather conditions and is frequently exposed to vibration. The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles and risk of electrical shock.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

description:
Full Job Description
FHLB Dallas actively pursues dedicated and hardworking individuals to be a part of our professional team. Positions are offered on an as-needed basis for all departments. View our current opportunities by clicking the View Open Positions tab above.

Federal Home Loan Bank of Dallas is seeking an Undergraduate Junior or Senior to participate in a 2 month paid Summer Internship Program working within our Internal Audit Department. As part of this internship, you will gain knowledge of internal audit operations by working closely with FHLB Dallas’ Internal Audit staff. This role will perform professional auditing work of moderate difficulty and complexity and provide assistance to other professional auditors.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop an understanding of the FHLB Dallas audit approach, methodology and tools.
Under the direction of department management, participate in audits of financial, compliance, operational, and Information Technology (IT) areas to determine if operating units are in compliance with Bank policies and procedures, applicable laws and regulations and GAAP.
Assist in performance of tests of internal controls related to internal audits and SOX testing.
Prepares audit work papers which document audit procedures performed and results of testing, in accordance with departmental guidelines.
Assist in preparing written audit recommendations and audit reports that will be presented to the auditee.
Establish working relationships with client personnel.
Apply concepts of risk assessment

INTERNSHIP REQUIREMENTS:
Active and enrolled student in an accredited college or university
Pursuing a degree in accounting, finance or related field
Classified as a junior or senior
Overall GPA of 3.25 or better
Completed coursework must include: one intermediate financial accounting course, one audit related course, and one computer science course.
Proficient in MS Office (emphasis on Excel and Word)
Working knowledge of audit software (such as ACL) is a plus
Demonstrates high degree of integrity and possesses the ability to complete challenging assignments with a high level of confidentiality
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

General Information: The FHLB Internship Program is a paid opportunity that will run between May 24 - August 13, 2021. Interns must be able to commit 40 hours a week and have reliable transportation. Housing will be provided to individuals who may need it.

Eligibility: Students must be enrolled and active as a classified Junior or Senior at an accredited 4 year college or university. Students should be pursuing a degree in accounting, finance, or related field is required with a GPA of 3.25 or better.

Application Process: An Applicant should submit a resume, references, and transcript. An unofficial transcript is acceptable for purposes of this position, and must be emailed with the application. Please list the current school you have attended, along with current GPA if available at the time of submission. Please include past coursework or degrees from other universities/colleges you have attended along with the dates attended.

FHLB Dallas Offers a Professional, Inclusive Culture

FHL Bank Dallas employees are committed to and exemplify the following principles:

Service to our members is first and foremost
All business will be conducted honestly and ethically
Each employee contributes to customer service by directly serving our members or supporting those who do
Interaction with members should focus on building professional relationships and helping customers achieve their goals
Cooperation and teamwork throughout and across all levels of FHLB Dallas are essential to its effectiveness
Colleagues and members will be treated with the utmost respect and dignity

FHLB Dallas provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, marital status, ancestry, veteran status, disability, or national origin. FHLB Dallas will consider for employment all persons on an individual basis consistent with job-related criteria without regard to visible and non-visible disabilities. Equal opportunity applies to all employment practices, including recruitment, screening, hiring, compensation and training, as well as other conditions and privileges of employment.

description:
Full Job Description
Position Summary:
We are looking for an intern who will work in UTHealth’s office of the Senior Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer. You will work with the entire staff in this organization in tandem with the COO and his direct reports. This role will ask the employee to focus on the business, management, financial, operational and analytic aspects of health care. You will participate in projects that may impact physician practice, higher educational funding of health professional education, health economics, decision analysis, health services research, public health and legislative processes, survey research, outcomes research, quantitative methods, evaluation research, health administration, and ethical and legal aspects of health care. This role is designed specifically for someone who is working on a graduate degree with UTHealth’s School of Public Health, and has an interest in finance of a large health organization.

This role is an internship, but will be compensated hourly by UTHealth. It is not eligible for benefits, and should only be expected to last for up to four or five months. The employee will work during normal business hours with some flexibility given for academic pursuits and demands. The work location will be in our University Center Tower in the heart of the Texas Medical Center.

Position Key Accountabilities:
Prepare and edit draft reports and communications for executive leadership.
Extract and review statistical data in support of assigned projects.

Certification/Skills:
Candidate should be a current or a graduated student with UTHealth School of Public Health, or equivalent.
Must have studied Management, Policy and Community Health Program, or similar/equivalent
Must be or recently been a student with accredited Master’s of Business Administration program, particularly with a health care concentration.
Possess excellent writing, analytical and organizational skills and abilities.
Excellent spreadsheet and database management computer skills a plus.
Undergraduate degree in finance, accounting, information technology, data analytics, public health or economics a plus.

Thank you for considering a summer internship position a Tech For Good Inc. We are a nonprofit dedicated to making the world a better place though technology. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our team as an intern!

This is an educational, unpaid internship opportunity where you will improve interpersonal and programming skills while developing web, mobile, and machine learning software solutions for various projects our company is currently working on.

Some examples of our past projects are our lifesaving weapons detection system, community based ride-sharing application, and cloud optimization platform. Our projects are tailored to our employees/'interns' needs and preferred learning experiences.

  • Designing, developing, and installing testable, scalable software solutions.

  • Preparing and installing solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.
  • Improving operations by conducting systems analysis and recommending changes in policies and procedures.

  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Strong teamwork and leadership skills.
  • Familiarity in at least one of the following programming languages: Java, Python, C++, C#, C, Kotlin, Go, JavaScript, and related technologies.

All work done at Tech For Good Inc is considered charitable work that is only meant for the good of the world. We hope that you will join us this summer and help us change the world with technology!

You can reach us at ‪+1 (857) 706-4629‬ if you have any questions or concerns.

(Note: This is due to U.S. export regulations, and we are unable to make exceptions.)

Four billion people do not have access to the internet. Astranis is going to change that. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost telecommunications satellites to bring the world online.

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021.

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

The Role

Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet

We are at a transformational moment in our company journey - and we’re so excited about it. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture, and to accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our purpose is to help customers improve business performance with Dun & Bradstreet’s Data Cloud and Live Business Identity, and we’re wildly passionate and committed to this purpose. So, if you’re looking to make an immediate impact at a company that welcomes bold and diverse thinking, come join us!

We have exciting opportunities available for Summer 2021 virtual internships at Dun & Bradstreet! We are seeking self-motivated individuals that are passionate and curious about technology. Interns will gain valuable insight into a technology driven business.

Software Engineer Intern: As an intern, you will help to code, test, and create features for the next generation of D&B user interfaces, applications, and mobile app suites. You will learn from senior engineers and work on team of experienced software professionals. You will gain experience and mentorship in the software engineering profession.

Full Job Description
Intelligence Analyst Interns evaluate and analyze information from classified and unclassified sources and provide assessments to the President, National Security Council, and other U.S. policymakers.

Internship/Co-op
Starting salary: $46,300 - $48,946 ($22.26 - $23.53 per hour)
Full-time student pursuing an undergraduate degree

About the Job

As an Intelligence Analyst Intern for CIA, you will work on teams alongside our full-time analysts, studying and evaluating information from all available sources—classified and unclassified—and then analyzing it to provide timely and objective assessments to customers such as the President, National Security Council, and other U.S. policymakers.

Liberal arts majors research, analyze, write, and brief on international political, military, economic, and leadership developments.

Engineering, science students, or those in other technical programs analyze and provide written and oral assessments on challenging national security issues—including foreign weapons development, weapons proliferation, cyber warfare, and emerging technologies—and apply their scientific and technical knowledge to solve complex intelligence problems.

In addition to your analytic responsibilities, you will become familiar with the Agency and Intelligence Community by participating in a range of meetings and projects. The Undergraduate Internship/Co-op Program allows you and the Agency to assess opportunities to serve as a graduate fellow, if schooling continues, or permanent employment following your completion of undergraduate school.

Who You’ll Work With

At the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), we recognize our Nation’s strength comes from the diversity of its people. People from a broad range of backgrounds and viewpoints work at CIA, and our diverse teams are the reason we can keep our country safe.

Read more about diversity and inclusion

What You’ll Get

The CIA offers various benefits to students, including:
Paid time off
Federal health and life insurance
Retirement
Education and training
Health services
Child care center
Credit union

As a CIA employee, you’ll also get the satisfaction of knowing your work is part of something bigger than yourself. Our work is driven by one mission: to keep our Nation safe. Every day is an opportunity to enhance U.S. national security.

Learn more about working at CIA

Minimum Qualifications
Full-time student pursuing an undergraduate degree from a variety of majors, including:
Area Studies
Computer Science
Cybersecurity
Economics
Engineering
International Affairs
Physical Sciences
At least a 3.0 GPA on a 4-point scale
Attending school on a full-time basis before/following this internship
Availability to work at least one 90-day tour prior to graduation with the possibility to do additional tours depending on availability
Ability to meet the minimum requirements for joining CIA, including U.S. citizenship and a background investigation
What You’ll Need to Apply
Resume
Unofficial transcripts for all degrees
A cover letter in which you specify your qualifications for one or more positions. Please address why you want to work in this role and what differentiates you from other applicants.
Two (2) different writing samples, three to five pages (3-5) each, single-spaced PDF. Submit papers that showcase your writing style, research abilities and critical thinking skills. Subject matter should focus on your current areas of expertise that relate to your interest in positions at the CIA. You can excerpt longer papers.

Who's Clearcover?

Clearcover is the smarter car insurance company. We use powerful technology to offer everyday drivers better coverage for less money. We're proud to be one of the fastest-growing startups in Chicago, and we're currently looking to add an extraordinary remote intern to our Engineering team.

What is an Engineering Intern?

As a Software Engineering Intern at Clearcover, you will be embedded into the product and technology organization in the same way full time employees are. You will be included in a scrum team and paired with a mentor as well as an Engineering Manager. You will learn to understand Clearcover products, technologies and domains, work on active tickets to support sprint goals and contribute to product features all with the support and guidance of your mentor. You are encouraged to become familiar with other parts of the organization wherein you could have an impact, be that the diversity and inclusion committee, Clearly Covered engineering talks, etc. We are looking for interns that are just starting their careers and are eager to learn and get more exposure to not only our products but the tools and technologies we use to build them.

Gain experience owning features from start to finish while collaborating with your scrum team to creatively solve problems and ensure excellent outcome
Be assigned a mentor for the duration of the internship who will be your guide to understanding the team, project and all things Clearcover.
Gain knowledge of software engineering concepts related to the implementation and deployment of distributed microservices
Work on projects that impact the business
Learn coding best practices and how to troubleshoot and debug issues

What do you need?

Currently enrolled in a BS program in computer science, computer/software engineering, or related field
A recent bootcamp graduate or self-taught with example projects in Github
Experience with at least one programming language included in our stack: Javascript, Typescript, Ruby, Kotlin
Familiarity with RESTful API conventions
A passion for solving complex technical problems
Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced technical environment
